Title: ‘Maharashtra has withdrawn 348 Koregaon cases’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

State home minister Anil Deshmukh said that the Maha Vikas Aghadi government had withdrawn 348 cases. (File Ph... Read More

MUMBAI: State home minister Anil Deshmukh said on Thursday that the Maha Vikas Aghadi government had withdrawn 348 cases out of a total of 649 filed in connection with the Koregaon Bhima violence. The other cases were in the process (of being withdrawn), he said, clarifying that only those cases which involved attacks on the police and damage to property would not be withdrawn.

The government has also promised to withdraw cases filed in connection with various protests such as the Maratha reservation agitation, opposition to the Nanar oil refinery project, farmers’ stir and the Dhangar reservation agitation.

Deshmukh said this in the legislative council during his reply to questions raised by members of the Congress and NCP and some independents about the Elgar Parishad and Koregaon Bhima cases. He reiterated that though the state government has the right to probe the Koregaon Bhima violence and the Elgar cases, it will examine whether there is a provision in the Maharashtra Police Act which would allow it to initiate a parallel inquiry into the Elgar case in order to check if people have been falsely framed. Deshmukh specified that the state has the right to conduct an inquiry if investigation has been carried out in the wrong manner.

The minister said that the home department has received many memorandums on the matter, pointing out that the FIR in the Elgar case has been registered against the “wrong people” and against “those who did not follow the ideology of the erstwhile (BJP) government.”

Sharad Ranpise, a Congress MLC, pointed out that people had been falsely framed by the investigating agency. Kapil Patil, an independent MLC, urged the government to withdraw cases registered against a few people like Anand Teltumbde . “Will the state government initiate a parallel inquiry into the Elgar Parishad case to reveal the truth and provide security to these people who were framed by terming them as ‘Urban Naxals’?” Patil asked.

Deshmukh said the state has the right to probe both cases if the investigation had proceeded in the wrong direction and added the state would check if it could initiate a “parallel probe.”

Title: Bihar now passes resolution seeking caste-based Census
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

File photo used for representation.

PATNA: The Bihar assembly on Thursday unanimously passed a resolution demanding a caste-based census in 2021.

The move comes just two days after the 243-member House unanimously passed a resolution stating that National Register of Citizens (NRC) is “not needed in Bihar” while also emphasizing that the state would stick to the 2010 proforma for National Population Register (NPR) and add only a new column for transgenders.

Bihar is the second assembly in the country seeking a caste-based census in 2021. On January 8, the Maharashtra assembly had passed a similar resolution.

The twin resolutions on NRC-NPR and caste-based census are being seen in political circles as part of a strategy by Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar to ensure that his party, the JD(U), plays a dominant role in the assembly elections later this year vis-à-vis its ally, the BJP. Nitish has been emphasizing the need for a caste-based census arguing that it is required to increase the percentage of SC/ST and OBC quotas which is currently capped at 50% as per a Supreme Court verdict.

Cutting across party lines, legislators thumped their desks and welcomed the resolution for caste-based census, which was moved by speaker Vijay Kumar Choudhary himself. “The last time the country had a caste-based census was in 1931. Several decades have since passed and it has now become necessary to hold a similar census again,” Nitish said in the House.

Nitish said both the assembly and the legislative council had in 2013 passed a resolution on the need for a caste-based census. He added that in the last census, the socio-economic survey and caste enumeration were done in 2011 for a “limited purpose” and were found to be “flawed”.

The issue of a caste-based population enumeration attracted a lot of attention in the 2015 assembly polls when the alliance of JD(U), RJD and Congress defeated NDA.

While BJP supported Thursday’s resolution – just like it had backed the NRC-NPR resolution two days ago – the party’s minister, Nand Kishore Yadav, told mediapersons that there was “nothing new” in the resolution. “Earlier too, the House had passed a similar resolution,” he said. Though BJP had backed the resolution, its MLC Sachchidanand Rai said such a move can divide the society further.

On expected lines, RJD welcomed the resolution. “It’s a historical fact that the social and spatial demarcation within India exists even today. SCs/STs/OBCs have been deprived socially and economically for ages,” leader of the opposition in the assembly, Tejashwi Yadav, tweeted hours after the House adopted the resolution. “Caste-based census will provide a radical ground at the policy level for greater social and economic reforms,” he added.

Title: Jaish case accused gets bail as NIA fails to file chargesheet
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

File image used for representation

NEW DELHI/SRINAGAR: One of the accused in the Jaish-e-Muhammed (JeM) conspiracy case, Yusuf Chopan , has been granted bail by a special court on the grounds that the National Investigation Agency (NIA) did not file a chargesheet within the stipulated period. He has, however, been rearrested under the Public Safety Act and sent to a Jammu prison .

Though some media reports suggested that Chopan was granted bail in the Pulwama attack case , the NIA dismissed these and said a “breakthrough” in the Pulwama case was expected soon.

The NIA released a clarification pointing out that he was never arrested in the Pulwama case. “He, along with six others, was arrested in the JeM conspiracy case where two chargesheets were filed against eight accused,” the NIA said. It also released the names of the accused persons — Sajad Ahmad Khan, Tanveer Ahmed Gani, Bilal Ahmed Mir, Muzaffar Ahmed Bhat, Ishfaq Ahmed Bhat, Mehrajuddin Chopan, Mudassir Ahmed Khan and Kari Mufti Yaseer.

Mudassir and Yaseer were killed in encounters, the NIA said, adding, “Yusuf Chopan was not chargesheeted due to inadequate evidence.”

“As such, he has been granted default bail by the special NIA court in New Delhi on 18.02.2020 and he has been sent back to Kot Bhalwal Jail, Jammu, under the Public Safety Act by order of the DM, Pulwama,” the NIA statement reads.

The NIA highlighted that significant leads have emerged during investigations in the Pulwama attack case and a “breakthrough” was expected shortly.

Special NIA judge Praveen Singh granted the reprieve to Yusuf Chopan on February 18, observing that he was entitled to statutory bail. “I find that the investigating agency has failed to file a chargesheet within the statutory period. The accused is entitled to statutory bail. The accused is accordingly admitted to bail subject to furnishing a personal bond in the sum of Rs 50,000 with one surety in the like amount,” the court held.

Chopan’s counsel submitted that his client had been in custody for about 180 days and the time for filing a chargesheet had elapsed. Statutory bail was, therefore, sought.

The NIA submitted that 180 days — the period for investigation in respect of the accused — was completed on February 11, 2020. Owing to insufficient evidence, the chargesheet could not be filed, it added. The NIA, however, said the investigation would continue under relevant provisions of law.

The case pertains to an alleged criminal conspiracy to strengthen the base of the proscribed JeM in India, raising funds for terrorist acts, conspiring to carry out terrorist acts, organising terrorists acts, organising terrorist camps and recruiting persons to carry out terrorist acts as well as harbouring JeM cadres and becoming members of the outfit.

Title: FACT CHECK: Ankit Sharma’s brother denies saying his brother was killed by those chanting ‘Jai Shri Ram’
Content:
What WSJ claims

What Ankur told Times Fact Check

UPDATE:

Leading US news website Wall Street Journal (WSJ) quoted Ankur Sharma , brother of murdered IB officer Ankit Sharma , as saying that Ankit was killed by people chanting ‘ Jai Shri Ram ’ slogans.In an article titled ‘India’s Ruling Party, Government Slammed Over Delhi Violence’, WSJ claims to have spoken to Ankur.As per WSJ, Ankit was returning home, a group of rioters started throwing stones and charged into the street his house is located in.“They came armed with stones, rods, knives and even swords; they shouted 'Jai Shri Ram' [Glory to Lord Ram]; some even wore helmets," WSJ quotes Ankur as saying in a telephonic interview. "They started throwing stones, bricks at residents, who rushed to Ankit to help them....Later, his body was found in a ditch."Here’s the screengrab of this paragraph from the report that quotes Ankur. The report can only be viewed by WSJ subscribers.Times Fact Check got in touch with Ankur Sharma.In a telephonic conversation with Times Fact Check, Ankur denied giving any such quote to WSJ. He said, "They’re lying. I've always said that my brother was attacked by Aam Aadmi Party Councillor (from Nehru Vihar) Tahir Hussain 's men. They attacked Ankit and dragged him inside Hussain’s house."Earlier, speaking to Hindustan Times (HT), Ankur accused Hussain of plotting Ankit’s death at the hands of a mob. “The mob that snatched and killed my brother was operating from Hussain’s house. A mob was pelting stones from the terrace of that building,” Sharma’s brother, Ankur told HT.Times Fact Check doesn’t have access to the telephonic conversation WSJ claims it had with Ankur. We have reached out to WSJ regarding the report in question, we will update this report if and when they respond.Times Fact Check is just placing the facts as they are and is refraining from passing any judgement.In a new report titled 'India begins probe of clashes that left 38 dead' , WSJ said, "On Thursday, Mr Sharma's brother repeated the story but said he and his family believed Mr Sharma was killed by supporters of a local municipal politician, Tahir Hussain, who is Muslim and a member of the Aam Aadmi Party, the local political party that controls the government of Delhi. He offered no evidence for the claim. Police said the father had filed a complaint alleging Mr. Hussain was involved in the killing."

Title: Para-athletes to hit the rainbow ramp in Kolkata
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

KOLKATA: A queer-disability fashion show is set to be held in Kolkata, featuring models beyond gender, ability and age stereotypes, at a sports bar in Sector V, which has a safe space for the LGBTIQ community. The Civilian Welfare Foundation will organize ‘Rainbow Sunday’, where queer models and para-athletes will share the ramp.

Saheb Hussain, a model and a national record holder in blind 100m race, is thrilled to be part of the show. “I never imagined I would walk on a ramp with models with alternative sexualities. This is something that will dispel homophobia,” Hussain said.

Atar Ali, a make-up artist and the fastest 400m disabled runner in Bengal , will help the participants look glamorous. “Sports is my passion and make up is my profession. I will be able to do both,” Ali added.

Wheelchair-basketball player Pritam feels his beloved Kolkata is not inclusive when it comes to para-athletes. “Para-athletes and people from the LGBTQI community are often looked down upon here. I hope this initiative will change the outlook,” Pritam said.

Fashion designer Debarati Guha has special outfits in mind for each participant. For Ronia, who is disabled, she has selected a pastel pink sari paired with a turban. Kolaj will be sporting a sari, while Ujjal, a para-cyclist, will go topless with a Dhakai draped as his lower garment along with ghungru on his feet. “This is an important show for me. Not only will it break barriers, but my collection will be donned by these special personalities,” Guha said.

City-based band, The ASP Project, has volunteered to perform at the event.

Title: SAT allows lenders to sell Reliance General Insurance
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: In a victory for Reliance Home Finance’s lenders Nippon India Mutual Fund and Credit Suisse , the Securities Appellate Tribunal ( SAT ) has upheld their right to sell shares of Reliance General Insurance following invocation of a pledge. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority ( Irdai ) had earlier declared the pledge enforcement as invalid since the regulator’s nod was not sought and the transfer violated foreign investment norms.

The tribunal, however, said after identifying a buyer for Reliance General Insurance, the proposed owner will have to be certified fit and proper by Irdai, which will carry out a due diligence and ascertain the prospective buyer’s financial soundness.

Nippon India MF and Credit Suisse are likely to invite bids for Reliance General Insurance, whose shares are held by IDBI Trusteeship. Current foreign direct investment norms prohibit non-residents from owning more than 49% in an insurer.

Nippon India and Credit Suisse argued before SAT that they enforced the pledge in accordance with the share pledge agreement to safeguard their interest and not to take control of the company. Nippon India also submitted that, in any case, it cannot control or manage any other business apart from mutual fund according to Sebi norms.

Nippon India was represented by counsel Pradeep Sancheti and Sumit Agrawal of RegStreet Law Advisors, while Credit Suisse was represented by counsel Janak Dwarkadas and law firm Juris Corp. The case dates back to March 2018, when Reliance Home Finance issued bonds worth Rs 400 crore and Rs 1,200 crore to Nippon India and Credit Suisse respectively. After Reliance Home Finance defaulted on its debt obligations, the two invoked the pledge (of Reliance General shares) made by Reliance Home Finance’s promoter, Reliance Capital.

In November, the Delhi high court had prevented Reliance Capital from selling any of its assets. Another debenture trustee Vistra ITCL sought to intervene in SAT, claiming it held a prior charge on Reliance General shares. It was, however, told to approach an appropriate forum for its case.

Title: Kolkata cops involve community leaders and locals to keep peace
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Officers conduct a route march in Entally

KOLKATA: In the aftermath of the violence in Delhi, Kolkata Police has started forming volunteer groups with members of different religious communities and tasking them with spreading the message of peace and harmony in their neighbourhoods. They have also been advised to inform cops about any outsider movement or informal meetings in their locali-ties that may provoke religious sentiments.

Over the past two days, officers of multiple police stations across Kolkata have organized route marches, beat meetings and door-to-door visits to several pockets to ensure peace and harmony are maintained. They are also keeping a close watch on every gathering in neighbourhoods to ensure no clash-provoking comments are made in public.

“We are focussing on the neighbourhoods with a mixed population of Hindu and Muslim communities and those areas that have a history of communal riots in the city. We are hand-picking volunteers and have asked them to spread the message of love and harmony among themselves and also report to the local police station about any incident of mass provocation at local tea shops, outside temples, mosques and even in areas of social gathering, like parks,” said a senior officer of Kolkata Police.

The state police top brass has also issued an advisory to all police stations to step up vigil in their areas to prevent rumour-mongering and hold peace meetings to ensure that the law-and-order situation doesn’t worsen. Acting on the directive, officers have started holding route marches, peace meetings and intensified night vigil in sensitive neighbourhoods, like Entally, Beniapukur, Cossipore, Kidderpore , Tollygunge and Charu Market.

“For the past two days, we have been constantly holding interactive sessions with imams and the general public. We have also been to every household in some of the sensitive neighbourhoods in our respective jurisdictions to ensure peace is maintained. We have identified some of the trouble-prone areas and set up CCTV cameras so that the people know they are being watched and can be thwarted from creating a ruckus,” said a senior officer of central division.

Cops said they have earmarked some areas, like Chhatubabu, Bibibagan, Motijhil, Matipara and Pilkhana, where there were riots in 1992 and other occasions in the past. “Round-the-clock police posting and multiple route marches have been initiated in these areas to keep the situation under control,” said the officer.

“We have been conducting beat meetings with people in our neighbourhood for the past two days. The meetings have been fruitful so far. We have explained to them the current situation in the country and have sought their help to prevent any law-and-order deterioration here,” said an officer of the south-east division of Kolkata Police.

Bidhannagar City Police commissioner Laxmi Narayan Meena said he, too, has instructed officers of all police stations in Bidhannagar to be alert and conduct peace meetings in their respective areas to prevent any unforeseen event. “We have asked officers of all ranks to stay alert and act according to the situation. So far, the situation has been under control,” he said.

Title: BS-VI fuel supply from April 1: IOCL
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

PATNA: All the 1,597 retail outlets of the Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) across the state will begin supplying Bharat Stage-VI (BS-VI) grade fuels from April 1.

Addressing mediapersons here on Thursday, IOCL Bihar head and executive director Vibhash Kumar said, “The new version will be launched across the country on April 1. Bihar will also be part of the shift from BS-IV to BS-VI grade fuels.”

On October 24 last year, the Supreme Court had ruled that no BS-IV vehicle would be sold across the country from April 1, 2020. Accordingly, the state government imposed a ban on the use of BS-IV vehicles after March 31.

Talking about the merits of conversion, Vibhash said, “The sulphur content will be reduced from the present 50 parts per million (PPM) in BS-IV grade fuels to 10 PPM in BS-VI. This will mitigate the problem of pollution and improve the air quality to a large extent.”

He added, “Besides, the gap between emission limits for petrol and diesel cars will narrow down substantially.”

Vibhash pointed out that the planned expenditure for transition to BS-VI was around Rs 17,000 crore, including a Rs 1,772 crore expenditure on the Barauni refinery.

Deliberating on IOCL’s plan in Bihar, Vibhash said, “To meet the demand of petrol and diesel, we are upgrading the capacity of Barauni refinery from 6 million metric tonne to 9 million metric tonne by utilising funds to the tune of Rs 1,400 crore. The deadline of the project is June, 2024. Work is also underway on several other projects of the IOCL in Bihar, which entail an estimated outlay of Rs 22,000 crore.”

He also stressed on building sustainable energy infrastructure that could cater to the energy needs of all people.

CGM (operations) R K Singh, general manager (retail sales of Bihar state office) Ajay Garg and chief manager (planning and coordination) Veena Kumari were also present on the occasion.

Title: Jawan attempts suicide after killing wife, held
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: A 30-year-old jawan in the Indian Army strangled his wife at his residence in Indrapastha Nagari, in the Mhasrul area of the city, on Wednesday night.

Jawan Sunil Bava was arrested and produced before a local court on Thursday, which remanded him in police custody for two days.

Pandharinath Dhokane, the senior inspector at the Mhasrul police station, said after killing his wife Chaitali, Bawa slit his wrist with a blade purportedly to end his own life. “The injury was not serious. He was arrested soon after he was released from the hospital,” said Dhokane.

Preliminary investigation has revealed that the couple did not share a healthy relationship since they got married two years ago. They also have a two-and-a-half years-old daughter.

Bawa was posted in Jammu and Kashmir and had come home on a 10-day leave.

Police officers said that before killing his wife, the jawan had called up his cousin, who stays in Kalyan, to vent his frustration about his wife.

“His cousin got suspicious and immediately called up Chaitali’s father, who stays in Nashik. Her father rushed to the couple’s residence and found her lying on the bed. Bawa was bleeding profusely from the wrist,” said police.

The victim’s father immediately contacted the local police, who deployed a team tp Bawa’s residence. Chaitali’s body has been sent for post-mortem.

Title: Pidilite to buy 70% of Italian co Tenax’s Indian arm
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Mumbai: Fevicol maker Pidilite Industries has entered into an agreement with Tenax of Italy to acquire 70% in its Indian subsidiary Tenax India Stone Products. The acquisition is being made for a cash consideration of around Rs 80 crore. The move would help the homegrown sealants and adhesives player expand its presence in the market.

Tenax India was set up in 2005 as a subsidiary of Tenax Italy, a manufacturer of adhesives, coating, surface treatment chemicals and abrasives of marble, granite and stone. It is engaged in the sales and distribution of Tenax Italy products in the Indian retail market.

After the acquisition, Tenax India will become a subsidiary of Pidilite, enabling Tenax India to leverage the sales, distribution and marketing capability of Pidilite in India and Saarc markets. However, Tenax Italy will continue to be a partner with a 30% stake in the Indian arm.

Pidilite Industries MD Bharat Puri said, “This acquisition will help expand Pidilite’s presence in the fast-growing adhesives, coatings and surface treatment chemicals market for the marble and stone Industry and bring world-class technology to India by investing in a manufacturing plant.”

Title: Sensex down 1.4k pts in 5 days
Content: Mumbai: Equities closed in the red for the fifth straight session with the sensex ending 143 points down at 39,746 on Thursday. The BSE benchmark has dipped 1,424 points in five successive sessions as global sentiments remained weak with more cases of coronavirus being reported outside China.The sensex fell to an intraday low of 39,423 but recovered on strong buying by domestic mutual funds and insurance companies. Similarly, the broader NSE Nifty fell 45 points or 0.4% to end at 11,633.Foreign institutional investors were net sellers, offloading stocks worth Rs 3,127 crore, while domestic institutions more than made up for their foreign counterparts by net purchases worth Rs 3,497 crore.Analysts expect the government to report growth numbers of 4.7% for the third quarter. The five-day successive decline is the longest string of losses in five months. A gauge of volatility on the Nifty is at its highest level since May 23, 2019.In South Korea, where 334 new cases of the virus were reported, the Kospi dropped 1%. The central bank downgraded its growth estimate for 2020 to 2.1% from 2.3% and said the virus outbreak would have a short-term impact on business activity, after the economy expanded at its slowest pace in a decade last year.The Bank of Korea kept its key policy rate unchanged, at its current record low 1.25%.The Shanghai Composite index rose 0.1%, while shares fell in Taiwan and most of Southeast Asia. Thailand’s benchmark rose 1.5% after tumbling 5% on Wednesday following reports of newly discovered virus cases.The rupee meanwhile continued to gain for the third day, rising 10 paise to close at 71.56 against the dollar as crude prices continued to remain soft.

Title: Blue star hikes prices, others likely to follow
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chennai: Combined effect of parts shortage caused sue to Corona virus outbreak in China coupled with increased import duties of 12.5% from 10% on compressors, imposed in the union budget, airconditioner makers have marked up prices by nearly 5% or around Rs 2,000 a unit. Bluestar, which effected a price increase earlier this month said that with the sea routes to and from China being blocked , some of the components have to be airlifted, thereby adding to the costs. “The ocean freight charges are up by 65%-100% and the increase in custom duty would bring up the cost by roughly upto Rs 200 per air conditioner on an average,” said B Thiagarajan, MD, Blue Star. Indian consumer durable brands are dependent on China for components and compressors. Dependency on imports from China even for brands which make compressors in-house has had a negative impact on the consumer durables sector. “A price increase of up to 3% for consumer durables such as televisions sets, ACs, refrigerators and microwaves, is anticipated from March 2020 onwards, mainly contributed to the short supply of components and finished goods due to coronavirus outbreak, apart from the duty increase on certain components like compressors and motors and in some cases on finished goods,” said Kamal Nandi, business head and EVP, Godrej Appliances.

Eric Braganza, president, Haier India says, “Haier is looking at increasing the prices of air conditioners by 3%-5% due to the hike in customs duty and logistics cost amidst coronavirus outbreak We have already increased the prices of our deep freezers and will shortly be increasing prices in TV and refrigerator categories as well. Besides an increase in prices, companies also predict a supply shortage in April with the current conditions in China. With the expectations of a good summer, brands expect a shortage in stocks in the peak seasons. Blue Star’s Thiagarajan said that they have stocked up enough for the units to last until the mid of April, he expects the latter half to see some shortage if summers end up being hotter.

Title: Truck & bus financiers cut down financing BS4 chassis
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chennai: With the March 31 deadline for registration of BS4 vehicles just a month away, most truck financiers, including Sundaram Finance, Cholamandalam and HDFC Bank have stopped financing the purchase of BS4 truck and bus chassis, as these vehicles will a body-built at workshops after which they will need to pass a fresh RTO fitness test before getting their final registration. Typically, a body building workshop takes between 30-45 days to build a cowl/bus body/cabin on a chassis. For tourist buses, that takes longer. So a BS4 chassis bought now will not be ready for registration before the March 31 cut off date, say financiers. “For the last 2 or 3 weeks we are going slow on financing BS4 chassis. Unless we are absolutely sure that body building will happen before the deadline, we are not financing the vehicle. In a situation like this, the risk to the financier is significant and we have been very careful. We are identifying only those vehicles where there is certainty that body building will be complete before March 31,” said Sundaram Finance CFO M Ramaswamy. Others like Cholamandalam Finance have completely stopped chassis financing from this week onwards. “We have stopped financing chassis. And it is not just us — most financiers have stopped financing BS4 chassis. For us, February 25 was the cut-off for financing BS4 chassis. BS6 chassis are not yet available. We are only making an exception for one or two customers on a case to case basis if we are confident that the body is readily available,” said Ravindra Kundu, executive director, Cholamandalam Investment & Finance.

Financiers say the cut-back is only on account of the risk involved in financing a truck or bus chassis. “Yes banks are careful on vehicles where body building is required because uncertainty about completion and final registration is creating anxiety but there should be no issue with fully-built vehicles,” said Umesh Revankar, MD & CEO, Shriram Transport Finance. As for unsold BS4 stock, ultimately, say financiers, the buck stops with the truck and bus companies. “Those who produced the BS4 vehicles until now should take the risk. Why have banks to be blamed for not financing? There is no desperation to take such risks. Were the OEMs hoping that the (March 31 vehicle registration) deadline would get extended?,” said Ashok Khanna, group head-vehicle loans, HDFC Bank. (ENDS)

Title: Telangana: Cop who kicked suicide victim’s father suspended
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Screenshot of cop kicking the suicide victim’s father

HYDERABAD: The constable who kicked the father of a 16-year-old who died of suicide at Patancheru government hospital was suspended by the Sangareddy SP on Thursday.

Referring to the incident, Director General of Police M Mahendar Reddy tweeted on Wednesday night, “It is an unfortunate incident. The concerned police officer has been withdrawn from duties and attached to headquarters. SP Sangareddy has been directed to take appropriate measures to prevent recurrence of such incidents.”

On Thursday, Sangareddy SP Chandana Deepthi also tweeted about the suspension. “The Police Officer, N Sridhar, PC-349 who is seen kicking the father of the deceased in the Patancheru incident of 26.02.2020, is placed under suspension,” he wrote.

In the evening, DGP Reddy held a video conference with all police officers and home guards in the state, excluding traffic police, to discuss the incident. During the three hour long video conference, DGP advised his colleagues to be careful about their conduct as irresponsible behaviour by a few officials would tarnish the image of the entire department.

DGP advised that at each police station, a focus group comprising of youth, farmers, factory workers, senior citizens, teachers, women and students should be formed. After brainstorming with them, a course of action should be prepared to prevent such incidents from recurring.

After the suicide of 16-year-old student Sandhya at her college hostel in Patancheru on Tuesday, police shifted her body to Patancheru government hospital. Students barged into the mortuary and brought the freezer containing the body to the road to stage a protest. While police were trying to take the body back into the mortuary, Sandhya’s father resisted. Constable Sridhar kicked and forcibly removed him.

Title: VNGU VC’s speech creates ripples on social media
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

SURAT: The convocation speech by Shivendra Gupta , vice-chancellor of Veer Narmad South Gujarat University (VNSGU), has sent ripples across the social media in the Diamond City.

The statement made in the presence of thousands of students has put the government in a tight spot. In his speech delivered at the 51st convocation on Wednesday, Gupta had said: “The rate of unemployment is currently at its highest possible level.”

Gupta started his little over 10 minutes address, saying, “Presidential address and convocation address are not so interesting things. But I have to perform these duties because without it the convocation remains incomplete.” Gupta was presiding over the convocation function where Kapil Dave, former Indian cricket team captain, and poet Rajesh Reddy were guests.

In his address Gupta said, “The first and foremost is the issue of unemployment. The rate of unemployment is probably at the highest possible level. It has increasingly became evident that universities are somehow not supplying the trained workforce demanded by industries.”

A video grab of Gupta’s speech is being circulated widely on various social media platforms. The video has only that portion in which Gupta is heard speaking about unemployment.

When questioned about his statement, Gupta said, “I was speaking in the context of the students of VNSGU and not about the overall situation. I suggested to bridge the gap between the university and industries.”

“Vice chancellor is the top official of the university and he gets feedback from the society and sources. He must have received information reflecting the current situation on unemployment and he expressed it in his convocation address,” said Sanjay Desai, a syndicate member.

Title: Two charred to death as fire erupts in chemical unit
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

A short-circuit in the electricity meter box at Aceto Chem Private Limited caused an explosion

SURAT: Two persons were killed and two others received serious injuries in a huge explosion at a chemical factory at Pandesara GIDC on Thursday.

Surat Municipal Corporation’s (SMC) fire and emergency services department officials said the explosion took place due to a short-circuit in the electricity meter box at Aceto Chem Private Limited, a chemical company owned by Bansi Patel, at Pandesara GIDC at about 11:30am. Fire officials stated that a portion of the three-storey chemical company collapsed after the blast. It took three hours for the firefighters to extinguish the fire.

About 50 workers were present in the factory when the fire took place but majority of them managed to escape. The explosion was heard in a five kilometre radius of the GIDC estate. However, Pappu Singh, 28, and Amod Singh, 35, both residents of Pandesara, were killed. Raju Paswan, 40, with serious burns injuries was admitted to a private hospital and Amar Singh Nisar, 35, to New Civil Hospital after he fractured both his legs while trying to jump from the first floor of the chemical company.

Vidhi Chaudhary, deputy commissioner of police (zone-3), told TOI, “The chemical substance coming out of the factory was highly acidic. There was a burning sensation in my legs when I accidentally stepped into a pool of chemical. Two workers were killed in the fire. We have sought a report from Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) to know the exact reason behind the fire. We will decide on the course of action against the owner of the chemical factory after receiving the report.”

Fire officer Dipak Makhajani told TOI, “The company owned by Bansi Patel manufactures coloured dyes and chemicals for processing of finished fabrics in textile mills. There was a burning sensation in the eyes of people due to the hazardous nature of the chemical. Firefighters faced lot of difficulties in dousing the fire. The explosion could have occurred due to a short-circuit in electricity cables.”

Title: Surat to get 150 electric buses in one year
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) will get subsidy to purchase 150 electric buses in the phased manner during the next one year, for which it has already received Rs 13.5 crore as the first installment from the union government.

According to SMC officials, these buses have been sanctioned under Phase-II of Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles in India Scheme (FAME India Scheme) of Department of Heavy Industry (Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises ).

With this, the civic body officials expect to run around 75 electric buses on Bus Rapid Transportation System (BRTS) routes in the city from Diwali onwards. This will be a major boost to Surat’s effort for clean mobility in public transportation system.

“Under the Union government’s scheme, Surat is entitled to get a total subsidy of Rs 67.5 crore for 150 electric buses. Of this, 20 percent subsidy (Rs 13.5 crore) has been released now. The electric buses will help reduce carbon emission and fight pollution as well,” said an SMC official.

According to officials, in order to give a further push to clean mobility, the Department of Heavy Industry has approved 150 electric buses to Surat under FAME India scheme phase II.

Department of Heavy Industry had invited the Expression of Interest (EoI) from more than million cities, smart cities, States and Union territories capitals and cities from special category states for submission of proposal for deployment of Electric Buses on operational cost basis. Surat had also submitted its proposal for the same.

Government expects that these buses will run about 4 billion kilometer during their contract period and are expected to save cumulatively about 1.2 billion litre fuel over the contract period. This will result in cutting 2.6 million tonnes of CO2 emission.

“Surat has 102km BRTS corridor, the largest dedicated corridor in the country and 1.35 lakh commuters travel daily on BRTS buses. Apart from BRTS, on average, 1.4 lakh commuters travel on city buses daily,” said an official.

Title: SMC to set up 27 new vending zones for street vendors
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

SURAT: There is a good news for street vendors and citizens as Surat Municipal Corporation ( SMC ) will set up 27 new vegetable vending zones in different parts of the city in the coming months.

This will help street vendors get dedicated spaces with civic amenities, while citizens will get vegetable zones near their localities.

The new vending zones will come up in Rander , Limbayat, Althan, Katargam and Athwa zones of the SMC .

According to the SMC officials, at present, there are over 52 existing vending zones in the city, but in many areas, new vending zones are needed to support street vendors. In the absence of any dedicated space for vending, vegetable vendors are left with no option but to be on the streets for vending, causing traffic snarls in the city. The civic body plans to set up 27 new vending zones in different parts of the city with the cost of Rs 76 crore.

The new vending zones will accommodate 3,339 vendors in the city. These vending zones will be built under the central government’s National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM)’s Support to Urban Street Vendors (SUSV) programme.

“We will receive grants from the central government for these vending zones. We have named this project as ‘Ajivika’ (employment),’’ SMC commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani told TOI.

“The new vending zones will have CC Road, drainage system, water supply system, storm water drainage, public conveniences, recharge borewell and parking space. Moreover, they will have fire extinguishers, solar panels, organic waste converters and CCTVs,’’ Pani said.

Apart from creating new vending zones, the SMC will also renovate existing vending zones in old parts of the city. These vending zones are located in the central zone area which include Bhagal, Saiyadpara and Navsari Bazaar. According to an estimate, there are over 22,000 street vendors in the city.

“The NULM seeks to address the concerns of urban street vendors by facilitating access to suitable spaces for vending, institutional credit, improved skills and social security linkages,’’ said an official.

“Street vendors constitute an important segment at the bottom of the pyramid of the informal economy in cities. Street vending provides a source of self-employment, and acts as a measure of urban poverty alleviation. Street vending also has a prominent place in the urban supply chain, and provides inexpensive and convenient access to goods and services to all segments of the population including the poor,’’ Pani said.

Title: Pension revision work to be completed by March 31: Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi on Thursday said work on revision of pension of 2.53 lakh employees, who had retired before 2016, as per recommendations of the Seventh Pay Commission would be completed by March 31.

“Pension revision of about 2.20 lakh retired employees has already been done,” Modi said in response to a question raised by RJD leader Ram Chandra Purbey in the legislative council on Thursday.

Modi, who also holds the finance portfolio, said the task of revision of pension of retired employees before January 2016 was earlier given to the banks. “The banks, however, did not show interest in the work. Later, the pension revision work was given to the accountant general office. However, the work was delayed due to shortage of data entry operators,” he said.

The deputy CM added, “The state government has engaged eight data entry operators for this work. The revision of retired employees’ pension will be done by March 31.”

Replying to a question of RJD MLC Radhacharan Sah about loan to self-help groups (SHGs) in Bihar , Modi said all the SHGs under Jeevika would now get loan at 7% interest. “This system is already applicable in 17 districts of the state. It will now be applicable in other 21 districts, where SHGs currently get loan at 10-12 % interest,” the deputy CM said.

Replying to a question raised by BJP MLC Nawal Kishor Yadav on ‘rise in crime’ in Patna, energy minister Bijendra Prasad Yadav replied on behalf of the home department that six people were arrested and pistols and cartridges seized from them by the Patna police in two separate cases of loot in the district. “One criminal was arrested for holding employees of a petrol pump hostage at gunpoint and looting Rs 50,000 from them at Digha on January 4,” Yadav said.

He added, “Five people were arrested in connection with the loot at a gas agency in Naubatpur. The criminals had looted Rs 2.5 lakh from the gas agency on January 5.”

Title: NRC and CAA anti-poor: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

GAYA: Incarcerated RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Thursday said that Bihar has become the ‘epicentre of unemployment’. He said that no less than 7 crore Bihari youths have no work and largescale migration of work force was taking place.

Addressing a public meeting at Sherghati, the younger Yadav scion said that CAA, NPR and NRC were just diversionary tactics to deflect attention from real issues, like unemployment and hyperinflation. He also blamed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for strengthening the divisive forces in the country that culminated in communal riots in Delhi.

Tejashwi, who was in Sherghati as part of his ongoing ‘Berozgari Hatao Yatra’ alleged that the CAA was a sham aimed at causing religious divide. He also said that NRC was inherently anti-poor as the daily wagers living in slums, crores of homeless and people living in areas vulnerable to natural disasters like floods are the undocumented population of the country. “It is an invitation to chaos,” he said.

The RJD leader promised to fill all vacant positions in the state government and other bodies if his party came to power in the forthcoming assembly elections. Former speaker Uday Narain Chaudhary created ripples at the public meet by saying that political rumour mills were agog with speculation about 2015 type re-alignment of political forces in the state and return of CM Nitish Kumar to the Mahagatbandhan fold.

“If any such alliance was to take place, Tejashwi and not Nitish should be the CM face,” said Chaudhary.

The political realignment issue was also raised by RJD strongman and former minister Surindra Prasad Yadav. Accusing the Bihar CM of betrayal, the former minister who represents the Belaganj seat in the Bihar assembly, said that going by the CM’s track record and ‘politics of opportunism’ practised by him, any tie up with Nitish would be ‘politically counter-productive’.

“Mahagatbandhan in its present form is very strong,” Tejashwi said.

While both Surindra and Chaudhary spoke before Tejashwi, the former deputy CM did not make any response to the realignment story. Instead Tejashwi quoted statistics to claim that his party left a much stronger economy as compared to one that the party inherited. He also claimed that without increasing fare, Lalu pulled out Indian railways from ‘deep red’ and made it financially obese.

“The NDA government is now selling railway assets at throw away prices,” Tejashwi said.

Title: CM Nitish Kumar should stop NPR exercise in Bihar: Former JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Former JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar

PATNA: CPI functionary and former JNU Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar on Thursday said chief minister Nitish Kumar should issue a gazette notification to stop National Population Register (NPR) exercise in the state.

Kanhaiya, who was addressing his ‘Samvidhan Bachao Nagrikta Bachao Maharally’ at Gandhi Madian here, asked people to exert pressure on their local representatives so that resolutions could be passed at the panchayat level against the NPR.

“If the government issues a notification that there will be no NPR, it’s fine. Otherwise, tell your mukhiyas to pass a resolution at panchayat level against the NPR. The resolution should then be sent to the DM concerned,” Kanhaiya said. He asked the people to be ready for “civil disobedience movement” in worst case.

Stressing on the need to maintain communal harmony, the CPI leader said fire knew no religion or caste. “Britishers used to follow divide-and-rule policy. They used to throw pork in mosques and cow meat in temples. Because of that hatred, our country was divided. In Delhi, it was not a Hindu or a Muslim who lost his life, it was humanity which died,” Kanhiaya said.

Kanhaiya said the controversy over citizenship rights was designed to divert the attention of people from issues like unemployment, education and health. Raising ‘azadi’ slogan, he said country’s independence was once again in danger. “We want independence from poverty, unemployment and dishonesty,” he added.

Congress’s Kadwa MLA Shakil Ahmad Khan hit out at the BJP government for asking common people to prove their patriotism now and then. He said, “Those who were licking the boots of Britishers during independence and did not support Quit India movement are asking us to provide certificate of nationalism. Our history has the answer. You don’t even feel the pain of people being killed.”

Mahatma Gandhi’s great grandson Tushar Gandhi said Bapu had asked people to maintain communal harmony and he had started his fight for independence from Bihar. “This is the second fight for independence,” Tushar said.

Former IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan said people were discussing about number of Hindus or Muslims being affected by NRC in Assam, ignoring the plight of women. “Names of around 12 lakh Hindus, six lakh Muslims and one lakh dalits were not there on NRC list in Assam. Of them, 70% were women,” Gopinathan said.

Others who addressed the rally were social activists Medha Patekar, Shabnam Hashmi and Sadaf Zafar, Congress MLA Awadhesh Singh, CPI(ML) MLA Mehboob Alam, representatives from RLSP, HAM (S) and student leaders from Jamia, JNU and Patna University. However, none from RJD addressed the rally.

Title: Dirty tricks operation aimed at top SoftBank executives: Report
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

SoftBank executive Rajeev Misra (File photo)

BENGALURU: Top SoftBank executive Rajeev Misra had launched a smear campaign against two other high ranking executives of Indian origin — Nikesh Arora and Alok Sama — at the Japanese telecom and investment giant, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal. The tactics included a shareholder campaign to get them removed, planting of negative news stories on them, and even a honeytrap to blackmail, said the report.

The developments come at a time when SoftBank’s Vision Fund has suffered setbacks on a number of its investments, like WeWork, and activist firm Elliott Management has become a shareholder in the firm. A former Deutsche Bank executive, Misra joined SoftBank in 2014 and is right now the CEO of the $100-billion Vision Fund, besides also being on the board of the company.

Arora had resigned as president and heir apparent at SoftBank in 2016 after an internal investigation found the charges against him to be false. A former top Google executive, Arora had cited differences in the timeline of succession with SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son as the reason for his departure.

Sama, who came in as Arora’ s deputy and helped the SoftBank founder steer his biggest deals — like the $32-billion purchase of UK’s ARM Holdings, and $59-billion merger of US telcos Sprint and T-Mobile — left in April last year, as TOI had reported.

“These are old allegations which contain a series of falsehoods that have been consistently denied,” a spokesman for Misra said. “Mr. Misra did not orchestrate a campaign against his former colleagues.” A SoftBank spokesperson said, “For several years, we have investigated a campaign of falsehoods against SoftBank Group and certain former employees in an attempt to identify those behind it. SoftBank will be reviewing the inferences made by The Wall Street Journal.”

The WSJ report said Misra joined hands with an Italian businessman Alessandro Benedetti, who previously worked with private intelligence operatives and computer hackers, and also made a payment of $500,000 to him for targeting Arora and Sama. Benedetti’s effort to honey-trap Arora with one or multiple women did not succeed in Tokyo, the report added.

Title: Bihar: Bedlam in assembly over diesel subsidy to farmers
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

CPI-ML legislators demonstrate on assembly premises on Thursday

PATNA: With opposition members targeting agriculture minister Prem Kumar and creating noisy scenes in the assembly on Thursday, leading to its adjournment twice, Speaker Vijay Kumar Choudhary asked the ministers to “confine” themselves to only giving replies to the questions and supplementary queries of the members.

The Speaker first adjourned the House for 35 minutes at 11.25 am when the RJD, Congress and CPI(ML) members entered the well of the House, claiming that the agriculture minister had not given satisfactory answer to the short-notice question of RJD member Lalit Kumar Yadav regarding the farmers who could not get diesel subsidy for various reasons.

The Speaker again adjourned the House after it passed the resolution on caste-based census following unruly scenes over the same issue of payment of diesel subsidy to the farmers.

The tricky situation occurred when the agriculture minister was giving replies to Lalit’s short-notice question and supplementary queries. The latter wanted to know if the slightly over 5.07 lakh farmers, who had also applied for diesel subsidy online but had been deprived of it, would ever get it, and also if the farmers who could not apply for it online would be considered for the payment of subsidy.

The minister said 11.44 lakh farmers had submitted online application for diesel subsidy. Of them, 6.37 lakh farmers were paid Rs 83.25 crore as per the revised rules after proper verification.

“Today, there is 24-hour supply of electricity and all payments to the beneficiaries are made through the direct benefit transfer method. Everything is done as per rules,” the minister said. He told the Speaker that the opposition members were criticising him because he is from extremely backward caste.

The Speaker adjourned the House, as the opposition members, who had entered the well of the House, refused to return to their seats.

After the House met again and passed the resolution regarding caste-based census, Lalit stood up and demanded an apology from Prem for making reference to the “lantern age” and for claiming that he was being victimized on account of being an EBC man. At this, the Speaker issued a general advisory to all the ministers that they should not stray from the answers required for a question.

Title: Tax counters to remain open on all days till March end
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has decided to keep open counters for property tax collection on all Saturdays and Sundays, excluding Holi, till March 31. The move is meant to increase tax recovery and facilitate tax payment to people on holidays.

As per the state government’s decision, the NMC has also implemented five-day-a-week working from February 29. It means NMC will not work on Saturdays and Sundays. But the property tax collection counters at all the ten zones and the head office will remain open on all days in the week. Tax collection counters will be closed only on March 10 on the eve of Holi.

Title: A step forward: Third-gender patients get exclusive clinic in West Bengal
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

The clinic inaugurated on Thursday

KOLKATA: The state’s first health clinic exclusively for the transgender community was inaugurated on Thursday. Aimed at providing basic healthcare to the community that often faces harassment while seeking medical care, the clinic, titled Antar, will be in operation twice a week for now and the consultation will be free.

“As a teen, I had gone to a local doctor as I was suffering from dysentery. To my utter shock, the doctor wanted to see my genitals to confirm whether I was male or female,” said Tista Das, a transgender activist.

A joint initiative with Prantakatha and Association of Transgender and Hijra in Bengal (ATHB), the clinic was inaugurated by minister of women and child and social welfare Shashi Panja at Peerless Hospital . Initially, the clinic will have general physicians, though the hospital has plans to invite endocrinologists to be part of the project. “Apart from basic health issues, a good number of transgender people are on hormone therapy, which comes with a number of side effects. Hence, they need regular monitoring,” said Peerless MD Sujit Kar Purkayastha.

Apart from Bappaditya Mukherjee of Prantakatha and Ranjita Sinha of ATHB, American Center director Monica Shie was present on Thursday.

“We have been holding sensitizing workshops in the hospital before launching this project,” said Subrojyoti Bhowmick, clinical director of the hospital who is in charge of Antar.

Other private hospitals in the city said they do not discriminate against people from the community and added they had no plans of setting up such exclusive clinics.

“We have been attending to patients from the transgender community just like we take care of any other patient,” said an official at Apollo Hospitals.

“We do not have plans for an exclusive clinic. But whenever a patient from the LGBTQ community comes in, we allow them to choose their gender while filling up the form,” said a source at Fortis Hospital.

Title: Breaking the ability barrier
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chennai: Remember Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi and his exploits on the cricket field? A total of 2,793 runs from 46 Tests might not sound monstrous in this day and age, but the former Indian captain played most of his international cricket with a permanently damaged right eye since 1961. And then there was the legendary B S Chandrasekhar, whose polio-afflicted right arm wove magical leg spin. The two played much of their cricket together, but since their retirement four-and-a-half decades ago we have hardly seen differently abled players at the top.

Though Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL) is no international cricket, this T20 tournament, conducted by the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association , often serves as a stepping stone for players. And come the 2020 season G Periyaswamy and M Suganesh — braving their disabilities — will display their skills for Salem Spartans in the highly competitive TNPL .

READ THE FULL STORY ON TOI+

Meet the new Pataudis and Chandrasekhars of cricket

Title: Government employees give ultimatum to state till March 15 to have dialogue
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Over 1 lakh employees took leave on Thursday, including patwaris, and panchayati raj employees, to observe Vir... Read More

JAIPUR: The government employees observed ‘Virodh Divas’ across Rajasthan on Thursday and gave an ultimatum to the state government to have a dialogue with the employees’ federations by March 15 on the issue of salary revision and other demands.

They also demanded that dearness allowance (DA), which was increased from 12 to 17%, must be detached from budget announcement and the revised DA should be implemented with immediate effect. They threatened a statewide agitation if their demands were not fulfilled till March 15.

Over one lakh employees took leave on Thursday, including patwaris, panchayati raj employees, agriculture supervisors, gram sevaks, animal husbandry department employees and employees from other cadres. Over 40,000 employees held demonstrations across the state.

“It has been over one year since this government came to power, but they have not fulfilled our demands. We have submitted memoranda addressing the chief minister (Ashok Gehlot) and chief secretary (D B Gupta) to the collectors of all districts. We have given them time till March 15 to have a dialogue with the employee federations and fulfill our demands,” said Tej Singh Rathore, general secretary, All Rajasthan State Government Employees’ Federation.

“On March 15, there is a joint meeting of the executive boards of all the employee federations. If the government doesn’t talk to us, we will launch a state-wide agitation. We also demand that the DA should be detached from the budget announcement and should be implemented immediately. The state government employees should enjoy benefits of DA at the same time when central government employees get it, which is in the month of July and January. As per the budget, DA will be implemented in April, which is pending since last July. For this year’s DA, should we wait till the next budget. Therefore, the DA should be paid immediately,” he added.

They held demonstrations outside district collectorates over salary cut, delay in payment of salaries, delay in filling vacant posts in various departments, bringing back the old pension scheme, to make contractual employees permanent and against downsizing of government departments.

“In 2013, the Gehlot government had revised the payscale of the employees. The last BJP government withdrew this move and reduced the payscale. The salary structure of a few departments - like roadways, RTDC - have not been revised as per 7th Pay Commission. This is also one of our demands,” he said.

The All Rajasthan State Government Employees Federation (United) had demanded merging of grade pay 5, 6, 7 as one level and 8, 9 as one (as per the central government norms). They also demanded implementation of the Samant committee report.

Title: Firms offload old models as BS-VI deadline nears
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

PATNA: Automobile dealers and showrooms in the city are offering lucrative discounts on Bharat Stage-IV (BS- IV) cars and two-wheelers to clear the existing stock of such vehicles. With the new BS-VI norms coming into effect from April 1, people will not be able to register BS-IV vehicles any more.

According to experts, the sulphur content of BS-VI fuel is five times lower than that in BS-IV. Besides, BS-VI compliant vehicles can lead to a substantial reduction of nitrogen oxide emissions.

The general manager of an automobile showroom on Ashiana-Digha Road, S K Singh, told this newspaper, “We are only following the government norms and offering rebates, ranging from Rs 35,000 to Rs 2 lakh on various BS-IV car models. We do not have many vehicles in stock, but are trying to sell off everything before April 1.”

Some dealers claimed that owners of petrol-run vehicles did not have much to worry about due to the new norms. “There is a slight difference between BS-IV and BS-IV when it comes to petrol-run vehicles. In diesel-based old models of BS-IV vehicles, the sulphur emission is five times higher than BS-VI vehicles,” said Abhimanyu, the sales executive of an automobile showroom on Exhibition Road.

Similarly, dealers of two-wheelers, including motorbikes and scooters, are giving lucrative offers to end the old stocks of BS-IV models. “We are giving a flat discount of Rs 3,500 as well as an exchange offer. We are also offering minimum down payment offers to new customers,” said Saurav Suman, the sales executive at a two-wheeler showroom in New Dak Bungalow area.

Few dealers claimed that a large number of people were buying BS-IV vehicles. Aman Kumar, the customer relationship manager of a two-wheeler showroom pointed out, “More than 80% of our customers have bought BS-IV models in the last few days as they are cheaper and more user-friendly. The BS-VI models, on the contrary, have several new and complicated features.”

Meanwhile, customers are happy with the discounts being offered to them. “We do not get such discounts even during Dhanteras sale. I have booked a car worth Rs 10 lakh by paying just Rs 8 lakh,” said Ashok Sinha, a resident of Patliputra Colony.

Title: Qure.ai raises $16 mn from Sequoia India
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chennai: Healthcare startup Qure.ai on Thursday announced that they have raised $16 million (Rs 115 crore) in a funding round led by Sequoia India and supported by MassMutual Ventures Southeast Asia (SEA). Qure.ai will use this new capital to drive geographical and product portfolio expansion and support regulatory clearances.

Founded by Pooja Rao and Prashant Warrier, the startup uses artificial intelligence to interpret radiology images and help reduce the treatment time. Qure.ai was incubated by Fractal Analytics.

Speaking on the investment, Prashant Warrier, CEO, Qure.ai said, “We are proud to have taken our solutions beyond the research stage to actually impacting patient lives across more than 200 locations in 20 countries. This funding round will allow us to further invest into R&D and to expand the reach of our solutions, accelerating our mission of delivering accessible and affordable healthcare to every human being.”

“The sophistication of Qure.ai’s algorithms and predictive analytics tools, coupled with their expert team of data scientists and physicians positions them very well versus their global competitors,” said Anjana Sasidharan, principal at Sequoia Capital India LLP.

“Very few companies in this category have achieved such level of both academic and real-world validation, and Qure.ai is leading across multiple use-cases and modalities,” added Ryan Collins, MD, MassMutual Ventures SEA.

Title: State to demand hike in coal royalty
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Revision of coal royalty, Left-wing extremism and pending railway projects are some of the key issues that are likely to be discussed in the Eastern Zonal Council meeting to be chaired by Union home minister Amit Shah here on Friday, government sources said.

While West Bengal chief minister Mamata Benerjee is already in Bhubaneswar to attend the programme, her Bihar counterpart Nitish Kumar is scheduled to arrive here on Friday morning.

Mamata, one of the fiercest critics of the Citizenship Amendment Act and who has resorted to social media to protest against the violence in Delhi over CAA, will come face-to-face with Shah for the first time after the Act was enacted.

Similarly, Nitish will meet the Union home minister in the wake of his government passing a resolution against the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and in favour of the 2010 format of the National Population Register, something the BJP may not have liked.

Sources said Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren will not attend the meeting. The Jharkhand Congress state unit chief and finance minister Rameshwar Oraon will represent him, it is reliably learnt.

Since all four member states of the council — Bihar, Odisha, West Bengal and Jharkahand — are coal-bearing states, the issue of non-revision of coal royalty for around eight years may figure prominently in discussions.

Odisha chief secretary Asit Tripathy said the state will raise the long-pending demand of hike in coal royalty and lack of mobile connectivity in 11,000 villages.

The Naveen Patnaik-led government has been demanding a periodic revision of coal royalty every three years, according to the norms. The royalty has not been revised since 2012. As per an estimate, owing to the non-revision of royalty, the coal-bearing state has lost more than Rs 10,000 crore. The government has also been pressing for Centre’s assistance to ensure mobile connectivity to villages without one.

Sources said the meeting is also scheduled to see a discussion on interstate water issues, power transmission lines, pending land and forest clearance of railway projects, investigation of heinous offences, cattle smuggling across the country’s borders, lack of banking infrastructure in remote areas, petroleum projects, sharing pattern of centrally collected revenues, among others.

Naveen is the vice-chairman and host of the conference

The chief ministers will be accompanied by two cabinet ministers from their respective states besides the chief secretaries and other senior officers.

The Eastern Zonal Council had last met in Kolkata on October 1, 2018.

The Centre had set up five zonal councils in 1957 under Sections 15-22 of the States Reorganization Act, 1956. The Union home minister is the chairman of all the five councils. The chief minister of the host state, chosen by rotation every year, is the vice-chairman.

As per the agenda, Naveen will make the welcome address followed by introductory remarks by the finance minister of Jharkahand and the CMs of West Bengal and Bihar. Shah will make the opening remarks, which will be followed by agenda-wise discussion. The home minister will also make the closing remarks at the end of the daylong programme.
