Title: ‘Baat Bihar Ki’: Prashant Kishor accused of plagiarism
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Prashant Kishor

PATNA: A complaint case was filed in a local court against poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday a day after an FIR was lodged against him with the Patliputra police station here for alleged breach of trust and fraud. Kishor was expelled from JD(U) on January 29 following his differences with party’s top leadership over CAA, proposed NRC and NPR in the state.

On Thursday, a complaint case was filed against Kishor in the court of the chief judicial magistrate (CJM) in Patna for allegedly stealing slogan, logo and data, which the complainant, Shashwat Gautam, a political data analyst, had allegedly conceptualized for the state assembly polls scheduled to be held later this year.

The complaint case was transferred to the court of incharge sub-judicial magistrate-8 Abhishek Ranjan for further proceedings. When contacted, Gautam’s legal counsel Sangeet Devkuliar said, “We have filed a suit for damages under civil criminal procedure code and Intellectual Property Act since Gautam’s IPR has been stolen.”

Besides Kishor, the name of Osama Khursheed figured in the complaint filed in the court. Khursheed had earlier contested the Patna University Students’ Union election for the post of joint secretary when Kishor was monitoring the election campaign for Chhatra JD(U), sources said.

The complaint alleged that Gautam had to incur a loss of Rs.10 crore due to theft of data and other election related contents. “We have sufficient evidences to prove the charges levelled against the accused,” Gautam's legal counsel said.

The complaint filed on behalf of Gautam, a resident of Motihari in East Champaran district, said he (Gautam) had helped Kishor in conceptualizing the election campaign of JD(U) during the 2015 state assembly poll. Gautam, who had studied data analytics at George Washington University, USA, had earlier collected data with Kishor during the previous assembly polls, when JD(U) was part of the alliance with the RJD and the Congress and had performed very well in the election.

Earlier, an FIR was lodged against Kishor and Khursheed with the Patliputra police station under sections 467 (forgery of valuable security), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating), 471 (using as genuine of a forged document), 420 (cheating and dishonesty inducing delivery of property) 406 (breach of trust) and 120B ( conspiracy) of IPC on Wednesday night.

According to the Gautam's complaint, Osama was working with him on ‘Bihar Ki Baat’ project before he resigned from job. It further claimed that the organization had got the programme registered in January for its use in future. However, the data was stolen and used by someone else.

Patna high court advocate Devkuliar said, “The case filed by Gautam is very clear since somebody’s property has been stolen and used by someone else with little changes.”

On January 20, Kishor launched his ‘ Baat Bihar Ki ’ campaign with an aim to connect 10 lakh youths in the state. The programme received wide applause with around 3 lakh people willing to be associated with it on the very first day. Despite repeated attempts, Kishor couldn’t be reached for his comments. A staff of Kishor’s I-PAC said, “I am not authorized to talk to the media. Kindly contact him (Kishor) for any comment on such issues.”

Meanwhile, Khursheed, who has been accused of stealing campaign slogan and data from Gautam, denied all the allegations against him. Khursheed, however, accepted that he knew Gautam. “I am a student leader and many people come to meet me. Gautam had also approached me through a friend of mine, especially after my candidate’s performance in Patna University election. However, I have never worked with him,” he added.

Khursheed said ‘biharkibaat.in’ was registered by Sashwat in January 2020, while ‘BIHARKIBAAT.COM’ was created by someone in April 2019. “There are seven different Facebook pages with this name and almost similar logo. He (Shashwat) should clarify which data he is talking about. This is his publicity stunt,” Khursheed said.

Title: AAI circular allows reverification of site coordinates of buildings with NOC
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Surat airport has been listed among 21 airports across the country where ADSAC will allow reverification of si... Read More

SURAT: Airports Authority of India (AAI) has issued aerodrome safeguarding circular (ADSAC) to check violation of height norms by buildings in the vicinity of airports, including Surat.

Surat airport has been listed among 21 airports across the country where ADSAC will allow reverification of site coordinates of buildings for which no-objection certificate (NOC) has been issued.

Till now, there was a standard procedure for builders to apply under no-objection certificate application system (NOCAS) for taking NOC for building construction. Once NOC was approved under NOCAS, the same was submitted to Surat Municipal Corporation SMC) for approval of building construction.

Official sources said AAI has made a provision for appointment of Geographical Information System (GIS) analysts at airports for aeronautical surveys, aeronautical data management, quality control of surveyed data, image processing etc.

Once NOC for a building is approved, local airport authorities will have to reverify site coordinates and building height obstacles with GIS analyst by visiting the locations and later need to submit a report to higher authorities on a quarterly basis. In case of continued non-compliance by a developer, cancellation of NOC by the designated officer could be taken up on request of local airport authorities.

Surat airport has been facing building height obstruction issue for a long time. AAI has identified about 90 buildings of 17 projects that obstruct flight path of airport runway and that notices have been served to concerned builders.

Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) had displaced runway by 615 metres, out of the total 2,905 metres for safe landing of aircraft at the airport due to height obstacles.

An AAI officer said, “The building height violation is hampering development of Surat airport. In order to protect the airport from further damage, AAI has come up with this circular where local airport authorities have been designated the power to request cancellation of NOC for non-compliance by developers. As Surat still has a vast land near airport open for real estate development, building height violations will be closely looked at.”

Title: ‘Normal summer in south Bengal, harsher in north’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

The minimum temperature in Kolkata climbed to 19.2°C on Thursday

KOLKATA: Summer temperatures in south Bengal are likely to remain normal while they will be slightly harsher in the north, according to the India Meteorological Department’s (IMD) outlook report released on Thursday.

Northwest, west and central India are also heading towards harsher weather between March and May, the report stated. The seasonal average temperature in south Bengal is likely to remain near the normal mark, though north Bengal is set to be warmer this summer. At least six districts of south Bengal that come under the core heat-wave zone of the country, however, are likely to see temperatures soar.

The seasonal average of maximum temperature is likely to remain between -0.5 and 0.5 of the normal mark from March to May. In north Bengal, on the other hand, it is likely to be 0.5°C to 1°C above normal. “Even though large parts of the country are expected to be warmer, south Bengal should experience a normal summer. But the districts of Bankura, Purulia, West Burdwan , Birbhum , Jhargram and West Midnapore could be warmer since they fall under the core heat-wave zone of the country,” said Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) director G K Das.

Meanwhile, the minimum temperature in Kolkata climbed to 19.2°C on Thursday following overnight drizzle in some parts of the city. “Local cloud cells triggered shower in some areas, but there is no other system that can curb the rise in temperature now. It will remain around 18°C-19°C on Friday. But the maximum temperature is set to touch 30°C-31°C this weekend,” said Das. However, it will remain around 29C on Friday.

Explaining the reasons behind the rise in mercury, Das said that with the passing of winter, the cool northwesterly wind has stopped flowing in. Since there is no immediate possibility of further rain, the days will get warm, he said.

Title: Caste-based census: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar plays ‘masterstroke’, again
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Chief minister (CM) Nitish Kumar seems to be determined to lead the ruling NDA largely on his own terms and conditions. After catching BJP in its sleep while getting a resolution passed in the assembly against NRC and for implementation of only the 2010 format of NPR, he again played a masterstroke by getting a resolution passed for caste-based census in the state.

The caste-based census is a long pending demand of the JD(U) and it is the second time that a resolution for caste census was passed in the assembly. In February last year, the state assembly had passed a resolution recommending to the Centre to conduct caste-based census in 2021.

Nitish had said in the assembly prior to the passage of the special resolution that caste-based census was required to remove the present cap of 50% on reservation for increase in the quota for reserved categories of scheduled castes (SCs), scheduled tribes (STs) and other backward Classes (OBCs) on the basis of the increase in their population.

Nitish had again said in a special daylong session of the legislative assembly on January 13 this year that a proper caste-based census had not been done in the country after 1930. He had claimed that the caste census done in 2010 was not comprehensive as it was not done properly and its figures were also not published.

While BJP leaders did not speak much on the fresh resolution on caste-based census, the opposition RJD claimed that Nitish government got the resolution in this regard passed in the assembly under pressure from leader of opposition Tejashwi Prasad Yadav.

“It’s a historical fact that the social and spatial demarcation within India exists even today. SCs/STs/OBCs have been deprived socially and economically for ages. Caste-based census will provide a radical ground at the policy level for greater social and economic reforms,” Tejashwi tweeted hours after the resolution was passed by the assembly.

BJP MLC Sachchidanand Rai, however, said such decisions lead to division in the society. Without taking Nitish’s name, Rai said having majority does not mean that any proposal is passed in the assembly.

However, BJP MLC Naval Kishor Yadav said no one should be having any issue with caste-based census as it will reflect the actual status of people from different communities.

Earlier, the Bihar BJP leadership was virtually caught in their sleep when the special resolution against implementation of NRC and for implementation of NPR in its 2010 format was moved by Bihar legislative assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Chaudhary and later approved unanimously by the House on Tuesday. Sources said the issue never came up for discussion in the joint meeting of the NDA.

Title: Patna: Work on garbage transfer station at Gardanibagh begins
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

File photo of Patna Municipal Corporation

PATNA: The construction work on garbage transfer station for segregation of solid and wet waste has recently resumed at Gardanibagh after the Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC) selected a Delhi-based private firm for the job.

The construction work on transfer station was stopped after the urban development and housing department cancelled the contract with a private firm last year. The company was supposed to construct transfer stations, processing plant and waste-to- energy plant. However, it did not get the environment clearance from the ministry of environment, forest and climate change.

Altogether six transfer stations would come up in the city in the next six months, including four at Agamkuan garbage secondary point and two in Gardanibagh area.

Garbage collected from New Capital and Patliputra circles would be segregated at Gardanibagh, whereas garbage collected from Azimabad, Bankipore, Kankarbagh and Patna City will be segregated at Agamkuan.

PMC sources said six garbage transfer stations are to be constructed at the cost of Rs15 crore. Each transfer station would come up in 30x30sq metre area.

Patna mayor Sita Sahu said Gardanibagh transfer station would be ready within three months. “It will be have facilities like platforms, ramps and compactors. There will be a composting pit as well, where the organic fertilizers will be made through wet garbage, especially kitchen and garden waste, by using chemicals,” she said.

“The solid waste would be loaded in waste compactor to reduce the volume of trash. The compactor machines would compress the solid waste material to reduce the amount of space it takes up. The remaining garbage will be dumped at Ramchak Bairiya landfill site,” she added.

Indradeep Chandravanshi, a member of PMC’s empowered standing committee and councillor of ward number 48, said the construction work on Agamkuan garbage point would begin soon. “The segregated plastic waste will be sent to processing plant, which is being constructed at Ramchak Bairiya. It will be ready in 5-6 months,” he said.

The PMC has shortlisted the National Federation of Farmers’ Procurement, Processing and Retailing Cooperatives of India Ltd (NACOF) last week to operate the transfer station and segregation of waste.

The PMC would sign the agreement for next seven years to manage the composting pits, provide human resource, vehicles to transfer the segregated waste to processing plant and landfill site among other works.

Title: Don’t read much into CM-Tejashwi Prasad Yadav meets: JD(U)
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

JD(U) state president Bashishtha Narayan Singh

PATNA: JD(U) state president Bashishtha Narayan Singh on Thursday said the two meetings between CM Nitish Kumar and leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav earlier this week were just courtesy meetings. He said the NDA was strong and it would register an emphatic victory in the upcoming assembly elections in the state.

Bashishtha was addressing media persons at the JD(U) office here to announce the induction of former CPI functionary Shalini Mishra into the party. Asked about two meetings between Nitish and Tejashwi, Bashishtha said there was no hidden agenda behind it and nothing much should be read into the meetings.

“It is a common gesture of ruling leaders to meet those in the opposition. PM Narendra Modi also meets opposition leaders at the Centre. There is nothing unusual about it. Nevertheless, Tejashwi still spews venom against Nitish ji and state government through his speeches and yatras. Having a causal chat over a cup of tea should not be linked with politics,” Bashishtha said.

Tejashwi had met Nitish in his assembly chamber on Tuesday, minutes before the House adopted a resolution against implementation of National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the country. The two leaders met again in the chamber of assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Chaudhary on Wednesday. According to sources, the Speaker, Nitish and RJD functionary Abdul Bari Siddiqui were already talking to each other, when an emissary was sent to invite Tejashwi as well for a cup of tea.

Meanwhile, Bashishtha claimed that JD(U)’s state-level ‘Karyakarta Sammelan’ at Gandhi Maidan in Patna on March 1 will be attended by over 2 lakh party workers.

Title: Indians dial up nearly 12GB a month
Content:
(Representative image)

CHENNAI: Video consumption using 4G mobile technology drove data traffic in India last year, with an average of 70 minutes a day spent on over-the-top (OTT) platforms on phones. Monthly data usage also grew to 11.7GB a month from 10GB in 2018. The Mobile Broadband India Traffic Report from Nokia said that 2019 saw a 47% year-on-year (YoY) increase in data traffic, 96% of which was constituted by 4G, up from 92% in 2018.Most telecom operators have switched off their 3G networks in big cities and the consequential impact saw 3G connections witnessing the highest-ever decline of 30% during 2019. In 2018, a mere 1% subscribers surrendered 3G connections.Total data traffic grew by 44 times in 4 years and 2019 saw overall data subscribers grow to 600 million, the report added. The 4G device base grew in parallel by 1.5x, driven by the launch of a variety of models by brands’ aggressive pricing (VoLTE handsets — mobiles that have high-speed wireless communications — grew to 432 million). Despite the growth registered, broadband penetration in India is at around 47%, which is significantly lower compared to China at 95%, and other European nations at 95-115%Nokia senior VP & head (India market) Sanjay Malik said, “We believe the migration of subscribers to 4G will continue to drive broadband growth in the country. The upcoming 4K/8K videos and Industry 4.0 solutions that promise to enhance productivity and bring down expenses for the industries across different verticals demand ultra-high speed and extremely low latency. Indian telcos will need to consider other connectivity solutions to leverage the new opportunities and to address the growing data consumption.”A big factor for the increase in data traffic is video consumption. Viewers spend 12.5 times a week with an average of 40 minutes a session on OTT platforms, whose investments in original content has paid off. Mobile phones have become the dominant medium of consumption, taking up 88% of the total viewership.While OTT players have gained momentum through partnerships with DTH players and by offering sachet pricing and mobile-only packages, the mobile operators — fuelled by Reliance Jio — are offering internet at affordable rates to drive data traffic. The report says that Indian operators offer the cheapest mobile data at Rs 7/GB, down from Rs 226 in 2015. They have also increased their rural penetration to 27.6% from 13% in 2016.

Title: 3 killed in separate incidents of violence in Bihar
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A 60-year-old man, Arjun Das, was beaten to death at Nadpura village under the Punpun police station area in Patna district, police said on Thursday.

Police said a group of people attacked Arjun with sticks and iron rods following a dispute over barking of pet dog belonging to one Madan Das.

Arjun’s son Shambhu Das told police that his neighbour Madan got agitated after his dog entered his house and touched eatables in the kitchen.

The altercation between the two rival groups led to the death of Arjun. Police said altogether 10 people were made named accused in the case. Three of them have been arrested by the police.

Meanwhile, a 25-year-old youth was killed at Rahimabad village under the Bangra police station area in Samastipur district on Wednesday night. The deceased was identified as Lalbabu Rai. SHO of Bangers police station Anil Kumar said old enmity was the reason behind the murder.

In another incident, unidentified criminals killed a 25-year-old youth near Sadar hospital entrance gate in Golalganj district on Thursday. Gopalganj SP Manoj Kumar Tiwari said the incident took place when the victim, Satyajeet Singh alias Chhotu, was returning home after attending a wedding ceremony at Haziapur village in neighbouring Uttar Pradesh.

Title: How businesses help ease pain of bereaved
Content:
(Representative image)

MUMBAI: When a loved one passes away, all that their relatives and friends are left with are personal belongings and fond memories. While the sorrow of losing a loved one — either to old age or to an unfortunate event — is acute, the remedies to fill in the vacuum created in one’s life are growing as well.Traditionally, individuals in bereavement find solace in prayer. Some try to get past the pain by engrossing themselves in various hobbies, while others drown themselves in work to overcome their agony. No matter how morbid it may sound, the business around helping people in their grief has found traction, owing to the acceptance that one doesn’t live forever.Flowers and gifting company Ferns N Petals has come up with a ‘flower will’ — a subscription service that allows one to send flowers to their loved ones, even after they are gone. The sender can choose a plan varying from 5 to 20 years and assign an ‘informer’. The company’s founder & MD Vikaas Gutgutia said the just-launched ‘flower will’ plan has received a good response on social media.Initially, the campaign revolves around the husband-wife relation. But Gutgutia said the company will explore emotions across relations in future. “Death is an integral part of life. Yet, we cry when somebody departs. We were working on how departing can be made different. We said to ourselves that flowers must have a role to play here and we would be the medium to make that happen. True love continues even after death , and thus we came up with the line ‘Love forever’,” said Gutgutia.This campaign is similar to the one by LIC, titled ‘Zindagi ke saath bhi, zindagi ke baad bhi’. The insurance industry has for decades tried to explain the importance of safeguarding near and dear ones financially after the breadearner’s death. But people usually avoid conversations around the subject of death and such skepticism has only posed hurdles in marketing life insurance. The campaign is said to have cut some ice with consumers, with more takers for life insurance products today.Beyond the circle of friends and relatives, there are services which comfort those in bereavement. Religious tourism is one. People rush to religious sites to pray for the departed soul as such moves warm the cockles of the heart. Many others find an outlet through social media by posting pictures of their departed loved one, while some turn to other beliefs.Mumbai-based tarot reader Sapna Shahri said, “I find that people in grief are very closed and do not want to expose their vulnerability. Out of 10, I get about 3 cases of people wanting some communication with their loved one who has passed over. After this, they seem to accept it better and it is more like a completion for them.” Tarot readers on an average charge from Rs 2,000 to even Rs 5,000 per hour.Harish Bijoor, brand strategy expert and founder of Harish Bijoor Consults Inc, said, “I do believe these services fill a gap and offer solutions. The Ferns N Petals offer is surely one such. Email and messaging services that offer to bank ‘message wills’ into the future are another. On designated days, messages pre-made by the person concerned will be automatically dispatched. A kid can receive such a message well into adulthood from a person who is physically no more.” However, from a healing point of view, Bijoor said all these marketing tools and devices are fighting the natural. “Death is but natural. Prolonging the communication on memory process fights healing in a way as well. Therefore, we as a people need to go with nature and obey its wills. Nature makes a will of its own, and a ‘flower will’ fights that in its own way as well,” he said.Since those in bereavement are also naturally depressed, Many take recourse in mental health helplines, which have in recent years seen a surge in the number of calls due to the growing awareness on mental wellness. “It’s normal to grieve for a loved one, and in eight weeks most people accept it and move on. There are some who may take longer to overcome the grief. They should pick up signs of anxiety and seek help,” said Anjali Chhabria, a psychiatrist & founder of MindTemple .

Title: Coronavirus scare: 300 fishermen from Gujarat, other states stuck in Iran
Content:
Indian government has initiated process to bring back 340 fishermen

SURAT: Over 300 fishermen from India are trapped at Bandar-e-Chiru, Chiruyeh, Hormozgan province in Iran as nearby airports have been sealed by local authorities following coronavirus scare . The fishermen belonging to Gujarat and other states sought help from their family members over phone and also shared videos.On receiving information MoS forest and tribal development, Ramanlal Patkar, wrote a letter to ministry of external affairs seeking its intervention to bring around 340 fishermen from Gujarat and other southern states back home.The fishermen from Gujarat include those from Maroli, Bhatkhadi, Kalgam, Dandi, Nargol and few other villages in Valsad.“I was informed by family members and community leaders of those stuck in Chiru. Their flights have been cancelled due to coronavirus scare as the airports are sealed,” Patkar told TOI over phone."I have shared the details of the fishermen from Gujarat and other southern states with external affairs ministry. The officials are working on it and the fishermen will be brought back soon," added Patkar.Chiruyeh is a port town of Hormozgan province. The fishermen went to Iran around seven months ago by flight. Forming small groups they hire fishing boats and share 50 percent profit with the owner. They continue fishing for seven to eight months and return to India once the fishing season ends, informed family members of those stuck in Iran."I am worried and I don't know what to do now. I wish that my husband returns home safely," said Bharti, whose husband Jayesh is stuck in Iran currently."My uncle and few other relatives are stuck in Chiru. The fishing season is over and they have no work since last 15 days. They are trying to return but there are no flights," said Harish Bari, president of Bari Bariya Community in Valsad. "From our community around 150 fishermen are trapped in Chiru," he added."The fisherman do not have direct connecting flight to India. They used to take flight to Sarjah and then to Mumbai," said a family member."From my village many fishermen went to Iran for fishing. The fishermen have contacted their family members for help," said Lata Marolikar, sarpanch of Maroli village.

Title: IndusInd insider Kathpalia to be bank’s next MD & CEO
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Sumant Kathpalia (File photo)

MUMBAI: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has cleared the appointment of Sumant Kathpalia as the MD & CEO of IndusInd Bank . As a result, Kathpalia will succeed Romesh Sobti who retires next month.

The appointment, which is for a period of three years from March 24 this year, puts an end to speculation on the succession issue at IndusInd Bank. Sobti, who headed it since February 2008, has to step down as the RBI did not relent on the 70-year age limit for bank CEOs. The bank had last year announced that a board-level committee had identified a successor and submitted the name of the candidate to the RBI. It, however, did not name the candidate.

“We now advise that the bank has received a communication from the RBI today, approving the appointment of Kathpalia, who currently heads the consumer banking business,” a statement to the exchanges said.

IndusInd Bank, the first new-age lender to get a licence from the RBI, commenced operations in 1994. Sobti had brought about a transformation in the bank, increasing the focus on retail and reducing pressure of stressed assets.

Kathpalia — a qualified chartered accountant and a commerce graduate from Hindu College , Delhi — is a career banker with over 33 years of experience. He has worked in multinational banks such as Citi , Bank of America and ABN Amro before joining IndusInd Bank.

He has diversified experience across various functions, including business strategy, sales & distribution, operations, systems, risk and credit.

While IndusInd Bank has had a good run for most of Sobti’s term, it has been under pressure after it revealed an exposure of around Rs 3,000 crore to IL&FS. The bank’s shares are currently trading at Rs 1,116, compared to its 52-week high of Rs 1,835. The bank currently has a market capitalisation of Rs 77,360 crore.

Earlier this month, rating agency Moody’s had revised the outlook on the bank to negative citing deterioration in its asset quality. “The bank has a relatively higher exposure to real estate compared to other banks (at around 8% of its loan book as of December 31, 2019). While there have been no NPLs in this segment so far, this exposure to the property market remains a source of risk, given the broader stress in the real estate sector. The bank could also be negatively impacted by the ongoing stress in the telecommunications sector,” Moody’s had said.

Title: Students protest against VNSGU’s MoU with private institute
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Members of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) locked the office of Rajendra Patel, registrar of Veer Narmad South Gujarat University , on Thursday alleging that he was mostly not present whenever the students came to make a representation to him. The students had arrived at the university head office on UM Road to make a representation against the MOU signed by the university with a private institute that runs event management and sport management courses.

The students alleged that the university officials signed the MoU with the Mumbai-based institute without following the procedures.

"The institute will be provided space in the university premises to conduct classes for 20 per cent share from fees. The institute will be charging fees as high as Rs6 lakh," said one of the student leaders.

"Surprisingly, no syndicate member objected to the MoU when it was brought before the syndicate. The syndicate members cleared it despite the institute’s high fees," said Kanu Bharwad, a senate member.

The students grilled Rajendra Patel for over an hour in visitors' room and didn’t allow him to go to his office.

Meanwhile, VNSGU vice-chancellor Shivendra Gupta said, "The MoU has been signed based on syndicate’s resolution. Approvals from various university bodies are yet to be taken. The MOU is not final as yet."

Title: Turning deaf ears to noise pollution
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

More alarming is that noise levels during night time were also quiet high compared to the required limit

SURAT: The Diamond city know for its vibrant lifestyle and exuberant night life has a reason to be worried.

A study by the environment cell of the civil engineering department of Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT) has found that noise levels in the city were significantly higher than than the norms prescribed by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB). What is more alarming is that noise levels during night time were also quiet high compared to the required limit.

The noise mapping study was conducted by Dr B N Tandel, assistant professor, environment cell at SVNIT and his PhD student Dipesh Sonaviya at five location in the west zone of the city. The aim was to study the propagation of urban road traffic noise in the areas along with field measurements. “Vehicular sound is major source of noise pollution in urban areas and therefore many countries have noise emission limits for vehicles. They also have legislations to regulate traffic noise,” Tandel told TOI. “We also need to realise the consequences of high noise pollution on human health.”

“The study findings should worry us all. It indicates that the noise levels are significantly higher even during night time and it could have serious health implications on residents,” he added.

Of the total seven zones in Surat, the researchers selected west zone for noise mapping because it includes diversified activities like vehicles, residences, commercial establishments and corporate offices. Three road stretches of 1 km each, forming a triangle, were selected for collecting noise level data. In all five locations were monitored for noise levels.

“We have ignored the ill effects of noise pollution in the study. This is a progressive problem and therefore people do not realise it as a serious issue. But it can affect work productivity as well as sleep pattern. More studies need to be conducted with the help of medical fraternity about effects of noise pollution on humans physiology and psychology,” Tandel added.

Title: SMC prepares to recover property tax dues of Rs 385 crore
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Surat Municipal Corporation ( SMC ) has pulled up its socks to recover property tax dues to the tune of Rs385 crore from the denizens of the Diamond City before March-end.

Against total demand of Rs1,385 crore in 2019-20, SMC has been able to collect Rs1,013 crore in property tax till date. In 2018-19, against total demand of Rs1,234 crore, the civic body fell short of its target and could collect only Rs1,013 crore by March 2019.

Official sources said there are 19.54 lakh residential units in the city. The highest demand for property tax worth Rs284 crore has been raised from south zone having areas such as Udhana, Bamroli, Pandesara, Bhestan-housing textile dyeing and printing mills, powerloom units, chemical factories, textile ancillary units, residential and commercial properties. The civic body has been able to recover Rs195 crore till date from south zone.

Till date, against demand of Rs167 crore from east zone, SMC has been able to collect Rs134 crore. Similarly, against demand of Rs185 crore from south east zone, the civic body has been able to collect Rs150 crore. From Athwa zone, collection was Rs134 crore against the demand of Rs166 crore.

Kamlesh Naik, in-charge of finance department of SMC, said, “Till now we have been able to collect 73% of property tax from the city and aim to achieve 95% of the target by March-end. The campaign for collecting pending tax has been going on in the city and we have been regularly sealing properties whose owners had failed to pay up the taxes.”

Naik added, “We are also putting up notices outside buildings and commercial properties mentioning names of tax defaulters. If they fail to comply, then we would have to take harsher action by severing water and drainage connection of their properties.”

Title: TAPI Utsav enthrals Surtis, brings culture alive
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

The festival began on Wednesday and is scheduled to run till March 1

SURAT: The five-day TAPI Utsav at Science Centre in the city has brought alive art, craft , music , dance and cinema of the diamond city with artistes from all walks of life interacting with participants. The festival began on Wednesday and is scheduled to run till March 1.

TAPI stands for The Art Promotion Initiatives and is a biannual event.

TAPI Utsav was conceptualised in 2014 and since then has become city’s festival identifying with quality-oriented cultural activities on a single platform. This year, TAPI Utsav, which has been christened as TU2020, is organised by the joint effort of the trust, a core group , students and support from like minded individuals and industrialists and entries are free and open for all.

“Besides talks and film screenings, various workshops like Blue Printing nature art, watercolour technique, paper pulp casting, origami, POP carving, 3D sculpture, Photography , Molela, Acrylic demonstration, Wooden Toy and Wood cut have been a major attractions,’’ said Binita Pandya , one of the organisers of TAPI Utsav told TOI.

Title: Diamond workers plan strike to demand abolition of professional tax
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Surat Ratnakalakar Sangh (SRS) has threatened a two-day strike in the diamond industry to demand abolition of professional tax collected by the state government from diamond workers.

SRS president Jaisukh Gajera told TOI, “An urgent meeting of representatives of diamond workers’ community and office-bearers of SRS has been convened on Friday to take the decision on announcing a two-day strike in the industry over professional tax issue.”

Gajera added, “On February 10, we met deputy chief minister Nitin Patel in Gandhinagar and demanded abolition of professional tax for diamond workers. The minister informed us that the labour department falls under the jurisdiction of chief minister. There has been no favourable reply from the state government so far. Diamond workers earn on piece meal basis and yet they have to pay professional tax to the state government. Majority of workers are employed in small and medium diamond units and earn less than Rs15,000 per month.”

Gajera said Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) collects professional tax on behalf of the state government. The yearly collection of professional tax from the diamond industry has been pegged at Rs150 crore.

Title: Poster contest marks ease of living index survey
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

PATNA: A minimalist poster competition was organized by Patna Smart City Limited (PSCL) on Thursday in which participants made posters of famous places of the city. The competition was organized to create awareness among people regarding ease of living index (EoLI) survey and make them participate in it.

The first prize was bagged by Prajjwal Kumar and the second prize by Saumya Singh. The third prize went to Priyam and Aditi.

PSCL public relations officer Harshita said through such competitions, common people are being inspired to participate in ease of living index survey and give their views about Patna. “There are various questions in the survey like civic facilities for people, crime rate, health and education. Participation of common people is important because data of this survey will be used in policymaking,” said Harshita.

Participation of more number of people will also help cities perform better in this survey as 30% marks is on citizen feedback.

Altogether 114 cities are participating in the survey this time, including 100 proposed smart cities. In each city, at least 1% of population have to participate in the survey to qualify for Smart City competition. “Our target was 19,145 people and we have achieved it. Yet, more participation will help policymakers understand our needs in better way and also improve our EoLI rank,” Harshita said, asking people to click on the link https://eol2019.org/citizenfeedback and answer the questions.

Some of the questions which are being asked in the survey include affordable quality education in the city for children, cleanliness, drinking water facility and waterlogging problem.

Title: Appeal to file services via phone application
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: Chief commissioner (RTS) Swadheen Kshatriya heaped praises on the district administration on Thursday for having enlisted 81 more services under the Right to Service in addition to the 20 notified services of the state government.

Kshatriya was in Nashik district for a day to review the works carried out by the local self-governing bodies and the district administration.

Reviewing the works done by the Nashik Municipal Corporation, the Zilla Parishad, the land records and the district administration, Kshatriya expressed his satisfaction with the district administration for having added 81 services more to the Right to Service, besides the 20 services of the revenue department prescribed by the state government.

“This is a welcome step. I am sure the district collector will ensure delivery of the services is maintained throughout,” said Kshatriya addressing the authorities at the central hall of the district collectorate.

He further appealed to citizens to use the mobile application ‘Maharashtra RTS’ for getting the services.

“Through his application, the government has promised to deliver in some notified services and also taken the responsibility of pulling up those not delivering the services,” said Kshatriya.

Instead of going to the government offices, citizens can go to the the Aaple Sarkar Seva Kendras or even log on to the mobile application and file for their services they wish to be delivered.

“In case of non-delivery, all that citizens have to do is take up the issue with the seniors. It is up to the officers to ensure that the services are delivered to the citizens,” Kshatriya said.

Divisional commissioner Rajaram Mane assured to take up training and conduct workshops related to the Right to Service in the district.

Title: Massive search across Kerala for missing 6-yr-old Kollam girl
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kollam: Police have launched a search operation for a six-year-old girl who went missing from her house at Elavoor in Kannanalloor police limits in the district on Thursday.

Besides police, fire and rescue personnel, and local residents, several social media users across the state were trying to find Devananda aka Ponnu , daughter of Pradeep Kumar and Dhanya.

In her complaint to the police, Dhanya said Devananda had been missing since 10.15am on Thursday. The girl had followed her mother when the latter went to wash clothes near their house. The mother, however, asked the girl to go back.

Dhanya told police that she had seen the girl entering the house, but found the front door open and the girl missing on her return. “My daughter is not used to going and playing in the neighbouring houses. I have no reason to doubt anyone,” Dhanya said. The girl’s father is employed in Muscat.

On receiving the complaint, police launched a probe. Divers from the fire and rescue department extensively searched the Pallimon River (Pallikkalaar) near the girl’s house.

The police dog squad and many people from the neighbourhood also joined the search. Police also checked vehicles in the district.

As the news of the missing girl spread, several people, including celebrities, shared her photograph on social media.

Even as the search was progressing, a fake message started circulating, saying the girl had been found. Kannanalloor police warned of stringent action against those spreading fake news.

Later in the night, police formed a 50-member special investigation team under Chathannoor ACP to find Devanandana. The team includes cyber experts. Besides strengthening vigil at the district and state borders, all police stations across Kerala have been put on alert.

State child rights commission suo motu took a case. Late in the night, Kollam district collector and SP visited Dhanya at her home.

Title: IndiGo goes with HDFC Bk to launch rewards card
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Mumbai: HDFC Bank , Mastercard and IndiGo have come together for a co-branded credit card, which will offer flyers accelerated rewards for purchase of tickets from the private airline. This is the first time that the budget carrier will be having a rewards programme for customers.

The 6E Rewards XL card will entitle holders to complimentary air ticket worth Rs 3,000 on activation, 6E Prime benefits of priority check-in, choice of seat, and a complimentary meal. It will also provide 5% 6E Rewards on IndiGo transactions and 3% 6E Rewards on dining, entertainment and grocery transactions. The 6E Rewards card will enable cardholders to avail free air ticket worth Rs 1,500 on activation and 2.5% 6E Rewards on IndiGo transactions, among other benefits.

HDFC Bank is the largest private bank and has the largest credit card base of 1.4 crore credit cards in the country , while IndiGo is the largest private carrier in the country.

“We have been saying we have the best frequent flyer programme in the world, which is low fares. But we understand customers want some kind of rewards programme for their loyalty, which is why we have come out with such a programme,” said IndiGo chief commercial officer William Boulter.

This card has been tailored to allow customers to accrue accelerated reward points not only on IndiGo flights, but also on all types of spends such as shopping, dining and groceries. These points can be redeemed for IndiGo flight tickets and other travel benefits. We are confident that our co-branded credit card will be a valuable addition to our growing portfolio of products that make travel a truly rewarding experience,” said Parag Rao, country head, payment solutions and marketing, HDFC Bank.

Title: Travellers from Italy and Iran will have to undergo health screening
Content: THIRUVVANANTHAPURAM: With Covid-19 testing positive in 38 countries across the world, the threat perception has become much lighter in the state.The number of people under observation in the state came down to 135, out of which seven are in hospitals. As many as 16 people were removed from the list on Thursday, according to the office of state health minister K K Shailaja.Meanwhile, with positive cases widely getting reported in Iran and Italy , the state health department directed health cells in airports to screen all passengers who reach the state from these countries in direct flights. Passengers from China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Vietnam, Nepal, Indonesia and Malaysia are already being screened at the airports. Pointing out that those who had travelled from these countries or those who have any such travel history from February 10 onwards should be under observation for at least 14 days after reaching India, a statement from the minister’s office appealed to such travellers to strictly follow the instructions. Those without any symptoms should remain at home, while those showing symptoms should report at nearby hospitals with isolation ward facility, it said.On Thursday, 16 people who were on self-quarantine were removed from the observation list as per the revised protocol. Out of the 462 suspected samples sent to NIV, results of 451 are negative, and there’s no cause for concern on the health of those in hospitals, the statement said.

Title: ‘Centre must aid firms to fight virus impact’
Content: Mumbai: The central government should immediately step in to help out the Indian industry—especially the pharmaceutical sector— affected by the Chinese economic clampdown caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus infection, said experts at a talk held at the Indian Merchants Chamber on Thursday.Alternatively, the current impasse could be seen as an opportunity. “We could have a one-window clearance system to help Indian companies step in the vacuum caused by the Chinese impasse. We could turn this into ‘Advantage India’,” said IMC president Ashish Vaid.Naushad Panjwani, president (west), Indo American Chamber of Commerce, said the Indian government should help contain the economic crisis caused by coronavirus. “Many of our medicines and healthcare products are dependent on Chinese companies. The government has to step in and bring the pharmaceutical industry back on track by rejigging tariffs or regulations... It is an opportunity for the Indian companies if the government helps out,” he added.Infectious diseases specialist Dr Vasant Nagvekar from Lilavati Hospital said, “The SARS 1 outbreak in 2002-03 caused 10% mortality and the MERS virus caused 34% mortality. However, COVID-2019 has a mortality of 2-4%. It is highly contagious, but not as harmful as the other two.” IMC president Ashish Vaid said if the current economic situation continues, it would affect sectors such as oil, steel, chemicals, plastics and pharma. “Even the auto sector could be affected as would small traders who deal with buttons, zippers etc. Refrigerators and AC sector would be hit as compressors come from China.”

Title: Court examines Manju Warrier
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kochi: Trial in the actor rape case continued at the additional special sessions court on Thursday and the court examined actor Manju Warrier , who is a witness in the case.

The court, which decided to examine actors Bindu Panicker and Siddique on Thursday, postponed the same. Warrier, the 11th witness, reached the court in Kaloor around 9.30 am. All the accused, including Dileep, were present in the court.

Trial proceedings began at 11.05 am. Sources said that the chief examination of Manju by prosecution lasted for nearly 90 minutes and the cross-examination by defence counsel B Raman Pillai, who represents Dileep, continued for nearly an hour, after which the court adjourned for lunch.

Trial proceedings commenced again at 2.30pm and went on till 6.30pm. Sources said there was a heated debate between prosecution and defence counsels over the allegations that the accused were attempting to influence witnesses.

Panicker and Siddique, the 12th and 13th witnesses, waited at the court till 5.30pm, after which the court decided to examine them later.

Actors Geethu Mohandas, Samyuktha Varma and Kunchako Boban are to be examined in the court on Friday. On Saturday, the court is scheduled to examine filmmaker Shrikumar Menon. Actors Ramya Nambeesan and Lal have already been examined.

Pulsar Suni, Martin Antony, Manikandan, Vijeesh, Saleem, Pradeep, Charly Thomas, Dileep, Sanal Kumar and Vishnu are the 10 persons against whom charge has been framed by the court. The case pertains to the sexual assault on an actor on February 17, 2017.

Title: Varanasi: Village head sets self afire, brother blames her in-laws
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: The woman gram pradhan Reena Soni (40) of Kariaon village in Meerganj area of Jaunpur district died of burns under mysterious circumstances on Thursday. The police are investigating the matter.

According to reports, Reena, wife of Ravishankar Soni, allegedly set herself on fire at around 4am. Before her family members, who were sleeping, could rescue her, she sustained serious burns and died.

The police reached there on being informed. The body was sent for postmortem. The village head’s brother Brij Mohan has filed a complaint with the police accusing the woman’s in-laws of setting her afire.

Jaunpur SP (rural) Sanjay Rai also visited the village to take account of the incident. He said that the matter is being investigated, and appropriate action would be taken after receiving the postmortem report.

Reena was elected gram pradhan in 2015. She had two sons and two daughters.

Title: ‘Drone camera surveillance at Valmiki Tiger Reserve soon’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

PATNA: Valmiki Tiger Reserve ( VTR ) in West Champaran will soon be under the surveillance of a drone camera.

VTR officials said the drone camera will not only monitor animals and keep a count on them but will also help in assessing the entire reserve. Field director HK Roy said the camera will help the patrolling teams to keep an eye on the movement of animals, especially tigers and leopards. “The high-resolution drone camera will also help in gathering information and images, including the location of animals in case they try to escape from the tiger reserve,” Roy said.

He added, “On several occasions, wild animals flee from VTR and hide in sugarcane farms. It becomes quite difficult for our patrolling teams to locate them. The drone camera will not only help in tracing their locations but will also keep people safe from wild animals.”

Spread in an area of 901.07 sq km, the VTR comprises eight forest ranges with two divisions — Govardhana, Rangia, and Manguraha ranges in Division I and Harnapand, Chiutaha, Madanpur, Valmiki Nagar, and Ganauli in Division II. Thousands of mammals, birds, reptiles and butterflies can be sighted at VTR due to which keeping a check on them becomes very difficult.

“Order for procurement of drone camera has already been placed. After the procurement, patrolling teams at VTR will be trained by the supplier. It will be used for monitoring from mid-March. As of now, only one drone camera worth Rs3.5lakh will be used. If things go well, we will procure one more drone next year,” Roy said.

Meanwhile, the ecotourism package for the Valmiki Tiger Reserve has been in demand since its launch by the forest department on December 21 last year. Priced at Rs 1,500 per person, the two-day ecotourism package includes transportation from Patna to VTR, food and accommodation for 16 tourists. “The weekend tour package is witnessing good response as all the slots get booked within an hour or two. Besides, people can avail the tour package till June as tourism sector at VTR remains shut from July to September,” Roy said.

Title: Jaipur: Man held for objectionable post on FB
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Represemtaive Image

JAIPUR: A man was arrested by the city police for posting objectionable content on social media provoking communal disharmony on Wednesday. The accused was sent to 15-day judicial custody on Thursday.

The accused Harmanu Dhaliwal had written a Facebook post which allegedly was a provoking one for two communities. A person filed a complaint against the accused though the cops refused to divulge the complainant’s name.

Anil Kumar, SHO, Vaishali Nagar said, “We received a complaint that the accused had written objectionable post which could have led to communal violence. We confirmed if such a post had been written following which we arrested the accused.”

The case against the accused was registered under IPC sections 153 B (imputations, assertions prejudicial to national-integration), 295 A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs and others.

“We are keeping a close watch on social media to avoid and prevent any outward incidents especially which create communal discord. Strict action will be taken against those promoting any such activities. We are constantly monitoring various social media sites to check any such activities,” added the official.

Title: U’khand govt’s declaration of eco-sensitive zone of Rajaji Tiger Reserve will not hold as it violates buffer zone guidelines of NTCA, say wildlife activists
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Dehradun: A day after the Uttarakhand government in a cabinet meeting declared an area of 270 sqkm outside Rajaji National Park as eco-sensitive zone (ESZ), wildlife activists and scientists pointed out on Thursday that the government is yet to declare a ‘1-km area outward from the boundary of the tiger reserve’ as buffer zone as stipulated by guidelines of the National Tiger Conservation Authorty (NTCA).

They added that the proposal by the state government “is bound to get stuck in the ministry of environment and forests (MoEF) as it fails to address the important issue of ‘buffer zone’ as mandated by NTCA.” Buffer zone is an area inside a protected area which is intended to reinforce its conservation.

Eco-sensitive zones on the other hand are areas within 10km of a protected area, national park or wildlife sanctuary which are formed to minimise the negative impacts of certain activities (construction works, mining etc) around these protected areas.

Wildlife activists point out that there are around 95 villages which fall in the buffer area of Rajaji. With the cabinet decision of Wednesday including only 22 villages in the eco-sensitive zone, rest of the villages have been kept out of both buffer zone as well as eco-sensitive zone. This, they said, was a problem point.

A senior scientist from Wildlife Institute of India (WII), told TOI, “NTCA guidelines clearly state that all the tiger reserves in the country should have at least 1 km around the reserve’s boundary as buffer zone. And all pre-existing buffer zones are automatically a part of eco-sensitive zone.”

Interestingly, the government has provisioned for different activities to take place in ESZs like building hotel etc after obtaining permissions.

Reacting to this, Doon-based nature activist Reenu Paul said, “Once an area is declared ESZ, then there should be no clause of giving permission to villagers for any kind of work. The idea of giving permission via a ‘competent authority’ is nothing but methods to violate environmental laws. It is totally illegal and in violation of wildlife protection Act.”

Other activists also raised questions on the exclusion of around 803 villages in Rajaji from the ESZ. “This is nothing but a ploy to appease villagers,” said Vasu Kirti, an activist.

Meanwhile, reacting to the concerns, principal secretary of Uttarakhand forest department, Anand Bardhan, said, “These matters are being looked into by competent authorities. The proposal will go to the Union government from where we will get a final approval.”

Title: CM Rawat takes a dig at Cong’s ‘lantern yatra’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nainital: Taking a swipe at the lantern yatra launched by Uttarakhand Congress on Wednesday, chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat said on Thursday that the rally held by the opposition party was “more about finding Harish Rawat in state politics rather than searching for development under the BJP rule.”

CM Rawat, who was in Nainital on Thursday, said, “It is a matter of research as to whether the rally was aimed at finding development in the state or finding Harish Rawat, who had gone missing from the state politics. But the good thing is that Harish Rawat has finally been found.”

With the state government about to complete three years in office on March 18, the Congress party had taken out a symbolic rally in Haldwani with lanterns ostensibly to look for development works under the ruling BJP.

While speaking to mediapersons, CM Rawat said that the government will hold 70 events in 70 assembly constituencies of the state to showcase development works undertaken in the past three years. “We will give an account of every single penny that has been spent by our government in the past three years for development works,” he said.

The CM also inaugurated several schemes and projects worth over Rs 113 crore in Haldwani. This included a foundation stone laying ceremony of projects worth more than Rs 64.89 crore. Rawat also announced that a budget of Rs 20 crore would be spent on repairing and developing the secondary roads of Haldwani.

Addressing the gathering, CM Rawat said that more than 500 schools in the state now have smart classes and another 700 schools will soon have the facility. “All the anganwadi centres will have their own buildings and every village in the state will be connected by roads by 2022. Our government is also committed to building an ISBT in Haldwani and we are working to ensure that the Jamrani dam project provides water to the entire Terai region,” the CM said.

Title: UP: CBI lodges second FIR against Rotomac in Rs 36 crore cheating case
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Central Bureau of Investigation

LUCKNOW: The Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ) on Thursday lodged another FIR against Kanpur-based Rotomac Exim for duping Allahabad Bank to the tune of Rs 36 crore. It was alleged in the bank’s complaint that the company took laon using shell firms and didn’t pay back

The FIR was registered against the company’s promoters, Vikram Kothari and Rahul Kothari, on the charges of criminal conspiracy, cheating, forgery for the purpose of cheating, using forged document as genuine, falsification of accounts and criminal misconduct.

Earlier in February 2018, the CBI’s anti-corruption branch of Delhi unit had also lodged an FIR against the Kotharis on the basis of a complaint from Bank of Baroda for allegedly swindling over Rs 800 crore. The CBI had then arrested the two, but they are now out on bail.

The Thursday’s FIR was lodged on the complaint of Amarjeet Singh Hira, the deputy general manager of Allahabad Bank. The CBI in its preliminary investigation found that company and its promoters used shell firms without any genuine business transactions to seek loan.

The company forged and fabricated documents showing false bills of transaction to avail credit limit of Rs 50 crore, the CBI probe found. The company and its promoters also failed to pay back the loan, says the agency which also hinted at the role of many public servants in the fraud.

A CBI officer said that Allahabad Bank had sanctioned Rs Rs 42-crore loan to Rotomac on October 3, 2010, but did not get back the due amount with interest. The fraud was detected when the CBI probed the company’stransactions. After that, the bank also sold a property of the owners and got back Rs 6 crore, but Rs 36 core were still due. The ED had also attached assets worth Rs 177 crore in connection with money laundering probe against the Rotomac group in an alleged bank loan fraud of Rs 3,695 crore in May, 2018.

Title: NMC stops collecting user charge for lifting garbage
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has abruptly stopped collecting user charge for doorstep lifting of garbage.

Of the 6.5 lakh properties in the city limits, only 2.43% property owners have paid the user charge. “The NMC, which imposed user charge from August 2019 has so far been able to collect Rs10,05,110 from 15,812 property owners — mostly residential. Since the last couple of months, we have stopped collecting user charges,” confirmed a senior official from the solid waste management department.

The official said the NMC levied user charge after the state government had issued a resolution in July 2019 about the collection of ‘garbage collection user charges’ that the citizens had to pay for the service in their respective civic limits. The charges depend on how a municipal corporation is categorized and population. As the NMC falls under the B-grade category, each house was supposed to pay Rs60 as monthly charge for the service.

Educational and religious institutes, hostels and government/semi-government offices were to pay Rs120 as monthly charges for the service. Marriage and entertainment halls, single-screen theatres and purchase centres/multi-screen theatre too had to pay Rs2,000.

If the civic body had strictly implemented the GR, the NMC is likely to get revenue of around Rs3.5 crore per month under the head from around 6.5 lakh properties. The state government had made mandatory for the NMC to collect the charges of Rs60 per month from residential users, 90 from commercial followed by other categories. The NMC has selected 100 sanitary inspectors, 10 from each of ten zones, who were supposed to collect the charges from all properties.

As it was mandatory for the civic body to impose user charge, initially, the sanitation department employees tried to recover mandatory user charges but faced opposition from not only citizens but also from elected representatives.

Following directives from the then mayor Nanda Jichkar, the health department had submitted a proposal to levy user charge before the general body. Instead of okaying the proposal, it was referred to the health committee. Now, the ruling party and even the civic administration had kept it in the cold storage.

The civic body also failed to implement another important provision of the GR to slap fine on people not segregating garbage at source. The quantum for the fine for the first offence is Rs300. Every subsequent offence will invite a penalty of Rs500. “Neither the citizens are handing over segregated garbage nor the NMC has started imposing fine,” the officer admitted.

Title: Only paper trails, e-libraries at colleges virtually defunct
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Indore: While directorate of higher education (DHE) has been going hammer and tongs to digitize government colleges, e-libraries at most colleges still seem to virtually non-functional.

Despite the fact that set-up of e-library is counted as one of the parameters of evaluation in National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC), not all the government colleges of Indore district have one.

Moreover, colleges that have one either don’t have sufficient number of subscription or students are not made aware about its presence.

Govt Maharani Laxmi Bai Girls PG College (New GDC College) has set-up of 15 computers for e-libraries. However, they have no subscription of any site for e-books.

The college had taken subscriptions for journals, which costs Rs 5000 per year and has a set of 25 books that were downloaded free of cost from internet by librarian, principal of New GDC College Dr Kusumlata Nigwal said.

The college has set up for e-library and even has subscription of journals and Nigwal affirms that it can be accessed by undergraduate students.

Govt Holkar Science College and Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Government Arts and Commerce College (GACC) have e-library and the access is given to all students including undergraduate students. While Holkar has around 25 computers for e-library, GACC has around 10-15 computers that gives access to e-content subscribed by the institute.

The e-library is not getting used by students as most of undergraduate and postgraduate students are unaware of it. While Govt Mata Jija Bai Girls P G College (Old GDC) still hasn’t got set up for e-library yet, they have already applied for it.

“The department had invited applications for setting of e-libraries and we have already applied for it. We are waiting for their approval and funds. We will try to set it this year itself,” principal of Old GDC College Sumitra Waskel told TOI.

Title: Uddhav Thackeray: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on March 7
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

CM Uddhav Thackeray

AYODHYA: Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray is scheduled to visit Ayodhya on March 7 on the 100th day of his coming to power in a clear political signal to allies Congress and NCP that Shiv Sena’s core Hindutva agenda remains intact despite being in a secular alliance.

Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who reached Faizabad on Thursday to make arrangements for Uddhav’s visit told TOI that he would be meeting UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday.

To a query on whether the party was deviating from the common minimum programme laid out by the alliance, he said, “We don’t need a visa or permission from anybody to come to Ayodhya. Uddhavji will seek blessings from Ram Lalla . The basic tenets of Sena remain intact. Remember, he’s not visiting Ayodhya for the first time,” he said.

However, BJP’s grassroot workers in Ayodhya are not amused. Reacting to the Sena leader’s visit, BJP’s Ayodhya district president Sanjeev Singh said, “It’s move steeped in hypocrisy. Uddhav Thackeray humiliated Lord Ram the day he formed an alliance with those who term the Lord as imaginary. He formed the government in his hunger for power and buried idealism of Sena patriarch Bal Thackeray.”

However, the Sena’s biggest ally, Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) is in sync with Uddhav's Ayodhya tryst. Talking to TOI over phone, NCP national spokesman and minister in Maharashtra government Nawab Malik, said, “The Ayodhya issue is no more disputed. Every individual has the right to perform his religious duties. After SC’s verdict, everything is clear. So Uddhavji’s visit to Ayodhya is personal and no one has the right to comment.”

Title: Mission hopes for a LIFE line
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: LIFE housing mission which is basking in the glory of milestone achievement of completion of 2 lakh houses will now go into the most crucial third phase where the project officials will have to work out a solution to address three crucial factors — money, dearth of land and demand for housing.

The third phase was conceived to construct apartment complexes for those who did not have land and home. The final number of beneficiaries following verification stands at 1.06 lakh in the third phase. For this year, LIFE mission plans to complete 100 apartment complexes using dry construction pre-fab technology. The mission officials estimate that only around 7,000 beneficiaries could be accommodated in 100 apartment complexes.

The officials are hence trying to divert some of the beneficiaries from third phase to second phase mainly due to cost factor. Local bodies are being encouraged to purchase land, if possible, for these beneficiaries and then they can be given houses by spending Rs 4 lakh per beneficiary. The cumulative cost would be less than the government’s fund allocation (Rs 7 lakh) for a house under LIFE misssion.

When the mission began, each unit in an apartment complex was estimated to cost Rs 10.25 lakh; this estimate has now touched Rs 14 lakh per unit. The officials are hence pushing beneficiaries to opt for second phase where a house can be given at half the actual price required for a housing unit in an apartment complex.

“We estimate that around 27,000 of the beneficiaries included in the third phase could be given housing either directly in apartment complexes or in houses under second phase. Around 7,000 beneficiaries will be given housing through sponsorship in third phase. That would leave us with over 60,000 beneficiaries for whom a massive housing campaign will have to be launched,” said U V Jose, CEO, LIFE housing mission.

The project wing had initially estimated to find nearly 1,000 acres for apartment complexes. At present, the mission has identified 374.92 acres in 314 places which are owned either by various departments or by local government institutions. LIFE mission already runs on loan amount of Rs 4,000 crore from HUDCO , and Rs 425 crore as bridge loan from Ernakulam District Cooperative bank. The state budget for 2020-21 has pumped in another Rs 2,000 crore, but given the demand for housing and cost of private land required for apartments, this amount would scarcely meet the requirement. “At present we may not need another loan and even if it is required we have the support to go for it,” said Jose.

A housing tower which will come up in each district will have about 44 dwelling units in the housing complex. It shall be built with light gauge steel framed structure system in combination with pre-engineered steel structural system (PEB) to promote sustainable housing. The size of each unit shall be of plinth area 500sqft and minimum carpet area 400sqft in accordance with the prevailing guidelines of the LIFE Mission.

Title: Sambalpur farmers reiterate opposition to token system
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Farmers at the meeting in Sambalpur on Thursday

SAMBALPUR: Farmers of Sambalpur on Thursday opposed the existing centralised token system and demanded rectification of shortcomings in the existing system for procurement of paddy during the upcoming rabi paddy procurement season. The farmers have also threatened that they will not register themselves to take part in the rabi paddy procurement process if the government does not rectify the shortcomings. The registration for the rabi paddy procurement will begin from March 1.

Addressing the media after a meeting, adviser to the Sambalpur Zilla Krushak Surakhya Sangathan (SZKSS), Ashok Pradhan, said, “Farmers suffered due to the existing token system during this kharif paddy procurement. Many farmers could not sell their paddy as their token lapsed during the procurement. Similarly, paddy of many farmers remained unsold as they did not receive the requisite tokens to sell all the paddy they had produced. Many registered farmers also failed to sell their paddy as the government stopped the procurement in the district on February 23.” According to the policy of the government, the market yard should remain open till March 30 so that all the registered farmers could sell their kharif paddy, said a farmer.

Pradhan said before the kharif paddy procurement, the government had assured that the centralised token system would make the paddy procurement process transparent and reduce the role of middlemen. But because of the existing token system, many farmers had to resort to distress sale as they failed to sell their paddy in the market yards, he said.

He further said though a target was set to procure 30,55,860 quintal of paddy during this kharif, the food supplies and consumer welfare department stopped the process after procuring only 29,78,852. 96 quintal of paddy in the district.

“We would not tolerate this during the rabi paddy procurement process. We want the government to discuss with us to bring in the changes in the existing token system so that the farmers will not have to face problems during rabi paddy procurement,” he said.

Pradhan added, “The farmers of the district will not register themselves for taking part in the rabi paddy procurement process if the government does not hold discussions with the farmers’ outfit.”

Title: Toddy board will be formed soon, says CM
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The government is closing in towards formation of toddy board that has been a long-pending demand of labourers working in the toddy sector, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan said here on Thursday.

Inaugurating the golden jubilee celebrations of Kerala toddy workers’ welfare fund board, the chief minister said as many as one lakh people are working in this sector. At the same time, an uncertainty in the sector has affected the labourers. The government is duty-bound to rectify the issues and promote the sector, he said.

After the LDF government came to power, several steps have been taken to address the issues in the sector, the CM said. The government has revised and fixed the minimum wages of the labourers in this sector. At present, there are 27,384 labourers and 16,721 pensioners under the welfare fund. In addition to the schemes like accident insurance, scholarship, aid for family members after the death of a member, the government is also offering pensions on the basis of number of years that a member has served and the amount ranges from Rs 2,000 to Rs 5,000 per month.

Since April 2018, the members of the welfare fund board have been included in the comprehensive health insurance scheme also, that would offer health benefits up to Rs 5 lakh. Several families have been availing this benefit, the chief minister said.

Several other schemes like offering Rs 40,000 for marriage assistance for daughters of members, Rs 50,000 for those who have put in the highest period of service while retiring from each district, providing laptops for the children of members who have taken admission to post-graduate courses, etc. are some of the other schemes that the government has devised, he said.

It is in addition to all these that the government is coming up with life insurance scheme by joining hands with the LIC, in which a member’s family will receive Rs 1 lakh in the wake of natural or unnatural death of a member.

Title: Varanasi: Hoardings accusing BHU VC ahead of Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank's visit
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Hoardings demanding action against the vice-chancellor of Banaras Hindu University for alleged discrimination ... Read More

VARANASI: Ahead of the visit of Union HRD minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank on Thursday, several hoardings demanding action against the vice-chancellor of Banaras Hindu University for alleged discrimination with Hindi-speaking students, appeared in different localities of the city on Wednesday night. The Union minister was in the city to lay foundation of student’s activity centre, boy’s hostel and faculty residential block at IIT-BHU and to attend other functions.

The hoardings demanded action against the VC for alleged partiality done with the Hindi-speaking candidates during interviews held for position of assistant professors. Similar hoardings had also appeared before the recent visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

These hoardings, reading ‘Rajbhasha Hindi ki upeksha va apman kyon’ (why Rajbhasha Hindi is ignored and insulted) and ‘Rajbhasha Hindi ko Rashtrabhasha ghosit kiya jaye’ (Rajbhasha Hindi should be made Rashtrabhasha), could be seen in Lanka, Maldahiya and Ravindrapuri areas. They also demanded a judicial probe into the recruitment process of assistant professors.

“We strongly oppose the partiality done to Hindi-speaking candidates in the interviews for the teaching position,” said a fellow of BHU Dr Karn Kumar Singh, who had also faced an interview for the post of assistant professor at the department of Ancient Indian History and Culture & Archaeology in the first week of January.

He alleged that he was asked to answer only in English during the interview. The Hindi-speaking students had been opposing the biased attitude of the BHU authority towards Rajbhasah Hindi, he added. Similar hoardings had appeared earlier also during the international alumni meet of BHU in the city on January 17.

The controversy began after Hindi-speaking candidates, in interview for the post of assistant professor at the department of Ancient Indian History and Culture & Archaeology were allegedly suggested to learn English to qualify.

Earlier, a group of students had also staged demonstration on January 4 and submitted a memorandum to the office of registrar alleging that the Hindi-speaking candidates were misbehaved with and discouraged to take part in the interview. However, BHU spokesperson Rajesh Singh denied the allegation saying that the interview was conducted as per the prescribed norms and no one misbehaved with the candidates neither any partiality was done to them.

Title: 230 pilgrims sent back from Karipur
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kozhikode: More than 230 umrah pilgrims who were scheduled to travel to Saudi Arabia were sent back from the Karipur airport on Thursday following the temporary ban imposed by the kingdom for umrah visa holders as part of its Covid-19 precautionary measures.

The decision would affect the umrah plans of thousands of pilgrims from the state.

Around 90 pilgrims who were scheduled to fly in the SpiceJet flight from Karipur to Jeddah at 5.30am had to be offloaded as the airline authorities came to know about the decision just before take-off. Also, 15 passengers who were on visit visa were not allowed to travel.

As many as 88 umrah pilgrims who were to travel in the Saudi Arabian Airlines (Saudia) flight to Jeddah too could not travel along with 43 pilgrim passengers of an Etihad Airways flight.

It was late on Wednesday night that the Saudi authorities announced a temporary ban on those entering the kingdom for umrah and/or visiting the Prophet’s Mosque in Medina. The entry of tourist visa holders from countries with confirmed coronavirus outbreaks, according to criteria established by Saudi authorities, has also been temporarily suspended.

Many passengers who had completed check-in and wearing the customary dress as part of the umrah pilgrimage shared their disappointment on not being able to undertake the pilgrimage.

“We are deeply saddened that the pilgrimage had to be called off at the last moment,” said a pilgrim who arrived at the airport.

Saudi Arabian Airlines officials however informed trade partners in the afternoon that passengers holding employment, work visit visas, business visit visas and family visit visas can be accepted for travel.

P V Vijesh, manager at Al Hind Tours and Travels said they were looking forward to a good umrah season with around 400 pilgrim bookings per month and the decision would certainly affect business.

Title: Rajasthan CM Gehlot questions central govt over Justice Muralidhar's transfer
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020
