Jaipur: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday questioned the transfer of Delhi High Court Judge S Muralidhar and asked the Centre what message it was trying to convey to the masses.

The notification of Justice Muralidhar's transfer to Punjab and Haryana High Court came late on Wednesday evening, on a day when a bench headed by him expressed “anguish” over Delhi Police’s failure to register FIRs against alleged hate speeches by BJP leaders Parvesh Verma, Kapil Mishra and Anurag Thakur.

“What message is the central government trying to convey by transferring Justice Muralidhar who showed his resentment against police inaction during Delhi violence and their failure to act against BJP leaders for their hate speeches,” Gehlot tweeted on Thursday.

“People have so much faith in the judiciary and the government’s attempts to undermine the justice system are very unfortunate,” he said.

Justice Muralidhar while conducting a special hearing at his residence on Delhi violence had said the court would not allow a repeat of 1984 to occur on its watch and directed police ensure safe passage to the injured.

Title: Delhi Riots Latest News: Gokulpuri drain of horror throws up two more bodies
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chand Bagh

NEW DELHI: A day after the discovery of an IB official’s body in a Chand Bagh drain, two more bodies were found floating in Gokulpuri drain near Ganga Vihar junction on Thursday morning. The news spread like wildfire and the authorities started sifting through the clogged drains in northeast Delhi to check if there were more bodies of riot victims stuck in them.

Anil Tyagi, employee of irrigation and flood department, said that bloated bodies were found stuck in floating garbage around 8am on Thursday. “As the news spread, a crowd started building up. But since curfew is imposed in the area, forces soon arrived and dispersed the gathering,” he added.

Both the bodies were removed around 11am. They were not identified till Thursday evening.

When TOI visited the area around 2.30pm, flag marches were being carried out in the colonies aligned along the length of the drain. “Section 144 has been imposed and shoot at sight orders have been received. People are being requested to go to their houses,” a senior police officer was heard announcing on the loudspeakers.

Ranjeet Kumar (62), a resident of Bhagirathi Vihar, claimed that the deceased did not belong to the locality and his body might have flown from Mustafabad.

The garbage-strewn drains were being scanned by civic officials and police for bodies. A joint meeting in this regard was also held among officials of irrigation and flood department, East Delhi Municipal Corporation and police. EDMC commissioner Dr Dilraj Kaur and spokesperson Arun Kumar later said that the civic body was ready to provide all necessary help to police for the discovery of bodies.

TOI also spoke to the relatives of a few other riot victims whose bodies were fished out of the drains earlier.

Musharraf’s body was found in the Chand Bagh drain. “We went everywhere but did not find him until someone known to Musharraf (35) told us that he was thrown into the drain. When we could not find him in the drain, we visited GTB Hospital on Thursday morning and found his body there,” said Farheen, the victim’s sister.

Mohseen’s (24) body was found in Bhajanpura drain. “Around 5pm on Tuesday, he had to come to Bhajanpura for some work. A mob surrounded his car and asked him to remove his pants. He managed to call up one of his friends. But before anyone could do anything to save him, the men bashed him and threw him in a drain,” said Waris Ali Khan, Mohseen’s uncle.

Title: GHMC approves eight development proposals
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation

HYDERABAD: The GHMC standing committee approved eight proposal on Thursday, including one to privatise sanitation projects at tourist places for two months. An administrative sanction of Rs 54 lakh was also approved.

Proposal to install 155 new traffic junctions and 98 pelican signals was approved.

Title: Thief enters flat using key, steals gold worth Rs 1.25L
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: Gold ornaments worth Rs 1.25 lakh were stolen from a flat in Vrindavan Nagar between January 28 and February 20.

An unidentified person allegedly stole the ornaments by entering the house using a key kept hidden inside a shoe in a shoe rack outside the flat.

The case was registered on Wednesday.

Complainant Digambar Patil, a 58-year-old resident of Pride apartment, had gone out of town with his family. The Patils had locked the flat before leaving, but had left a key in the shoe rack for a relative who was supposed to come home in their absence.

According to the police, an unidentified person may have kept a close watch on the movement of the family members. On finding a suitable opportunity, the thief entered the house and stole the ornaments.

The complainant said that the person has allegedly stolen the gold ornaments worth Rs 1.25 lakh kept in the cupboard. The person also closed the doors before leaving to ensure that no one in the neighbourhood suspected that the flat had been burgled.

The police suspect that it was done by a person who knew the family members and their arrangement of keeping the house keys in the shoe rack outside.

“Somebody must have kept a close watch on the members of the family. The thief may have heard them talk about the arrangement or may even have seen them actually keep the key there,” the police said. The police suspect this person may even have taken some insider’s help to figure out when the family would be out of the house for a long duration.

The police said they are investigating the matter. A habitual criminal’s involvement was not ruled out either.

Title: Wheels and gears are driving Chandigarh to tears
Content:
Representative Image

TimesView Driver training and testing is the best way to ensure good driving skills, which in turn leads to better road safety practices. Automation in driver testing, which includes use of devices like pole-mounted video cameras along the test track, test the driving skills of the applicant in a precise way and rule out human error and bias. This of course makes it tougher for the applicants to clear the driving test and brings down the success rate. However, the flip side is that it turns out drivers who are confident behind the wheel

CHANDIGARH: City residents have a poor pass percentage not only in driving test on the new sensor-equipped automated test track at Chandigarh Traffic Park in Sector 23, but also in the learner’s licence test at Registration and Licensing Authority (RLA) office in Sector 17.As per data compiled by the RLA in the past one year (between January 19, 2019, and January 19, 2020), 60% applicants failed in the learner’s licence test.According to figures, 49,797 applicants appeared in the learner’s licence test between this period, out of which only 19,920 managed to clear it and 29,877 failed.RLA secretary, Virat, said there were 25 objective questions in the learner’s licence test and the applicant has to solve a minimum of 15 questions. He said they have streamlined the system so that applicants do not face inconveniences during the entire process at the RLA. “An applicant is given multiple choice questions and he has to submit it within a stipulated time,” he added.Lauding the system, Pooja Thakur, who cleared learner’s licence test in the first attempt, said she had applied through the online method and did not face any inconvenience.For the regular driving test at Chandigarh Traffic Park, the pass percentage is not any better. According to the data compiled by the RLA for the past six months, between July 1 and December 31, 2019, only 51% cleared the test in the first attempt.

Title: FIR by BJP neta nailed Azam Khan & kin
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Azam Khan

LUCKNOW: An FIR lodged by a BJP leader nailed the SP stalwart and his family in his bastion that finally threw him behind bars. Akash Saxena, convenor of party’s small-scale industry cell and son of former UP minister Shiv Bahadur, lodged the FIR at Ganj police station in Rampur on January 3, 2019.

According to the FIR accessed by TOI, Azam’s son, Abdullah, had two certificates with different birth dates. The first was issued by Rampur Municipal Corporation on June 28, 2012, bearing the registration number RNPB 2012-03857. An affidavit was sworn by his father, Azam Khan and his mother, Tanzeen Fatima in which Abdullah’s place of birth has been recorded as Rampur. Another birth certificate bearing number NNLKO-B-2015-292611 was issued by Lucknow Municipal Corporation on January 21, 2015, where Abdullah’s place of birth has been shown as Lucknow.

The FIR further states the first document was used for Abdullah’s passport while the second was used for affiliation and registration of Mohammed Ali Jauhar University, where he’s chief executive officer. This formed the basis of the FIR against Azam, his wife Tanzeen and son Abdullah and they were charged with providing false evidence, cheating, forgery, forgery for purpose of cheating. Akash had also got an FIR lodged against Azam Khan in May 2017 at civil lines police station of Rampur district for his remarks against Armymen.

Title: ‘RSS follows Savarkar’s spirit of nationalism’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh held ‘Navotsah 2020’ (demonstration of group exercises, exhibition and competition... Read More

Nagpur: As Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) workers displayed their skills in martial arts, like unarmed combat and stick wielding, sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat said the organization is committed to the spirit of nationalism as propagated by Vinayak Damodar Savarkar.

Reciting a few lines from the poem written by Savarkar — ‘Jari uddhara née vyaya tichya ho saacha, haa vyartha bhaar vidyecha’, which roughly translates into — all the learning is futile if it is not used for the nation, Bhagwat said RSS is an organization that implements his message in its entirety.

The Nagpur unit of RSS held a display of physical activities like yoga, and martial arts at Yeshwant Stadium on Thursday. Usually, such mass displays are held during Vijayadashmi function when RSS marks its foundation day.

Senior RSS functionaries said it was a display of the training undertaken by workers during Hindu calender year. Even two years ago, a similar function was held at Chitnis Park.

On the training, Bhagwat said it is an integral part of a swayamsevak’s life which is practised like a strict penance. Strength is one of the requisites for achieving any goal, he added.

“However, this should come with self control. On the RSS’ nature of activities, he said, in the organization, more than individual betterment, the motive is on achieving a common goal of serving the nation. Each individual is committed to the nation and any endeavour to achieve it is done with the objective of deriving more strength to serve the nation,” he said.

Earlier during a function at Hingna, sarkaryawah (general secretary) of RSS Bhaiyyaji Joshi spoke to an agency about the riots in Delhi. He said nobody has the right to take law into hands and the Centre should ensure that peace is restored which has been wrecked by communal violence.

“Necessary action should be taken to restore law and order in the national capital. The government should establish peace in the areas where there is ‘ashanti’ (unrest),” he said.

Communal riots, which broke out in various parts of northeast Delhi over the amended citizenship law on Sunday, have so far claimed 34 lives. More than 200 people were injured in riots in the national capital where the police department comes under the Union home ministry.

Title: 93 farmers in Jalgaon oppose selling land for 3rd rail track
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: Opposition by 93 farmers in Jalgaon district, who have been protesting against the sale of land through the direct settlement method, has delayed a major Railway project.

The project — laying of the third track between Jalgaon and Manmad junctions — was discussed on Thursday during a video conference between Union railway minister Piyush Goyal and chief secretary of Maharashtra Ajoy Mehta.

Manmad junction is along the Central Railway route, between Mumbai and Bhusawal divisional headquarters. It falls within the district of Nashik and is 73 km away from the Nashik Road railway station. Jalgaon junction is 160 km from Manmad junction on the same route.

“The third railway track is vital for the Railways’ growth in the region as the Jalgaon-Manmad section, with just a pair of tracks, is an extremely busy line. A third track is being constructed , but the land acquisition process has been delayed because of the farmers’ opposition,” said a senior officials from the Jalgaon district collectorate.

The Railways has laid a third track between Bhusawal junction and Jalgaon junction. A fourth line is under construction. This construction needs to be finished soon to ease congestion. But in Jalgaon district, 93 farmers who own some 5.29 hectare between them, are not ready to part with their properties. Currently, there are 26 farmers with 2.46 hectare who are opposing the direct land purchase in the Jalgaon revenue sub-division. In the Pachora sub-division, there are 52 farmers with 2.47 hectare and in Chalisgaon, there are 15 farmers with 0.36 hectare, the official said. The farmers have been demanding the price of Rs 25 lakh per hectare. This is despite a pricing formula that was already decided by the district level committees.

“The farmers are not ready sell through the direct purchase method, which gives them certain additional incentives besides the rate that has been announced. This is by withdrawing the their rights to challenge the government decision in high court,” the official said. He said the government agencies will now renew talks with the farmers. If the talks fail, the administration will have no choice but opt for the compulsory land acquisition programme, in which the incentives will be withdrawn.

Title: Man kills uncle for planning to marry a woman from lower caste
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

AGRA: A 26-year-old man allegedly strangled his uncle to death with the help of his friend, fearing that he would marry a woman of lower caste.

Sudhakar Sharma was missing since January 28. His body was recovered on February 23 from a well near Pithauli railway station of Shahganj police jurisdiction. On February 26, Sudhakar’s sister-in-law Vimlesh Sharma lodged an FIR against unknown persons.

Saleem Ahmad, station house officer (SHO) of Shahganj, said, “During investigation, we found Nikhil Sharma ’s Aadhaar card from the well, in which Sudhakar’s body was dumped. During questioning, Nikhil claimed he feared his uncle will marry a woman from a lower caste. Sudhakar and his widow sister-in-law Vimlesh had equal share in ancestral property. Sudhakar, who was in his early 40s, was planning to marry a woman from Bihar.”

“This rattled his nephew Nikhil, who expressed his displeasure and told Sudhakar that it will bring bad name to the family and no family will tie relation with their family,” said the police officer.

Title: Justice Ravi Malimath from Karnataka to assume office soon as 11th U’khand HC judge
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nainital: The Centre has notified the transfer of Karnataka high court judge Justice Ravi Vijaykumar Malimath to the Uttarakhand high court.

A notification to this effect was issued by the ministry of law and justice on Wednesday. The notification comes after the Supreme Court Collegium had in its meeting on February 12 recommended the transfers of three high court judges.

Once Justice Malimath joins the Uttarakhand HC , there will be a total of 11 judges in the court, including Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan. The 58-year-old Justice Malimath was enrolled as an advocate in January 1987 at Bengaluru and he practised in constitutional, civil, criminal, labour and service matters mainly at the Karnataka HC.

Reacting to the appointment of Justice Malimath, lawyers at the Nainital high court expressed happiness as the total number of judges at the court has now reached its sanctioned limit.

The lawyers said that the full strength of judges will help in speedy disposal of matters and clearance of long-pending cases as well.

Meanwhile, Uttarakhand high court on Thursday ordered the personal appearance of the head of the Special Investigation Teams (SIT) probing the SC/ST scholarship scam.The HC also ordered private educational institutions that have been named to deposit Rs 50 lakh within two days after some of them expressed willingness to deposit the money that is alleged to have been siphoned off in the scam. The case will be heard next on March 4.

Title: It is likely to rain today, tomorrow
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

tnn

Chandigarh: Brace for clouds and showers. For, the Chandigarh meteorological department predicts rain in Tricity on Friday and Saturday.

“The approaching western disturbances will bring showers, which will drop the temperatures. The city is expected to receive around 20mm of rainfall on Friday and Saturday,” said the department director, Surender Paul

On Thursday, the maximum temperature was recorded at 23.9 degrees (a degree below the normal) and the minimum at 15.1 degrees (5 degrees above the normal). Generally cloudy skies and thundershowers have been forecast for Friday.

“Thunderstorms accompanied by gusty winds exceeding 45 kmph are likely in parts of Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh late on Friday. The spell might bring along hailstorm/lighting in isolated parts of Punjab and Haryana,” stated a warning issued by weathermen.

Title: Project report of Jaipur Metro Phase II ready, work to start soon; Gehlot assures the house
Content:
Ashok Gehlot (File Image)

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said the project report of Jaipur Metro Phase II from Sitapura to Ambabari is ready and the work will start soon.He asserted to make and execute the long-term planning of connecting Jaipur Metro upto Chomu-Bassi-Bagru and Chaksu.Gehlot slammed the BJP-led government at the Centre for not providing enough financial aid to the state in various projects and urged the MLAs of BJP to put collective efforts in pursuing the issue.While giving the budget reply at the state legislative assembly, Gehlot also made some announcements for medical, health and other departments. The new announcements included – creating 2,000 new posts of medical officers, setting up of 4D sonography machines at the medical colleges situated in district headquarters, starting of bike ambulance services for the Walled City and Jodhpur as pilot project.“We have prepared the project report for the Jaipur Metro Phase II from Sitapura to Ambabari and will start the work soon. Also, we are aiming at connecting various parts of Jaipur, especially its outskirts including Bassi , Bagru, Chomu and Chaksu with metro as we have to plan and anticipate to the need of Jaipur after 25 years,” Gehlot said.He added that people in the state have welcomed the ‘Saat Sankalp (seven pledge) taken by the government in the budget. “MLAs of opposition alleged that we have not done much in our governance so far. Let me clarify that we brought our budget in July, 2019, and since then we are working for various projects in the right direction,” he added.He questioned why the Centre is giving merely 50% in various projects. “The previous BJP government has ruined our planning for the refinery in its five years of governance. It was a joint venture of the Union and state governments,” he added.Meanwhile, Gulab Chand Kataria, leader of opposition, termed the state budget just a jugglery of figures. “Except for medical and health, you have not enhanced the budget and people in the state have been misled. Many of the announcements are old,” he said.

Title: Officials’ training for NPR, census temporarily stalled
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: The National Population Register ( NPR ) and census training of district and mandal level officers has been stalled temporarily in some districts due to the ongoing Pattana Pragati programme. The training was supposed to be given to the officials between February 19 and March 15. However, the dates were clashing with the Pattana Pragati, that commenced on February 24.

“The two-day training programme involves an orientation for the officials who will be in charge of collecting the mandal and block level information for NPR and the census,” a highly placed official told TOI.

Though the training schedule did not mention a session on NPR, officials said that household listing operation of census invariably involves NPR. The household listing will be carried out along with NPR between April 1 to September.

Two-three officials from the municipality and revenue department will be in-charge of each mandal. The training for a supervisor will begin shortly after district officials’ training. All the officials will be taught data collection on mobile applications. Masters trainers for each district have been deployed.

Title: Government committed for upgrading education, will provide best infra to institutions: Minister
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

VARANASI: Union human resource development minister, Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’ said on Thursday that the Union government is committed for upgradation of education and will provide best infrastructure to top institutions . Pokhriyal also praised IIT (BHU) for its contribution to development through social entrepreneurship development.

Pokhriyal laid the foundation stone of three new buildings, including faculty housing phase-II, Morvi hostel-II for students, and Annie Besant Lecture Complex Annexe, at IIT (BHU) on Thursday.

An MoU regarding a 21-day induction programme for new students in all certified institutions was also signed between IIT(BHU) and All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) in presence of the minister.

Speaking on the occasion, Pokhriyal said, “The government is committed for upgradation of education through excellent infrastructure in top institutions. I am happy that IIT (BHU) is contributing for development of the area through social entrepreneurship development under its social obligations.”

IIT (BHU) is working with UP government in the fields of defence technology and precision engineering, and can help promote agricultural industries under the National Agricultural Development Scheme, he said.

IIT (BHU) director Prof Pramod Kumar Jain said the 21-day induction programme for new students would be conducted at all AICTE-certified institutions.

“The induction programme was first started by IIT (BHU). Under the agreement, IIT (BHU) will be responsible for development of resource material in form of printed/ audio lectures/MOOCs to AICTE for smooth running of the programme. The main objective of the programme is to apprise students with the new environment, help them adapt and establish harmony with seniors and teachers. The programme also includes physical activity, creative arts, cultural and extra-curricular activities,” he added.

A joint committee of IIT (BHU) and AICTE will evaluate the programme in educational institutions across the country. Besides, workshops will also be conducted for teachers of other colleges to train them on running the programme.

The event was attended by BHU vice chancellor Prof. Rakesh Bhatnagar, member secretary of All India Council for Technical Education, Prof. Rajive Kumar and others.

Title: 5 days on, Sector 32 PG owner arrested
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

tnn

Chandigarh: Five days after three girls were killed as a fire broke out at their PG accommodation in Sector 32, police arrested the house owner, Gaurav Aneja, from the city late on Wednesday night.

The PG accommodation operator, Nitesh Bansal, has already been arrested and is lodged in jail. The third accused, Nitesh Popli who operated the PG along with Bansal, is still at large.

“On a tip-off, Aneja, a resident of Sector 30, was arrested from Sector 32. He had given his house on rent to Bansal, who was running a PG facility there. We are on the lookout for Popli,” said a cop.

Aneja was produced before a court on Thursday that sent him to judicial custody.

Three students — Riya, 19, of Kapurthala, Prakshi Grover, 20, of Kotkapura, and Muskan, 21, of Hisar — were killed and two others injured after a fire tore through their PG facility on February 22. Riya was pursuing a course from Alliance Francaise in Sector 36. Muskan was an MCom student and Prakshi of BBA at SD College, Sector 32.

Their friends Jasmine and Femina were on the second floor when they heard cries for help. Realising they would be trapped, the two jumped from the balcony of the second floor into the backyard of the adjoining house to escape the blaze. Both had received injuries.

Four fire tenders had taken about one-and-a-half hours to douse the flames. The first floor was gutted.

Police said Muskan and Prakshi were found under a bed and Riya in a washroom. Riya and Prakshi had died of asphyxiation and Muskan was charred to death.

Police had booked the three — Aneja, Bansal and Popli — under sections 304 (punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder), 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others), 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the IPC.

Title: Chandigarh: Manimajra 24x7 water dream gets out of pipeline
Content:
The municipal corporation will look after its operation and maintenance (O&M) for 15 years at a cost of around... Read More

CHANDIGARH: Decks have finally been cleared for the Rs 160-crore pilot project of 24x7 water supply in Manimajra . It has been decided that Chandigarh Smart City Limited (CSCL) will do the entire capital work (initial task of setting up and starting the project) of this first-of-its-kind venture that will start at a cost of around Rs 70 crore.The municipal corporation will look after its operation and maintenance (O&M) for 15 years at a cost of around Rs 90 crore and collect the water bills. The selected company will be given 24 months to complete the capital works and hand it over to the authority concerned.The matter was also discussed during the MC monthly house meeting on Tuesday, where consent was accorded to the proposal for capital works by CSCL and operation and maintenance by the MC.During a detailed survey for the project, CSCL had found that at present Manimajra has 55% non-revenue water (NRW) of the total supplied potable water. This was either going in theft or wastage through internal leakages in pipelines. The survey has also gathered other details for initiating the project, like Manimajra has 13,700 connections of water supplied by the MC and a population of 1.4 lakh. The plan has been prepared with the future projection of 1.8 lakh population and to run it at least till 2051.NP Sharma, chief general manager of the CSCL, said, “The selected company will be given a target to bring this NRW from existing 55% to 15% in seven years in a phased manner by using the latest technology with regular monitoring of each house’s water consumption through technical surveillance and other methods. The tender document is ready to be put up before the technical committee of the smart city. The tender will be called by March-end and if all goes well, the work will be allotted to the selected company by April-end.”

Title: Legend Roger Waters recites anti-CAA poem
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Roger Waters (AP photo)

NEW DELHI: A month after ‘Sab yaad rakha jayega’ (Everything will be remembered), a poem penned by Mumbai-based Aamir Aziz in protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act went viral online, Pink Floyd co-founder and guitarist Roger Waters read out an English translation of it to protesters at a march in London. At a gathering that demanded release of jailed Wikileaks founder Julian Assange on February 22, Waters described Aziz as a “young poet and activist in Delhi” who is involved in a fight against “fascist, racist Citizenship law”. He added, “I think this kid’s got a future.”

Waters, who played the bass, and also wrote songs for the iconic band — two decades ago he staged one of the largest rock concerts in history, ‘The Wall - Live in Berlin’, with a reported attendance of 4,50,000 — said, “Julian is why we are here today, but this is no parochial protest. We are part of a global movement that might be the beginning of the global enlightenment, which this fragile planet so desperately needs.”

Pink Floyd’s ‘The Dark Side of the Moon’ (1973), ‘Wish You Were Here’ (1975), and ‘The Wall’ (1979) became massive hits worldwide. By the early 1980s, the band had become one of the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful groups of all time.

As news spread that Waters was caught on camera quoting Aziz, “Everything will be remembered. Kill us, we will become ghosts and write of your killings, with all the evidence...”, the 29-year-old said he was surprised at his own “popularity”.

Talking to TOI on Thursday, Aziz, an alumnus of Delhi-based Jamia Millia Islamia, said, “I am at a loss for words. I do not know how to react to this... It is a matter of pride and honour for me.”

Aziz said he felt compelled to write the lines because it was something “he felt strongly for”. The poem was written on January 11, a few days after the attack on Jawaharlal Nehru University students protesting against fee hike. He had also performed it at an anti-CAA protest in Hyderabad on the eve of Republic Day. The Patna-native told TOI that he plans to continue writing on love, life and social issues.

At least two of his poems talk about victims of mob lynchings in India. ‘Achche din blues’, released a few days before the 2019 Lok Sabha polls, which makes multiple references to demolition of Babri Masjid, also mentions two Muslim cattle traders killed in Jharkhand’s Latehar in 2016.

Another of his compositions, ‘Ballad of Pehlu Khan’, tells the tale of Khan, a dairy farmer from Haryana who was allegedly lynched by a mob of cow vigilantes in 2017 in Alwar. It reads: “Pehlu peshe se dairy kisan the, Bas khata itni si thi ki yahin paida huye, Aur, musalmaan the. (Pehlu was a dairy farmer. His only fault was he was born here. And that he was a Muslim).

After police crackdown on Jamia students on December 15, he wrote Jamia ki Ladkiyaan (The Women of Jamia) which spoke about women becoming the face of protests when police raised their sticks.

Title: ‘Grand’ summit planned in April
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: While saddled with the task of ensuring homes for the poor and surviving on loans worth over Rs 4,000 crore, LIFE Housing Mission is planning a mega housing summit this April in Kochi . The request for proposal (RFP), issued by LIFE mission, for selection of event management firm says ‘ Innovate build summit 2020 ’ is meant to transform the full spectrum of activities connected to housing construction through a national expo. It plans to engage event managers, with an average annual turnover of Rs 1 crore, a ‘grand, dynamic’ event complete with exhibition stalls, pavilions, multimedia halls, food courts, thematic conferences and workshops. The summit at Ernakulam collectorate is from April 24-26.

The summit will be held in an airconditioned expo area measuring 10,000 sq ft along with a non-AC conference area of same dimension. There will be an AC food area for VIPs (5,000 sq ft) and a normal food court spread across 5000 sq ft. RFP says that the event management firm must arrange travel and accommodation for delegates, organize luncheons, dinners along with speeches, plenary sessions, side events and workshops.

The summit is expected to attract 1,000 participants for the main conference in addition to the floating population for workshops, technical classes etc.

The pre-bid meeting of the event will be held on Friday and the timing and need for the event has raised eyebrows within LIFE mission. As per the RFP, only seven days has been given to the event management firm for submission of bid while it should be three weeks, said sources

The project cost is estimated at Rs 25 lakh, but given its scale, the amount is likely to exceed the estimate. While LIFE mission says the summit intends to identify disaster-resilient, innovative and sustainable alternative building materials and technology, Nirmithi Kendra and state housing board, line departments under housing departments, which are overseeing activities related to housing, are not in the picture.

Besides in March 2019, the Union ministry had organized an expo-cum-conference on construction technology as part of Global Housing Technology Challenge (GHTC). GoI undersecretary BK Mandal issued an office memorandum in 2019 which said that the challenge intends to involve all stakeholders including state governments. GHTC was launched as a platform to mainstream innovative and sustainable construction technologies in India’s affordable housing sector. LIFE mission had earlier invited project proposals from 16 alternative technology providers who were identified for GHTC for construction of LIFE towers.

LIFE mission CEO UV Jose said that the summit is planned to encourage cost-effective building solutions.

Title: HC upholds MAT order on senior medical officers’ salary
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Aurangabad: The Aurangabad bench of the Bombay high court recently upheld the order of the Maharashtra Administrative Tribunal (MAT) on ensuring parity in salaries of medical officers who were appointed before their junior medical officers, who, however, were getting increments more than the seniors.

P K Chavan and other 18 senior Class I medical officers had approached the MAT seeking directions for bringing their salaries on par with the juniors who were drawing higher salaries by a government resolution dated December 14, 2011.

Aggrieved by the MAT order, the state government approached the high court contending: “The Government Resolution, dated August 20, 2014, has been issued with an intention to benefit all the cadres and to overcome discrimination caused in their salaries.”

Lawyers Avinash Deshmukh and Shyam Patil, who represented the 19 medical officers, argued that “The present respondents (senior doctors) were promoted at an earlier point in time, but persons who were promoted/appointed after the introduction of the GR dated December 14, 2011, are drawing more salary. And that it is an elementary rule of service jurisprudence that a junior, similar in all respects, cannot be paid more salary than the senior. The tribunal has considered all the aspects of the matter and has rightly passed the order. The respondents were promoted in the Maharashtra Medical and Health Services Group-A (senior) prior to the introduction of the GR of December 2011.”

While dismissing the government petition on Februry, the bench comprising Justices S V Gangapurwala and Shrikant D Kulkarni observed: “It has been observed by the tribunal that the intent and purpose of the Government Resolution dated 20 August, 2014, was to remove the anomaly. The Government Resolution dated 20 August, 2014, was made applicable from the date of the Government Resolution and not with the retrospective effect. In view of that, the present respondents were not getting the benefit of Government Resolution dated 14.12.2011. For the interregnum period, i.e. between the Government Resolution dated 14.12.2011 and 14.12.2014, these respondents though seniors, were getting less salaries than their juniors. The very object and the purpose of bringing out the Government Resolution dated 20 August, 2014, was to do away with the disparity of the seniors getting less pay than their juniors. When the Government Resolution was to correct the mistake, then the same will have to be from the date, the disparity exist.”

While upholding the MAT decision, the HC observed: “The tribunal has rightly considered the said aspect. The view taken by the tribunal is a reasonable one. The interest of justice has been subserved by the order passed by the tribunal.”

Title: Explain measures taken to clean ponds: Telangana HC to GHMC
Content:
File photo of flowers and other puja material dumped in Hussainsagar after Bathukamma festival

HYDERABAD: The Telangana high court on Thursday asked the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation ( GHMC ) to explain the steps taken to clean various ponds in the city after Ganesh idols were immersed in them.A bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy issued notices to the state government and municipal authorities directing them to file counters by March 3. It was hearing a public interest petition which it took up on its own after coming across the plight of one such pond in Kukatpally .The hearing in the case would resume on March 5.GHMC, on its part, said 24 small ponds were set up in the city for devotees to immerse Ganesh idols during Ganesh Chaturthi. “What are you doing after these Ganesh and Bathukamma festivals are over? After these ponds are filled with idols and flowers, how are you cleaning them? How much time are you taking to do that?” the bench asked GHMC.GHMC counsel replied that they were cleaning the ponds first and in the second stage, ome species of fish were released into these ponds. “This is for cleansing the pond water,” he explained. The bench sought to know from him the progress of this new method after 2019 Ganesha and Bathukamma festivals. “Both were over by October. And its is three months now. Explain the progress you made till now,” the bench asked.To this, the counsel said that the commissioner had prepared a report and would file the same within a day or two. He sought some time to furnish a clear picture.As the main lakes of the city are getting damaged heavily on account of idol immersions, there was huge concern about the plight of the lakes and the ill-effects of the same on the city’s ecology. As a step towards curing this problem, GHMC had come up with the idea of digging smaller ponds near the main lakes or at alternative sites to encourage people to use these smaller ponds instead.One such smaller pond was dug up at Kukatpally and was lying neglected without cleaning. The bench saw one such photo published in vernacular media and took it up as a PIL.

Title: Lessons from Tasmania to Adyar poonga
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Adyar Poonga and ecologist Joss Brooks (inset)

CHENNAI: Community-based conservation centres play a major role when it comes to restoration of biodiversity, according to ecologist Joss Brooks , who has restored Pitchandikulam and Nadukuppam forest in Puducherry and Adyar Poonga in Chennai. Speaking on “Remembering the future garden” at MS Swaminathan Research Foundation on Thursday, Brooks said environmental education of villagers was necessary for restoration of biodiversity.

A lake restoration project that Brooks completed in Siruseri, according to him, could be replicated. “If what has been done in Siruseri is replicated several times, it will solve problems of Chennai,” he said, adding, the community, however, is the key to such initiatives. “Community members in respected areas need to monitor all activities closely. It is the community that should meet and decide how it would restrict buildings etc, not an outside authority; that is a sustainable model,” he said.

As an ecologist, Brooks has restored the Pitchandikulam forest in Auroville , which is today a mature forest, a community and education centre. In 2002, he embarked on environmental education of villages by setting up Nadukuppam Environment Education Centre in a village near Auroville. He also founded Pitchandikulam Forest Consultants, a business unit to provide environmental restoration services and is currently directing the restoration of biodiversity at Adyar Poonga in Chennai.

“I am an old gardener from Auroville,” said Brooks, pointing towards some community-driven initiatives which could restore what had already been there without introducing anything new. “A great example is how, in 2015, when Chennai was flooded, no water left the Auroville plateau. It was a sponge.” He also narrated how he restored water bodies in Adyar Poonga by removing huge piles of concrete debris.

Where did Brooks get the inspiration? Tasmania, he would say. He conducted many voyages using country boats along the Australian coast. “These travels helped me understand nature closely. I observed how its (Tasmania’s) indigenous people preserved nature by using traditional knowledge,” he said. However, it was the mass protest against the construction of Franklin Dam on the Gordon River in Tasmania in the early 1980s that made him think about nature seriously. The region had prehistoric caves which would be destroyed if the dam was constructed. “Campaigners used Australian photographer Peter Dombrovkis photograph of morning mist at Rock Island Bend of the Gordon River, which eventually brought down the Malcolm Fraser government in 1983,” he said. The dam was not constructed and the event stands testimony to one of the most powerful protests to preserve nature so far.

Title: UP Vidhan Sabha cancels Abdullah Azam’s membership
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Abdullah Azam

LUCKNOW: A day after he was arrested on charges of submitting forged documents along with his affidavit during 2017 assembly polls, the UP Vidhan Sabha notified election of SP leader Azam Khan ’s son Abdullah Azam as null and void on Thursday.

This is the third instance of an Assembly seat getting vacated. Earlier, elections of BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Senger and Ashok Chandel were quashed by Vidhan Sabha following their convictions.

The notification issued by the Vidhan Sabha on Thursday citied the high court order of December 16, 2019, which quashed the election of Abdullah following a petition filed by Congressman Nawab Kazim Ali. The notification said Vidhan Sabha has not received any suspension of the order. “The nullification of Abdullah Azam election from Suar assembly seat will be considered with effect from December 16,” the notification said. Sources said the Election Commission of India will soon be informed about the vacancy of the seat. Abdullah had found himself in the midst of the controversy for allegedly forging his birth certificate while filing his nomination in 2017.

Title: 2 head constables arrested for accepting Rs15k bribe
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Aurangabad: Two police head-constables attached to Kranti Chowk police station were arrested by the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) on Wednesday evening for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 15,000.

According to an ACB official, the money was sought from the son of an elderly woman who was booked under section 420 of the Indian Penal Code by Kranti Chowk police. The policemen took the money on the premises of the police station for helping the woman secure bail.

According to BV Gavade, deputy superintendent of police, the complainant’s son had approached the suspect duo — Rameshlal Jaiswal and Gopal Sonwane — to help him in securing bail for his mother. The policemen offered to help, but demanded Rs15,000 for it.

The man then approached Jalna ACB and lodged a complaint against the cops. Following this, Jalna ACB — led by inspector Sangram Tathe — investigated the complaint and after ascertaining the facts laid a trap.

As soon as Jaiswal accepted the powdered currency notes from the complainant the ACB sleuths present there swooped arrested him. Subsequently, Sonwane was also arrested.

“An offence under the anti-corruption act has been registered against the duo,” the official said.

Title: ‘No dumping at Dadumajra’: Adviser seeks interim plans
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

tnn

Chandigarh: Till the municipal corporation finds a new company with latest technology, no garbage would be deposited at the Dadumajra dumping site. Instead, the waste will be sent to the plant directly and processed.

Manoj Parida, adviser to the administrator, issued these directions to the civic body during a high-level meeting on Thursday. It was attended by home-cum-local bodies secretary, municipal commissioner, mayor, BJP’s city chief and other officers concerned. The adviser also asked the MC to inform him about the interim arrangements it plans to make in the absence of Jaypee Associate Company. The civic body will take over the Dadumajra garbage processing plant from Jaypee after a month.

Though modalities to run the plant are yet to be chalked out, sources said the municipal corporation would run it on its own till they find a new company. “The issue related to the employment of staff and technical expertise will be discussed during the preparation of the plan,” sources in the MC said.

“The key motive of the adviser was that no garbage should be dumped at Dadumajra ground at any cost, so he asked MC to adopt whatever plan it thought fit to process the garbage regularly,” an official said.

Since the National Green Tribunal is keeping an eye on the issue and had issued orders to implement solid waste management by March 31 (failing which MC will have to pay a penalty of Rs 10 lakh per month), the civic authority is left with no option, but to follow the directions.

Jaypee will be asked to vacate

While deciding to take over the garbage processing plant from Jaypee, the MC general house meeting, on Tuesday, planned to serve a notice on the company to vacate the premises within a week. It was also decided that if the company did not vacate the plant, MC will dismantle it and put the cost on it. Since the compost plant was recently installed, its current cost will be assessed and paid to the Jaypee.

Title: Dismissed UT cop acquitted in model rape case
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chandigarh: The Chandigarh district court on Thursday acquitted dismissed UT police sub-inspector Naveen Kumar Phogat, who was alleged to have raped a 25-year-old model from Mumbai. He had been booked under sections 376 (rape) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC.

The court of additional district and sessions judge absolved Phogat of the charges, as the complainant turned hostile and failed to identify him in the court. The prosecution also failed to prove the charges against him.

The accused was suspended in August 2018 and transferred to the police lines after charges of corruption were levelled against him in a Bitcoin forgery case, and after this case was registered, he was dismissed from service.

A Mumbai-based model had alleged that she came in contact with the former SI in May 2018 in the course of investigation of a case being handled by him, who was then posted in the cyber cell of Chandigarh Police.

The model had come to the city to lodge a complaint of fraud committed on her on the pretext of getting her photoshoot done to help her enter the Punjabi film industry. On June 10, 2018, Phogat met the complainant, who had arrested a Dhanas man for fraudulently transferring Rs 12 lakh from her bank account. On June 12, the victim was with the accused for completing the documentation work. In the evening, he offered to drop her at her hotel in Industrial Area, Phase 2. After reaching the destination, he requested the model to let him use the washroom, to which she agreed.

The police claimed that the complainant alleged that after using the washroom, Phogat came out and claimed that he had various objectionable videos and pictures of her in his possession and threatened to circulate them in social media. He allegedly blackmailed the victim to get sexual favours from her. As per the complaint, the former SI also used force to overpower and rape her.

Advocate Rabindra Pandit, the counsel of accused, argued that his client is “innocent and falsely implicated” in the case. He stated that Phogat was a member of an SIT, constituted to investigate a Bitcoin case. This case involved some senior police officials, who in connivance with one other, implicated him in the case to save the accused in that case and also to save their own skin. It was stated that he was also falsely implicated in the rape case.

Also, during the arguments, the rape case complainant also turned hostile and failed to identify the accused. After hearing the arguments, the court acquitted him of all charges.

BOX

Dismissal challenged

Naveen Kumar Phogat has also challenged his dismissal in CAT by the police department, claiming it to be illegal and arbitrary. Phogat had joined the Chandigarh Police as an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) in October 2012 and since October 2015, he had been posted at cyber cell unit of the force and was promoted as an SI in 2017

Timeline

October, 2018 | Case registered

January 10, 2019 | Chargesheet filed

February 2, 2019 | Charges framed

April 18, 2019 | Complainant turned hostile

January 6, 2020 | Prosecution closed evidence

January 13, 2020 | Defence closed evidence

February 27, 2020 | Court acquitted him

Title: Help, just a click away: Police dept launches new version of its website
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bhopal: Are you planning to go out on vacation with family, but worried that your locked house may be burgled?

Now, you don’t need to worry. Simply open the Bhopal city police website —bhopalpolice.com — and fill up the ‘Vacant House Information Form’, listed under the Citizen Services.

The details will be automatically forwarded to the police station in your area and the patrolling team will keep an eye on your house in your absence.

City police on Thursday officially launched the newly developed website in which over a dozen important ‘citizen services’, including ‘vacant house information form’ and ‘senior citizen care registration’, have been listed. Elderly persons residing alone in their houses can register themselves online by filling their details on the website which will be forwarded to the police station in their area. Cops will regularly visit their house and take care of their security concerns.

Other important services like ‘character verification’, ‘employee verification’, ‘tenant verification’ and ‘domestic help verification’ are also available on the website — eliminating the need to visit the police station.

Many services that are listed under the citizen services on the newly launched website were already available on the earlier launched MPeCop App of state police.

But they have been linked with the new website of city police to provide a single online platform for the convenience all sections of society.

One such service — ‘Atithi’ — is made available on the website under the citizen services in which hotel, guest house, and lodge owners cans fill in the details of people staying at their place to inform police. Other services, including vieweing FIRs, arrested person information and passport application status, have been linked to the website.

DIG Irshad Wali said that it is an ambitious initiative of Bhopal police and many services are being provided online for the first time. Issues may arise in the initial phase, but will soon be ironed out.

Police will make people aware about the citizen services available online to increase positive response. As the response increases, the database available with police will increase and then only police will be able to take the service delivery mechanism to the next level. The website will be updated on a regular basis.

Title: HC takes note of construction on riverbed in Andhari village
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

SLUG: Grampanchayat Asked To Deposit Rs10L

Aurangabad: The Aurangabad bench of Bombay high court recently asked the Andhari grampanchayat in Sillod taluka to deposit Rs 10 lakh for going against the court’s stay order and carrying out construction activity in Bhodri river that led to causing serious threat and damage to the environment and ecology and to the public in general.

Vinod Baburao Tayde, a resident of Andhari village , had moved court seeking directions against the gram panchayat and its officials for “construction on the river bed, causing obstruction to the natural flow of water and leading a situation, whereby there is an apprehension to life and property of the residents of Andhari”.

On February 15, 2019, while taking cognizance of the petition, the court had directed the Aurangabad district collector as well as other respondents concerned to ensure that the unauthorized/illegal construction without permission of the competent authority should be stopped immediately, failing to which the authority/authorities concerned will be answerable to the court.

The matter again came up for hearing before the bench comprising justices Prasanna B Varale and R G Avachat on Monday when the bench asked the grampanchayat to deposit Rs 10 lakh with the court.

The bench observed: “Insofar as the act of grampanchayat, namely, initiation of construction on the river bed under the garb of enhancing revenue and permitting one of its employees to collect the amount of rent from the shop owners and then in turn, permitting amount to be deposited in the account of member of grampanchayat is concerned, this act is certainly not in the interest of residents of village Andhari, in particular, as this act causes serious threat and damage to the environment and ecology and to the public in general. As such, we are of the opinion that some corrective measure against grampanchayat is the need of the hour.’’

While referring to the tehsildar’s affidavit in reply, the court observed: “We could find certain shocking facts. The tehsildar admits that the complaint was already lodged with the Hon’ble Minister for Environment in respect of illegal construction carried out on the river bed.”

The bench also noted that “one employee of the grampanchayat, Kishor Namdeo Tayade, collected Rs 25,000 every shop owner and the total amount of Rs 23,75,000 (contribution) was deposited in the account of Dadarao Kisanrao Wankhede, member of the grampanchayat. An illegal entry is caused in Namuna No.11 and the amount of tax was collected from the encroachers. There is reiteration in paragraph-10 that construction of 34 shops would cause serious damage to the natural course of river and would cause irreparable loss to habitation and ecology”.

The court observed that the encroachers, nine members of the grampanchayat and its employees are responsible for encroachment in river bed. The court has posted the PIL for further consideration on March 9.

Title: Govt eyes income from state-owned property
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bhopal: The cash-strapped Congress government in Madhya Pradesh plans to generate income from state-owned unused land and properties.

Chief secretary S R Mohanty has written to department heads to prepare detailed lists of properties in their possession or encroached upon, in dilapidated condition or left unused, so that income can be generated from them to meet department expenses. These details are to be submitted by March 10, said sources in Mantralaya.

The government is also exploring avenues of generating revenue from the spacious circuit houses and bungalows under PWD and irrigation department, apart from properties in other states.

“We have large circuit houses, rest houses and buildings in every district of Madhya Pradesh. We also have properties in other states that are lying unused, dilapidated or encroached by locals. Now, they will be utilised to generate income. We will auction some properties if necessary, rent out if possible, and offer public private participation (PPP) for use of the property to generate revenue or regular income,” PWD minister Sajjan Singh Verma told TOI.

During recent cabinet meetings, chief minister Kamal Nath has instructed department heads to maintain and utilise properties in their possession to generate income. “Properties owned by the state government should be utilised and income should be generated. All the departments must prepare an account of their assets and keep a record to monitor the utilisation of the properties. Action should also be taken against mafia that has encroached upon government property,” Nath had said during a review meeting of PWD.

The state also owns a huge land bank in possession of state roadways in Bhopal, Indore, Chhatarpur, Guna, Jabalpur, Gwalior, Seoni and Balaghat. There are properties and unused land in Mumbai, Nagpur, Jhansi and Agra which are either lying unattended or encroached upon. The government has prepared a list of its assets, some of which could be auctioned or rented out to big industry houses.

The finance department recently suggested to sell properties in possession of state roadways to clear dues of those who retired from state transport corporation, which was closed down due to financial crisis in May 2008. The revenue thus generated could be used to pay salaries, DA, retirement benefits and other dues. “Several properties in possession of the state government are lying unused as they could not be maintained. We will auction some of the expensive ones to generate revenue and settle dues of the department. We will prepare the plan within a week,” public relations minister PC Sharma told TOI.

The government will also renovate and provide some properties to other departments who sans buildings, land and other basic infrastructure for in-house purpose. The government has asked to prepare a detailed list of all such immovable assets, said the minister.

Title: Lessons from Tasmania to Adyar poonga
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Adyar Poonga and ecologist Joss Brooks (inset)

CHENNAI: Community-based conservation centres play a major role when it comes to restoration of biodiversity, according to ecologist Joss Brooks , who has restored Pitchandikulam and Nadukuppam forest in Puducherry and Adyar Poonga in Chennai. Speaking on “Remembering the future garden” at MS Swaminathan Research Foundation on Thursday, Brooks said environmental education of villagers was necessary for restoration of biodiversity.

A lake restoration project that Brooks completed in Siruseri, according to him, could be replicated. “If what has been done in Siruseri is replicated several times, it will solve problems of Chennai,” he said, adding, the community, however, is the key to such initiatives. “Community members in respected areas need to monitor all activities closely. It is the community that should meet and decide how it would restrict buildings etc, not an outside authority; that is a sustainable model,” he said.

As an ecologist, Brooks has restored the Pitchandikulam forest in Auroville , which is today a mature forest, a community and education centre. In 2002, he embarked on environmental education of villages by setting up Nadukuppam Environment Education Centre in a village near Auroville. He also founded Pitchandikulam Forest Consultants, a business unit to provide environmental restoration services and is currently directing the restoration of biodiversity at Adyar Poonga in Chennai.

“I am an old gardener from Auroville,” said Brooks, pointing towards some community-driven initiatives which could restore what had already been there without introducing anything new. “A great example is how, in 2015, when Chennai was flooded, no water left the Auroville plateau. It was a sponge.” He also narrated how he restored water bodies in Adyar Poonga by removing huge piles of concrete debris.

Where did Brooks get the inspiration? Tasmania, he would say. He conducted many voyages using country boats along the Australian coast. “These travels helped me understand nature closely. I observed how its (Tasmania’s) indigenous people preserved nature by using traditional knowledge,” he said. However, it was the mass protest against the construction of Franklin Dam on the Gordon River in Tasmania in the early 1980s that made him think about nature seriously. The region had prehistoric caves which would be destroyed if the dam was constructed. “Campaigners used Australian photographer Peter Dombrovkis photograph of morning mist at Rock Island Bend of the Gordon River, which eventually brought down the Malcolm Fraser government in 1983,” he said. The dam was not constructed and the event stands testimony to one of the most powerful protests to preserve nature so far.

Title: Let states fix MSP, says T minister
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana has proposed that states should have the power to decide the minimum support price (MSP) of crops cultivated in their respective zones.

Addressing the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) annual governing body meeting in Delhi, Telangana agriculture minister S Niranjan Reddy on Thursday said states should be able to decide the MSP since crop production depends upon local conditions.

Speaking on the reg gram issue, the minister said the state wants agencies to procure additional 50,000 metric tonnes of the pulse and the Union government has asked the state to send a letter again. TNN

Title: Govt to make MP the country’s horticulture capital: CM
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Chief minister Kamal Nath at the state credit seminar 2020-21 organised by the NABARD in Bhopal on Thursday

Bhopal: Chief minister Kamal Nath on Thursday reiterated the state government's commitment to transform Madhya Pradesh into India's horticulture capital. Nath said that the credit potential estimated by the NABARD for the horticulture sector should be increased from 6 percent to at least 15 percent. NABARD has estimated the credit potential for Madhya Pradesh at Rs 1,98,786 crore. This is 13 percent more than that of last year's Rs 1,74,970 crore.

Releasing the state focus paper at the state credit seminar 2020-21 organised by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) on Thursday, the CM said, "Horticulture sector is a gateway to prosperity of farmers. This is the future of the farm sector. A large patch of unutilized revenue land in Madhya Pradesh can be utilized for expansion of horticulture activities."

Stressing the need to approach the agriculture sector with a fresh vision and thinking, the chief minister said that the scenario is changing. "Earlier, millets were out of focus, but today they have gained prominence. The millets were meant for consumption by the poor people. Now high nutritive value makes millet a popular food," he said.

Nath said NABARD has years of experience and intellectual capacity. "NABARD will have to prepare plans for 2024-25. Today's scenario would change after five years. The goals set today can be achieved easily, but the challenge of achieving new targets must be accepted in future," he said, adding that "NABARD has made an unprecedented contribution in Madhya Pradesh by playing an important role in building agricultural infrastructure. The knowledge that NABARD has acquired should be harnessed to expand its vision. He said that plans made for Madhya Pradesh can also be useful for the country."

The chief minister said that the biggest challenge is unemployment among youth as they move from villages to cities. They have to be connected with emerging technologies and technical skills. He said that agriculture needs modernisation. He said NABARD should focus on export of crops and the emerging markets within the agriculture sector need to be closely monitored. "NABARD should not use its expertise for routine jobs. It must pay attention to new farming techniques, besides giving a thought to construction of warehousing and procurement infrastructure. Apart from this, it should explore how new and useful infrastructures can be built. The role of NABARD was limited to re-financing, but today it has changed with the changing scenario," said Nath.

NABARD has made credit potential of Rs 1,98,786 crore for the year 2020-21. This is about 13 percent more than the previous year's 1,74,970 crore. In this, Rs 1,03,005 crore has been earmarked for agriculture loan, Rs 44,982 crore for term loan, about 32,001 crore for micro, small and medium entrepreneurs and Rs 18,797 crore for priority sectors like export credit, education, housing, renewable energy and other social infrastructure.

Chief general manager of NABARD, SK Bansal, urged banks to play a key role in achieving the targets. He stressed the need to increase Kisan Credit Card (KCC) coverage to 100% farmers, invest in rural infrastructure and strive for financing agricultural producer groups. He also discussed the benefits of loan worth Rs 26,000 crore offered to the state under the Rural Infrastructure Development Fund (RIDF) and the Long Term Seed Fund (LTIF).

Giving information about e-Shakti project for self-help groups in 21 districts, Bansal said that this will benefit about 2.5 lakh families of 25000 groups. The chief minister also felicitated farmers' producer organisations for their outstanding performance.

Title: Women get MSRTC bus driving training in city
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has started training women as drivers for its fleet in Nashik Region – comprising Nashik, Dhule, Jalgaon, Ahmednagar districts and Aurgangabad region, combined.

There are 11 women from Nashik and another 11 women from Dhule depot of Nashik region. In addition, 10 women from Aurangabad region are being trained, the MSRTC officials at Aurangabad confirmed. The training is being conducted at the Traffic Inspector Training Centre in Aurangabad.

“The women will be trained for one year. Thereafter, they will have to appear for an examination. If qualified, they will be inducted in the service,” Anant Pawar, driver trainer at the centre, said.

This is the first time that the women are being trained by the MSRTC at its own facility in Aurangabad region. A total of 163 women, married and single, are being trained by the MSRTC at Yavatmal, Pune, Amravati regions besides Aurangabad.

Since the posts for drivers were reserved for women, the MSRTC was trying to fill them up. The transport utility started recruiting women as conductors about five years back.

“The major hitch was that MSRTC was unable to get women drivers despite flashing advertisements as the key condition was that the applicants should have three years experience in driving heavy vehicles,” the MSRTC official said.

The official said that it was very difficult to find women who had driving heavy vehicles, normally trucks. The transport utility then tweaked conditions to absorb women in the service by providing training as well.

The women applicants, who already have light motor vehicle licence and have applied for heavy motor vehicle licence, were selected for the training.

They will get one year training to drive the buses. This will be followed by a computerized driving test. Those clearing the test will get further induction training of one month before starting the job.

The MSRTC official added that the women will first be asked to join the local depot before being given a long-distance duty. “It will be a confidence-building measure for these women. As they gain confidence in their driving skills, the longer duties can be assigned to them,” the officer said.

Title: Azam Khan : 'Op Azam' brings back memories of Pota Act against Raja Bhaiya
Content:
Azam Khan (left) & Raghuraj Pratap Singh aka Raja Bhaiya

LUCKNOW: The way the Yogi Adityanath government has brought the powerful SP leader Azam Khan to his knees has few parallels in UP’s political history. The Rampur MP was not only declared a land mafia, but also a goat thief.He has also been hounded by income tax and enforcement directorate sleuths for financial transactions linked to his Jauhar University, though he, along with wife and son, were sent in judicial custody for alleged forgery in the birth certificate of his son Abdullah Azam which he submitted while filing papers for 2017 assembly poll.Political observers say that closest example of such a subjugation is the taming of firebrand Thakur neta Raghuraj Pratap Singh alias Raja Bhaiya during the BSP government in 2002 when Mayawati was the chief minister. Raja Bhaiya had not only been booked under draconian Prevention of Terrorist Activities (Pota) law but also slapped with charges like stealing of utensils and murder.Azam is a founder member of SP and his stature could be gauged from the fact that just when he landed at Sitapur jail the party chief Akhilesh Yadav rushed to see him. Earlier, SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, addressed a press conference after long when the BJP government lodged over 80 criminal cases against the Rampur MP.Earlier also, Azam has been showing his authority and importance by using pressure tactics. Often, his tantrums have embarrassed the party leadership. Be it his constant absence from party meetings, including national executives, and his insistence on not keeping any principal secretary in his urban development department when he was a minister, Azam has been in news for wrong reasons in the past. Once when he didn’t go to Agra for the party’s summit, Akhilesh went all the way to his house cajole him. The secretariat staff didn’t show any such reverence and they went on strike when Azam allegedly misbehaved with his personal assistant.He had frequent run-ins with governor as well. During the SP regime between 2003 and 2007, he described then governor TV Rajeswar as ‘darban of Sonia Gandhi” (attendant of the Sonia Gandhi). Rajeswar was insistent on sacking him, but then CM Mulayam Singh Yadav saved him by apologising to the governor.During the 2012-17 SP regime, he again invited the wrath governor Ram Naik when he allegedly used disparaging remarks against him during his speech in the assembly. An enraged Naik sought Azam’s unedited speech and asked CM Akhilesh Yadav to take action against him. Akhilesh, too, expressed regret.During 2014 LS poll, Azam also earned Election Commission’s censure when he said during campaign that only Muslim jawans fought and won Kargil for India. It saw a counter-polarisation against the SP and it was reduced to just five seats.During 2019 general elections, he again hogged the limelight by declaring that the Rampur DM (who was pursuing cases against him) would be made to clean his shoes when the SP came to power. He has been accused of forcefully acquiring land during SP regime for the construction of Jauhar University, which has led to 80 FIRs.Slapping of so many criminal cases against Azam has brought back memories of Raja Bhaiya’s plight during Mayawati’s regime. While Azam’s Jauhar University is facing demolition (HC has just ordered an stay), the BSP government had bulldozed Raja Bhaiya’s riverside sanctuary in his native place Kunda in Pratapgarh. Besides, his palace, Bhadri House, had been turned into an impromptu camp for para military forces.While by nailing a feudal Thakur leader, Mayawati wanted to send a message that socio-political dynamics was changing, by taming Azam Khan, Yogi wants to give a larger political message. “The more Akhilesh would defend Azam , the more Yogi would brand him a pro-Muslim in the run-up to 2022 polls,” said an analyst.In Video: UP: Azam Khan shifted to Sitapur jail with wife and son

Title: Appoint chief of TSCW: NCW chair
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Hyderabad: National Commission for Women (NCW) chairperson Rekha Sharma on Wednesday asked chief secretary Somesh Kumar to appoint a chief for Telangana State Commission for Women, stating that the post has been lying vacant since July 2018. According to reports, 46 complaints were filed with the State Women's Commission in 2018 and several more were recorded in 2019. They remain unaddressed in the absence of a chief. NCW had earlier written to CM K Chandrasekar Rao too and requested the CS to take up the matter urgently. TNN

Title: SRTMU rolls back change in exam schedule
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Aurangabad: The Nanded-based Swami Ramanand Teerth Marathwada University ( SRTMU ) on Thursday decided to roll back permanent change in the schedule of examinations as per which students were made to appear for two papers on a single day.

The decision came a day after state higher education minister Uday Samant took cognizance of the complaints from the students and invited SRTMU vice-chancellor (VC) Udhav Bhosle to discuss the issue.

Bhosle on Thursday had said the change in schedule was aimed at saving the overall time spent in conducting examinations, but the decision would be revoked from the next examination.

“Almost 45 days are spent every semester for conducting examinations alone. The idea was to curtail this period and utilize the time saved for academic purposes. The change concerned, however, did not go well with a section of students and therefore it will not be in place onwards,” he said.

The VC said that the contentious change in the examination schedule was implemented after following all due procedures and nobody took the objection at any stage. “The change in examination schedule was announced only after it received necessary clearance from the Academic Council and Board of Examinations, among other competent bodies. The proposal was also discussed with college principals separately, who too had given their consents,” Bhosle said.

The change in the examination schedule had received sharp reactions from students, who dubbed the move as regressive. Meanwhile, a section of students has demanded re-conducting of last semester examination, claiming that they suffered academic loss as two papers were held on a single day.

Established at Nanded by bi-furcating the Marathwada University, Aurangabad on September 17 1994, the SRTMU has over 300 affiliated colleges with jurisdiction over half of Marathwada, including Nanded, Hingoli, Latur and Parbhani districts.

Title: CBI relook at Laxmikant Sharma in Vyapam case
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bhopal: CBI is considering taking a fresh look into the case of former BJP minister Laxmikant Sharma, who the central agency had removed from the list of accused in the 2012 transport constable recruitment scam of Vyapam for ‘lack of evidence’.

Though CBI officials refused to comment, insiders say the decision to reopen the Sharma files comes in backdrop of a viral ‘honeytrap’ video clip, which has “Vyapam-related conversations”.

The 2012-transport constable recruitment scam was considered the most important of all Vyapam-related cases due to allegations against some top leaders of BJP, which was then in power, and the so-called ‘Gondia’ connection — a reference to a Maharashtra district.

While CBI had submitted the chargesheet of this case in 2019 against 26 people, it did not find anything significant in allegations that candidates from Gondia district of Maharashtra were selected under political influence. Nineteen of those chargesheeted are candidates. The others include former Vyapam officials, middlemen and impersonators. Two of the accused died during investigations.

CBI had registered the FIR on July 22, 2015, naming Laxmikant Sharma, former higher education minister, his close aide Om Prakash Shukla, and several others. This Vyapam case turned sensational after Congress alleged in 2014 that over a dozen candidates, who had cleared the written exam were from Gondia and that they were recruited by the transport department following “directions from CM house”.

“Some allegations mentioned in various complaints, pertaining to illegal enhancement of number of posts of transport constables, irregularities in selection of candidates for the post of transport constables from the merit and waiting lists, and allegations related to illegal selection of candidates from Gondia district of Maharashtra under political influence, were also investigated, which did not reveal any illegality, irregularity or commission of any offence,” the chargesheet says. CBI said it is still awaiting reports from CFSL Hyderabad on some digital files.

Sources in the agency said that Sharma may be made an accused in the case if opinion of legal experts points to the possibility. Sharma has always rejected the allegations.

Title: Now, Guj model to help preserve Bhopal heritage
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

File photo of students visiting ‘Bada Bagh Baoli’ in Bhopal

Bhopal: The Gujarat model of heritage preservation could form the genesis for preservation of heritage buildings in Bhopal city, said convener of Bhopal Citizens’ Forum, Prakash Seth.

The forum is demanding urgent measures to save heritage in the state capital.

In a letter to the MP state chief secretary, the forum pointed out that an outstanding characteristic of the state capital is its rich heritage, which is a matter of pride for the city’s residents and a big attraction for outsiders.

However, most of the heritage structures are located in the old city area and were constructed during the rule of the Orakzai Pathans who held sway over this area from 1707 to 1949. “They represent a priceless heritage and deserve conservation,” said Seth.

The first step to be taken in this direction would be documentation of precincts that require preservation. Only a handful of buildings have been notified as heritage and protected. Seth cited the forum’s letters to the state government in 2010 and 2015, seeking action for protection of the monuments.

Elaborating on the Gujarat model of heritage preservation, he said necessary revision has been effectuated in the development plan of the Ahmedabad Urban Development Authority for preservation of heritage buildings.

Rules have been framed, and under them, structures and precincts are listed as heritage properties. The Competent Authority there acts on the advice of the Heritage Preservation Committee.

Title: Rehab of 562 flood-hit families to begin soon
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Malappuram: The rehabilitation of 562 flood-hit families in the district will begin soon, as the government sanctioned a total of Rs 27.72 crore for land purchase for them.

An official order regarding the release of the compensation amount to the district collector was issued on Tuesday.

Of the total 562 families listed as the beneficiaries, each of the 462 families will receive financial aid of Rs 6 lakh for land purchase to construct houses.

For the remaining 100 families, the government had earlier sanctioned Rs 6 lakh for 33 families each, to purchase land for construction of houses after sponsorship by business man M A Yusuffali. The processs to purchase land for 67 other flood-hit families, under Care Home project, is progressing.

196 families in Kavalappara, where an entire village was swept away in a massive land slide killing more than 50 people, are also included in the list of 562 families.

District collector Jafar Malik said that the construction of 34 houses sponsored by Federal Bank for tribal families is underway and the project would be complete by March end. The authorities are planning to set up a township model project in Chembankolli colony in Edakkara grama panchayat.
