The construction of five houses sponsored by V-Guard group has been completed and the keys to the houses handed over to the beneficiaries on February 18.

The collector said that compensation to 80% flood-hit families has been distributed. The consolidated beneficiary list of flood-hit families has been published on the official website of the district administration. Compensation to 18,937 families living in relief camps during the floods was distributed, he said.

Title: Fire breaks out in Chowk jewellery shop, no one injured
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

PRAYAGRAJ: A fire broke out in a jewellery shop in Chowk, under limits of Kotwali, on Thursday afternoon. No casualties were reported and the fire was brought under control within 30 minutes.

Chief fire officer ( Prayagraj) RS Mishra said the blaze broke out around 3.45pm. He said the firefighters were yet to find out what might have triggered the fire.

The CFO added that the jewellery shop belonged to one AK Agarwal. He also said that the fire was controlled before it could spread to other establishments.

Title: Justice S Muralidhar's last act in Delhi: Ruling on running business from homes
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Justice S Muralidhar

NEW DELHI: All eyes were on court number-38 in Delhi high court on Thursday after the news of Justice S Muralidhar’s transfer to Punjab and Haryana high court spread.

However, instead of the judge holding routine hearings on the division bench that includes justice Talwant Singh, he came out to only pronounce a judgment relating to commercial activities being carried out from residential areas. “This is my last judicial act as a judge of Delhi high court,” Justice S Muralidhar said after which his bench didn’t assemble.

A large section of lawyers, including senior advocates, had gathered inside the courtroom to thank Justice Muralidhar. One of them said: “You are an inspiration to many” as they wished him the best on his future assignment.

The staff had already communicated to the lawyers, who had matters listed before his bench, that the judge won’t preside after pronouncement of the verdict.

Hours after a bench headed by him had slammed Delhi Police for failing to register FIRs in cases of alleged hate speeches by three BJP leaders — Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Verma and Kapil Mishra, the Centre cleared February 12 transfer recommendation for justice Muralidhar made by the Supreme Court collegium.

Justice Muralidhar is the third senior most judge in Delhi high court after Chief Justice D N Patel and Justice G S Sistani, and had to step in Tuesday night in the other two’s absence. He had conducted an urgent and unprecedented midnight hearing at his residence to issue immediate directions ensuring safe passage for victims holed up in a hospital under siege in northeast Delhi where rioters held sway.

On Wednesday, the bench of justices Muralidhar and Talwant Singh had heard a plea seeking lodging of FIRs and arrests for hate speech by BJP functionaries over Citizenship (Amendment) Act. It had passed strong comments making it clear that the HC won’t allow “another 1984 in the city...”

Title: Suspend civic chief for failing to raze illegal building: Telangana HC to government
Content: HYDERABAD: A day after talking a serious view of illegal structures which mushroomed all over the state, the Telangana high court on Thursday directed the state government to suspend Adilabad municipal commissioner for failing to demolish a commercial complex which was raised illegally in Adilabad town.A bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy said the municipal commissioner deserved to be suspended for his lack of action. “He should have demolished the structure promptly,” the bench said and issued notices to the government, principal secretary, municipal administration, Arvind Kumar, municipal administration director, Adilabad district collector and municipal commissioner.The bench also asked Arvind Kumar to ensure stringent action was taken against the municipal commissioner. The court was hearing a public interest litigation petition filed by Gottimukkala VRRG Raju of Saroornagar, Hyderabad, who charged the authorities with failing to take action on the commercial complex in Adilabad. The plot where this building was coming up was actually allotted to Munnur Kapu Sangham for raising a hostel building for the community students.According to the petitioner, the plot was allotted to the sangham way back in 1975. Instead of raising a hostel, president of the sangham began raising a structure which was meant to be used as a commercial complex. The petitioner contended that this defeated the purpose for which the plot was allotted.The standing counsel for the municipality informed the bench that the incomplete structure had been lying at the spot for the last five years and that is why the municipal officials did not take any action.At this, the CJ asked: “Are the municipal officials waiting for the structure to be completed?”The bench said, “If you (officials) come to a conclusion that the structure is illegal, you have to act on it.” The standing counsel tried to convince the bench that there was no finding that the structure was illegal and that he was only stating that it was in an incomplete form.The bench did not accept this and issued notices. Notices were also issued to the president of Munnur Kapu Sangham.

Title: India evacuates 195 desis from China and Japan
Content:
112 evacuees, including 36 foreign nationals, who were air-lifted from Wuhan are being quarantined by the ITBP... Read More

NEW DELHI: In a major rescue exercise, India on Thursday evacuated 195 nationals, who were seeking to escape the coronavirus outbreak , from Japan and China. While 119 people were evacuated from cruise ship Diamond Princess in Japan, 76 more were brought back from Wuhan in China by a relief military aircraft.Significantly, India also evacuated 36 foreign nationals from Wuhan and five from Japan. “The evacuation has underscored the priority India attaches to the welfare of its citizens wherever they are,” foreign secretary Harsh Shringla said. He added that India was “happy to have been able to assist our friends from Bangladesh, Myanmar, Maldives and other friendly countries from our neighbourhood and beyond in the evacuations from both China and Japan”.Of the 36 foreign nationals evacuated from Wuhan, 23 were from Bangladesh, six from China, two each from Myanmar and Maldives and one each from South Africa, US and Madagascar. Of the five from Japan, there were two from Sri Lanka and one each from Nepal, South Africa and Peru.The Indian relief flight to Wuhan carried 15,000 kg of medical assistance comprising masks, gloves and other emergency medical equipment. These supplies were delivered by an IAF C-17 special flight which landed in Wuhan late on Wednesday evening.The medical supplies followed PM Narendra Modi’s letter to President Xi Jinping offering assistance to deal with the crisis. “The medical supplies will help augment the China’s efforts to control the outbreak of this infection which has been declared as a public health emergency by the World Health Organisation,’’ the MEA said in a statement.Some of India’s neighbours like Bangladesh and Sri Lanka had sought help from India to evacuate their citizens. The government said assistance to them was in keeping with India’s neighbourhood first policy. India has until now operated three relief flights from Wuhan, evacuating 723 Indian nationals and 43 foreign nationals.In the case of Japan, a special Air India flight landed in New Delhi from Tokyo on Thursday, bringing back 119 Indian nationals (113 crew members and six passengers) who were on board the Diamond Princess which docked off Yokohama in Japan.“In line with India’s neighbourhood first policy and Indo-Pacific vision, the special flight also evacuated five foreign nationals — two Sri Lankans, one Nepalese, one South African and one Peruvian. All the evacuees will undergo a 14-day quarantine at the facility set up by the Indian Army in Manesar, Haryana,’’ the MEA said.Three Indian crew members didn't board the special flight and conveyed their wish, according to the government, to continue their stay on board the cruise ship to complete the period of extended quarantine put in place by the Japan government.“Out of the total 138 Indian nationals originally on board the Diamond Princess, 16 Indian crew members have tested positive for coronavirus 2019 and are receiving necessary medical care and treatment at onshore medical facilities in Japan. Embassy of India in Tokyo has established contact with these individuals and is continuously following-up on their recovery,’’ the foreign ministry said.The ship was put under quarantine by Japan on February 5 for 14 days as one of the passengers who had disembarked from the ship had tested positive for COVID-19. The quarantine period was extended by the Japanese government as the crew members were performing their regular duties during the initial quarantine period of 14 days.

Title: Nuclear power plant construction in Kovvada likely to be revived?
Content:
The Kovvada project has been mired controversies right from its proposal stage about a decade ago

AMARAVATI: The controversial nuclear power plant in Kovvada of Srikakulam is likely to be revived as the issue came up for discussion between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump during the latter’s just concluded trip to India.The joint statement released by the White House said both Trump and Modi have decided to encourage the firms - Westinghouse and Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL) - involved in the construction of the 7248 MW atomic energy plant to complete it early.Although the statement did not mention Kovvada plant in Andhra Pradesh , its reference to the joint venture of Westinghouse and NPCIL clearly indicates the plans to revive the project in coastal AP as it is the only project taken up by Westinghouse in India.The statement said: “President Trump and Prime Minister Modi welcomed growing links between the United States and India in trade and investment in hydrocarbons. Through their Strategic Energy Partnership, the United States and India are seeking to enhance energy security, expand energy and innovation linkages across respective energy sectors, bolster strategic alignment, and facilitate increased engagement between industry and other stakeholders. President Trump and Prime Minister Modi noted the potential for the United States to meet India’s goal to diversify its import base for coking/metallurgical coal and natural gas, welcoming recent commercial arrangements intended to accelerate access to LNG in the Indian market.“President Trump and Prime Minister Modi encouraged the Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited and Westinghouse Electric Company to finalize the techno-commercial offer for the construction of six nuclear reactors in India at the earliest date,” it said.The Kovvada project has been mired controversies right from its proposal stage about a decade ago. Fishermen and farmers off Kovvada area strongly resisted land acquisition plans by the state government and brought the works to a grinding halt. The government could take over just around 450 acres against the requirement of over 2000 acres for the plant.The locals heaved a sigh of relief when the project proponent Westinghouse went through bankruptcy proceedings and faced near shutdown in 2017. However, Westinghouse was back in action following the takeover by Brookfields Business Partners (BBP) in 2018.Human Rights Forum (HRF) general secretary VS Krishna strongly condemned the attempts to pump life back into the nuclear plant along AP coast. He said that setting up of nuclear plants is a crime against future generations. He demanded that the state government should immediately raise its opposition to the plant.Meanwhile, N Srikanth, CMD, AP Transco, said the energy department was unaware of the discussion between PM Modi and President Trump about Kovvada nuclear plant.

Title: 1.9L not getting pensions: Errabelli
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Hyderabad: A total of 1.9 lakh people who joined Abhayahastam scheme are not getting benefits, said panchayat raj and rural development minister Errabelli Dayakar Rao. During a review meeting on Thursday, the minister said there were about 19 lakh beneficiaries in 2009 and 1.9 lakh of them were not getting pensions. The minister said that since pension eligibility is reduced under Asara pension, the number of pensions will increase. TNN

Title: ‘Carbide’s criminal liability not proven’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bhopal: The Union Carbide India Ltd (UCIL) counsel said in a Bhopal court on Thursday that CBI has failed to establish UCIL’s criminal liability in the gas disaster.

The court of district & sessions judge is hearing appeal filed by all the convicts in the gas disaster criminal case against their conviction for criminal negligence. They were awarded two years’ suspended sentence by the trial court of chief judicial magistrate (CJM) on June 7, 2010.

In arguments that lasted over five hours, UCIL counsel Amit Desai said CBI contends that MIC gas escaped from tank- E 610- due to water washing of the pipes in the plant and some water getting into the tank in the process but it did not name or charge-sheet those who ordered it or carried out water washing. How is UCIL responsible for an act by some persons at a local unit, he said.

Quoting from several court judgments in India and abroad, he said that question of corporate liability of UCIL for the disaster does not arise as CBI has failed to produce any evidence that UCIL was responsible for the disaster. The lawyer said the CBI chargesheet was based on inferences derived from a scientific report on the gas disaster, which does not prove the charge of criminal negligence on the part of UCIL.

Despite an earlier order of district judge Rajendra Verma for appearance of all convicts in the case, only S P Roychoudhary attended the proceedings on Thursday. When the judge asked about the other convicts, standing counsel for the convicts urged the court not to press for their personal presence “unless and until necessary”, as they are frail and old and not in a position to come to court on each hearing.

Title: 42 repatriated Goan seamen quarantined
Content:
All the evacuees are currently confined in a facility at Manesar

MARGAO: The ordeal of 42 Goan seamen onboard the Diamond Princess cruiseliner quarantined off the coast at Yokohama in Japan, ended on Thursday, as a special Air India flight chartered by the Indian government landed in New Delhi early Thursday morning. It carried all 119 Indian nationals on the vessel.An update by the Union ministry of health said that all the evacuees are currently in 14-day quarantine at a facility set up by the Indian Army in Manesar, Haryana. Once they are cleared by the medical team following the quarantine period, they will be allowed to return to their respective homes.Of the 138 Indian nationals onboard the ship, 16 who had tested positive for coronavirus are hospitalized in Japan, while three crew members opted to undergo the extended quarantine period.Dhanasth Raikar, who is among the 42 Goans in quarantine, told TOI, “On our arrival, we were subjected to some blood tests, and the results are awaited.”

Title: Now, Telangana junior colleges set to be tobacco free zones
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Junior colleges across the state are set to be tobacco free zones as the Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education (TSBIE) has directed all the district intermediate educational officers and principals to conduct tobacco control drive.

Colleges have been directed to display ‘no smoking’ sign boards in the campus and conduct half-day sensitisation programme on tobacco control laws. “Declare educational institutions free from tobacco, cigarette and other tobacco products through enforcement and reporting of cigarette and other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA), 2003,” read the circular issued by the TSBIE.

As per Section 6 and 6 (b) of COTPA, tobacco sale to and by minors is banned and there is prohibition on sale of tobacco products within 100 yards of educational institutions. Mandatory signage should be displayed near the main gate.

Title: 19-year-old Pauri youth killed in Delhi violence
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Dehradun: A 19-year-old youth from Pauri district was reportedly killed in the violence that has erupted in Delhi. His charred body was found in a shop and was identified by one of his relatives who works with him in the national capital. Talking to TOI, SSP Pauri, Daljit Singh Kunwar said that the youth was identified as Dilbar Singh (19), son of Gopal Singh from Rokhara village in Pauri.

“No one in the family of the youth had contacted the police but as per information, the youth was living in Delhi with one of his relatives from Kumaon. His family has already left for Delhi. In all likelihood, he will be cremated in Delhi,” he added.

Meanwhile, some unconfirmed reports also stated that Dilbar Singh was sleeping in the gowdown of the bakery he used to work in, which was set ablaze by a mob. He was living in Shahdara locality in the national capital. His charred body was brought to GTB hospital on Wednesday, where he was identified by his relatives who were looking for him since he had gone missing.

Title: Marathi Language Day celebrated
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Lecture and book exhibition, among other events, marked the celebrations of Marathi Language Day at the government library in the city on Thursday. Speaking on the occasion, divisional head of the State Publicity Department Ganesh Ramdasi shed light on the legacy of literature of different saints who hailed from Marathwada.

MAGIC to support KPIT Sparkle 2020

Marathwada Accelerator for Growth and Incubation Council (MAGIC), Aurangabad , has announced its partnership with annual student-centric event KPIT Sparkle 2020 as an incubation partner.

The MAGIC will offer support for the Open Innovation Challenge for colleges and university students, an official release said.

Title: Seven thieves held with 60 smartphones
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

PRAYAGRAJ: Seven members of an inter-state gang of mobile thieves were arrested on Thursday.

The accused used to target people in guest houses, temples, wedding halls homes, and bus stations. Police have seized 60 mobile phones from them.

The accused were identified as Krishna Sonkar of Reewa, Rocky of Bhopal, Deepak Pawar of Aurangabad, Arun Chauhan of Bihar, HariOm of Vidhisha, Hira Adivasi of Jhansi and Randhir of Ghurpur (Prayagraj).

SSP (Prayagraj) Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj said, “We were tipped off about the whereabouts of the seven members of a Ghumantu gang . We got to know that they were spotted roaming near Baihrana power house road, looking for targets. We cordoned off the area and arrested them.”

Title: Experts seek proper water arrangements in wildlife sanctuaries
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Aurangabad: With warmer months around the corner, city-based environmentalist and nature lovers have demanded supply of adequate water in waterholes of all the wildlife sanctuaries in Marathwada .

According to experts, dearth of water, besides posing survival issue for different creatures during summer, can increase cases of man-animal conflict in forest areas.

Environmentalist Kishor Pathak said the forest department must take proactive steps to ensure that all waterholes in wildlife sanctuaries have sufficient water throughout the summer.

“Summer invariably brings scarcity of water in sanctuaries as natural waterbodies dry out. The dearth of water makes wild animals and other creatures prone to heat-stroke if no water is available. At times, deaths of creatures due to lack of water during summer have went unnoticed,” he said.

Marathwada region has Gautala-Autramghat wildlife sanctuary spread over Aurangabad and Jalgaon districts, Yedshi Ramling Ghat wildlife sanctuary in Osmanabad district, Naigaon Peacock sanctuary in Beed district and Painganga wildlife sanctuary in Yavatmal, among other major reserved forest areas.

Animal rescue expert Nitesh Jadhav said unavailability of water within the wildlife sanctuaries poses a potential threat to the food chain and in turn leads to man-animal conflict.

“The food chain refers to a sequence of transfer of food from one creature to another and is the link with which creatures are related to each other by the way of food they eat. Unavailability of water during summer breaks this food chain forcing animals to stray into human habitats in search of food and water,” he said.

When contacted, chief conservator of forests (territorial) PK Mahajan said instructions have been issued to ensure availability of water in all waterholes located in all sanctuaries of the region.

“Besides supplying water, we have also appealed to the locals to pitch in for quenching the thirst of wildlife creatures during summer. The region has sufficient number of waterholes in different sanctuaries which will be filled on a regular basis till the arrival of monsoon,” he said.

Title: Pedestrianisation a failure: Laad Bazaar shopowners
Content:
Modern technology must be used to showcase Laad Bazaar’s uniqueness which cannot be found in malls

HYDERABAD: Water stagnation, garbage accumulation and proliferation of hawkers were some of the concerns raised by shopowners of Laad Bazaar at a workshop organised by Unesco, Republic of Korea Funds-in-Trust project and Intach on Thursday.Srikanth, who owns a bangle shop in Laad Bazaar, said that while the pedestrianisation project was a good move, execution was not perfect. “Stones that were laid on walkways are not levelled. This makes it difficult for customers, especially elderly people, to walk through the bylanes.” Citing an example of how a senior citizen recently suffered a hairline fracture, he suggested that battery carts can be introduced for them.The workshop is part of Unesco’s efforts to make citizens stakeholders in their city’s heritage.Water stagnation was another subject that several shopkeepers touched upon. Tayub Abu Baker, owner of AH Zariwala, said, “There is no proper drainage from Charminar to Moti Gali and water stagnates every time it rains.” Stating that focus on the development of the western corridor of the city was robbing the Old City of its value, Abu Baker requested that Laad Bazaar’s unique identity be promoted and preserved.Besides newer commercial hubs, Husain Ramzani, a fourth-generation shopowner who deals in traditional wedding material, said hawkers have moved to the bylanes snatching business of stores.Highlighting the issue of hygiene, Ramzani added, “This market has a history. It attracts lakhs of tourists and customers every year, yet it is filthy.” He says while dustbins have been placed right outside his shop, people seldom use them, spitting and discarding water wherever they wish.While welcoming the pedestrianisation of Charminar area, Intach Hyderabad convenor Anuradha Reddy said, “The changes over the years have not taken into account the heritage value of the surroundings of Charminar. It is being done without taking into account heritage, cultural and social impact assessments. The lack of coordination among different agencies that manage the heritage site have led to some of the problems of Laad Bazaar and other shopping areas.”Prof Ramana Reddy, also an Intach member, said, “Modern technology must be used to showcase Laad Bazaar’s uniqueness, which cannot be found in malls. The government and occupants of the bazaar must work together to protect this historic market.”

Title: Rajendra Nagar MLA Raghav Chadha appointed DJB vice-chairman
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Raghav Chadha

NEW DELHI: Rajendra Nagar MLA Raghav Chadha has been appointed as the new vice-chairman of Delhi Jal Board. Burari MLA Sanjeev Jha and Deoli MLA Prakash Jarwal have been appointed as members of the board of the agency, which is responsible for supplying potable water to almost 97% of Delhi.

The Delhi assembly issued a notification in this regard late on Wednesday.

A first-time MLA, Chadha has replaced Sangam Vihar legislator Dinesh Mohaniya, who held the position in the previous term of the Aam Aadmi Party government.

The appointment of Chadha as the new vice-chairman of Delhi Jal Board came days after chief minister Arvind Kejriwal handed over the responsibility of the body to urban development minister Satyendar Jain. Kejriwal was the chairman of DJB in AAP government’s previous term. Jain has been appointed as DJB chairman this time.

The restructuring of the political wing of Jal Board is being seen as an important step by the government to provide piped water to every household in the next five years. In its 10-point guarantee card released ahead of the recently concluded Delhi assembly polls, AAP has promised to provide 24-hour clean piped water to every household in this term.

Title: Centre solely responsible for riots in Delhi: Kanam
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Union government is solely responsible for the riots in Delhi, said CPI state secretary Kanam Rajendran . “The attacks in Delhi were pre-planned. The immediate provocation was the rooting out of BJP in New Delhi assembly polls,” Rajendran said while inaugurating a protest gathering organized by CPI in front of Secretariat on Thursday.

“Our Prime Minister took several hours to make any comment despite the riots going on for three days. Goons who had come from Uttar Pradesh ran riot in Delhi. Sangh Parivar is applying dangerous tactics to divide people. All the while the police remained mute spectators,” Rajendran said. The CPI secretary also asked all who are concerned about the future of the country to stay united and resist the Sangh Parivar agenda.

CPI district secretary G R Anil presided over the event. Deputy speaker V Sasi, MLA C Divakaran, state assistant secretary K Prakash Babu and district assistant secretary Mankode Radhakrishnan spoke.

The CPI organized similar protest gatherings in all district centres.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: BJP targeting leaders with political vendetta, says Akhilesh Yadav
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

SP chief Akhilesh Yadav steps out of Sitapur jail after meeting Azam Khan on Thursday (PTI Photo)

LUCKNOW: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav , who rushed to Sitapur on Thursday morning to meet the jailed party MP Azam Khan , hit out at the BJP, accusing it of targeting senior party leaders with political vendetta.

Speaking to reporters in Sitapur, Akhilesh said Azam was being targeted ever since BJP came to power in UP. Azam is facing more than 80 criminal cases, including offences like cattle theft, jewellery theft and goat theft.

“Azam Khan and his family is in jail because of political conspiracy of the BJP. But in politics, such an act if vendetta cannot be considered ethical. However, you cannot expect anything more from BJP. Ever since it came to power, Azam is being implicated in false cases. Azam sahib expressed faith in the law which will help him in coming days,” the SP chief said. He also said that Azam’s wife Tanzeen Fatima is unwell while his son has an injury in his hands.

Hailing Azam’s Mohammed Ali Jauhar University as a center of learning, Akhilesh slammed BJP for not doing enough to educate people and instead conspiring to fan communal hatred. He categorically charged the saffron party of resorting to politics of fear and hatred amongst religious communities. He said that the BJP used to claim that no riots can take place under its regime. “But what has happened,” he questioned, adding: “BJP dange karakar rajniti karti hai, kyuki dange honge to unse (BJP leaders) investment ke bare main, development ke bare main koi nahi poochega…nafrat failana dange karana yahi Gujarat model hai,” he said, while referring to Delhi riots.

“Despite the visit by US president Donald Trump, the BJP could not ensure enough security in Delhi which was hit by violence,” he said.

Reacting to protests against amended Citizenship law Akhilesh said the law has ended the recognition of the country. Quoting Swami Vivekananda, Akhilesh said the country did not need religion but employment that could feed its people. “But the BJP appears to have forgotten Swami Vivekananda’s preaching,” he said.

Title: Bhopal: Jacuzzi at Tatya Tope Stadium to help boost players’ performance
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

MP sports department has installed a Jacuzzi at Tatya Tope Stadium

BHOPAL: To help players recuperate fast after injury and also to enhance their performance , the MP sports department has installed a Jacuzzi at Tatya Tope Stadium .

Several modern techniques have been developed to improve players’ performance. Hydrotherapy (Jacuzzi or hot water tub) is one such technique. Video analysis and acupuncture have also been deployed to enhance performance and fast recovery of players after injuries.

Hydrotherapy involves the use of water to treat various injuries or ailments. Although it resembles swimming, it is different because it requires the individual to undertake different exercises in a warm pool of water.

Experts said that soaking in a hot water before and after workout can help loosen up muscles. This will make it easier to exercise and reduce chances of suffering an injury. Depending on the sport or activity, using the Jacuzzi before exercising can help improve performance. When muscles are loose and ready, agility and speed can increase.

Head of the sport science centre at Tatya Tope Stadium, Dr Jince Thomas Mathew, said hydrotherapy has become very important for players. “Muscle soreness and stiffness are the very common complaints among athletes. They experience the most after exercise or injury. Warm water therapy or jacuzzi helps blood vessels expand. It helps increase blood flow to the muscles and skin. Consequently, it helps prevent complaints of soreness and stiffness,” said Dr Thomas.

He added that benefits of Jacuzzi complement most fitness routines and also help relieve pain, stress, and tension in more than one ways. Modern-day hot tubs and Jacuzzis are not just confined to usage with hot water as one can also pour cold water into them and use them to cool off after workout if it is needed.

Director sports (in-charge), Vinod Pradhan, said that correction in technique during training plays an important role.

“We have started video recording the training sessions, which are analysed by the coach with the players so that his or her wrong approach could be detected and resolved,” said Pradhan. The department has also hired an acupuncture specialist. “After getting exhausted in matches and training sessions, an acupuncture specialist helps the players relax in a better way,” Pradhan added.

The sports department is running around 18 academies for different sports.

Title: Juvenile, two others held for rape of nine-year-old in Telangana
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Student back from Wuhan under observation in Karond
Content:
Representative image

Bhopal’s preparedness:

BHOPAL: A medical student who studied in Wuhan, China, is under ‘community surveillance’ in Karond area of Bhopal “The student is being monitored and has no symptoms of the novel coronavirus ,” said a health official. With incubation period still undetermined, the health department is not taking any chances. The student underwent 14-day quarantine in Delhi and reached Bhopal earlier this week. The student is expected to be in quarantine for another 10 days in Bhopal There are about a dozen people in Bhopal under ‘community surveillance’. So far, about 14 samples of the suspected COVID-19 patients has been sent to NIV, Pune. All tested positive. Across India, a total of 23,531passengers are currently under community surveillance through IDSP, according to the Union ministry of health and family welfare. There are around 700 such cases in MP, according to estimates.On Thursday, the MP health department conducted an emergency mock drill to ascertain its preparedness for dealing with novel corona virus (COVID-19), said chief medical and health officer (CMHO) Dr Sudhir Dehariya.“Mock drill was conducted at Bhopal international airport. Within 10 minutes, an ambulance and medical response team reached the spot. The mock patient was brought to JP hospital. 99% of the protocols were adhered to,” said Dr Dehariya. Madhya Pradesh has not reported any positive case of COVID-19.Passengers with travel history to COVID-19 infected nations are screened at the airport. List of countries under the radar has increased. People coming from South Korea, Iran and Italy or having such travel history since February 10, 2020, are being quarantined for 14 days on arrival.* Health department has 2,000 N95 masks* The masks would also be distributed within the community to deter spread* 500 personal protective equipment (PPE) worn to minimize exposure to hazard* One team with doctors and ambulance for transfer of patient to JP hospital* Hospital quarantine has been upgraded

Title: CBD to ease norms to sell shopping complex space
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: The Cantonment Board Deolali's (CBD) proposed shopping complex project has hit a roadblock after it received a lukewarm response from prospective buyers of shopping space.

The CBD has now decided to ease some of the stringent terms and conditions for those looking to purchase outlets.

The cantonment board had hoped to set up the state-of-the-art shopping complex on its 2,161 square metres of land at Howson Road. A tender was floated seeking buyers the board hoped would buy space in advance.

Currently, Levitt market — the cantonment's main commercial zone — has over 80 shops. Residents largely rely on this market for everything from vegetables to jeans.

“The board is thinking of relaxing and reframing some of the terms and conditions of the shopping complex project," said Ajay Kumar, the chief executive officer of the CBD. "This easing of norms will make buying space easier."

Members of the CBD are set to hold a discussion on the matter during the next board meeting.

Vice president of the board, Bhagwan Katariya, said buyers will need not pay the entire amount for buying the outlets in advance.

“They have to pay the total in installments. This will allow the board to start construction work of the complex," Katariya said. “I am now optimistic there will be good response from prospective buyers once the norms are relaxed," he added.

Board members said a contract to build the complex will be appointed after it receives some advance payments from the buyers.

In total, the complex will have 92 shops spread over two floors. The ground floor will have 50 shops and a restaurant; the first floor will have a bank and 40 shops.

Shops on the ground floor will cost buyers Rs 20 per sqft. Space on the first floor is being sold for Rs 15 per sqft.

Title: Huge scope for CA studies, new ICAI chairman
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Aurangabad: Charted Accountants (CAs) are in demand in every sector and pursuing CA studies offer good job opportunities at par with the IT field, said Ganesh Shilwant, new president of the Aurangabad branch of Western Indian Regional Council (WIRC) of Institute of Chartered accountants of India (ICAI).

“Many students and parents are unaware of career opportunities as CA. The profession has been witnessing an increasing role in the service sector as well as the manufacturing sector among other fields. Therefore, CA studies should be considered as one of the preferred career options,” he said.

Shilwant said that CAs have a lot of job opportunities in the country as well as in abroad. “The accounting system by and large remains the same across the globe. CAs are responsible for accountancy, audits, financial planning and fund management among other tasks. The talented professionals have job opportunities not only in India but also overseas,” he said.

Sharing his vision during his term for 2020-21, the newly elected chairman of ICAI said that he would lay focus on continuous upgradation of knowledge of students and members.

“Increasing the passing percentage is also one of the focus areas. At around 10% to 11%, the success rate of Aurangabad chapter is higher as compared to the national average, but we still want to increase it further by few digits,” Shilwant said.

The other new office-bearers of ICAI, Aurangabad, include Pankaj Soni (vice chairman), Rupali Bothara (secretary) and Ganesh Bhalerao (treasurer).

Title: Raj Thackeray: Rs 5,000 reward for info on Pakistani, Bangladeshi illegal immigrants
Content:
MNS chief Raj Thackeray.

AURANGABAD: The Aurangabad city units of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena on Thursday announced a reward of Rs 5,000 for anyone who would provide correct information to them about illegal immigrants from Pakistan and Bangladesh.MNS city unit president Satnam Singh Gulati told TOI that they had displayed a banner to this effect in front of the party office, which was inaugurated on Thursday.“At present, we have no information on the illegal immigrants. You never come to know when such things (illegal immigration) occur. If at all, such people are staying in the city, we will come to know from citizens. We will turn them (illegal immigrants) to the police and reward the informer,” Gulati said.He added that the announcement about the reward to mark the inauguration of the party office in Aurangabad. Thackeray was recently in Aurangabad and took a review of his party’s preparations ahead of the civic elections. It will the first major civic election after the split of the BJP and Shiv Sena. Political analysts feel that Thackeray is eyeing the space created by the Sena’s shift of allegiance to the Congress-NCP.In January, the MNS launched a new saffron flag bearing the royal seal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj (Raj Mudra). Party chief Raj Thackeray then supported the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) but opposed the national registers of citizens (NRC).The new flag was viewed as his party's endeavour to shift to the Hindutva bandwagon. During the march in Mumbai earlier this month, MNS workers raised slogans and wore saffron colour shirts.

Title: No love marriage oath: 3 profs of Amravati college suspended
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nagpur: Three professors of the Mahila Arts and Commerce College, Chandur Railway, in Amravati district, were suspended for allegedly making students take a bizarre pledge on Valentine’s Day that they “will not love anyone, never have a love affair or love marriage”.

The incident had occurred at National Service Scheme (NSS) camp at Tembhurna, organized by the college managed by Vidarbha Youth Welfare Society. The decision the suspend the three professors — principal Dr RS Haware, Dr PP Dande and NSS programme officer Dr VD Kapse — was taken after the society management took serious cognizance of the episode. The society also decided to institute a one-man committee to probe the incident.

A video where the students of the all-girls college took the ‘no love marriage’ pledge had gone viral and drew sharp reactions from across the socio-political spectrum.

A day after the incident, college principal Dr Haware had issued an apology and sought to justify his action by saying that “girls in their teens can be easily swayed by boys under the pretext of love and to prevent any future harassment of the girls we want to make them aware that they should first complete their education and avoid indulging in such activities till then”.

Former BJP minister Pankaja Munde had tweeted her sharp reaction terming it as ‘ridiculous and weird’. This year’s National Bravery Award winning girl from Mumbai, Zen Sadavarte, in a complaint to the police had even sought strong action against the college management.

Title: Application date for liquor retail shops extended
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Jaipur: The last date to apply for retail liquor shops online, which was to be ended on Thursday, has been extended to March 5th. Similarly, the same for physical application , which would be closed on March 3, has been revised to March 7.

Raj Liquor Welfare Society president Nilesh Mewara said that traders have found the business less rewarding after the department raised licence and application fees for the new financial year.

As per the new Excise and Temperance Policy, the application fees have been increased from Rs 28,000 to Rs 30,000. Similarly, the licence fees has also been increased from Rs 22 lakh to Rs 26 lakh.

The industry has written to the department to reduce the prices but their demand is yet to addressed, said Mewara.

The licence fees for bars in hotels and restaurants has also been nearly doubled and several associations have already protested against the steep hike.

Title: 20 blackspots identified on highways of rural Trichy
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

One of the blackspots identified in Thiruverumbur-Navalpattu road junction

TRICHY: The district road safety council has recognized 20 accident-prone stretches and spots on national and state highways , falling outside the Trichy corporation limits, as blackspots . Corrective measures such as establishing adequate high-mast lamps, speed reduction mechanisms, foot-over-bridge and subways were suggested by the council for the stakeholders to prevent accidents in future.

The council chaired by the district collector S Sivarasu identified the spots based on the suggestions from Trichy rural police. The spots fall within the jurisdictional limits of 14 rural police stations in the district. The locations were deemed as accident-prone based on the statistics of fatal and non-fatal accidents recorded in recent years. Thuvarankurichi, Thuvakudi and Jeeyapuram localities have the maximum number of blackspots. In Navalpattu, Bharathidasan University’s campus zone near Mathur on Trichy-Pudukkottai NH was identified as one of the 20 blackspots. Police and the road safety council have proposed a foot-over-bridge across the highway for the university students to cross the road. “Solutions that can be provided in a short span such as equipping the blackspots with adequate lights were insisted to be completed before the next road safety meeting ,” said M Sekaran, member of the road safety council.

In Thiruverumbur locality, Navalpattu road joining near the bus stop on Trichy-Thanjavur NH was identified as an accident-prone stretch. As a solution, a new service road in Thiruverumbur Bazaar Street and a subway for pedestrians to cross the stretch were suggested to be established. Buses halting at the NH near Thirupattur Road junction on Trichy-Chennai NH in Siruganur was identified as one of the causes of the accidents. Stakeholder departments including police, state highways and national highways project implementation units (PIU) were told to implement the precautionary measures for eliminating the blackspots at the earliest.

Title: Case against Twitter, WhatsApp, TikTok for anti-CAA content
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Hyderabad: Cyber crime police on Thursday said it has registered a case against Twitter, WhatsApp and TikTok for allegedly allowing anti Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) messages on its platform, following a court direction.

A local journalist, S Srishailam in his complaint in December last year alleged that messages uploaded by these social media groups are being allowed without verification.

After the enactment of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), some elements under the guise of freedom of expression, started a social media campaign against CAA, by allegedly misusing social media platforms and many of its users without corroborating these content, were circulating the videos and messages, Srishailam said in his complaint.

On February 18, Hyderabad police registered a case under sections 153 A (promotes or attempts to promote enmity on grounds of religion, race), 121A (conspiracy to commit offences punishable under the section), 295 A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs) and 120B (conspiracy) IPC.

Whole formal complaints were lodged against Twitter Communications India Private Limited, WhatsApp Inc, TikTok, and the case is being investigated, the issue came to light on Thursday, police said.

Earlier, the petitioner told the court that when he approached the police, no case was registered against the social media platforms and so he approached the local criminal court.

Title: Car falls into gorge, one killed
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Uttarkashi: A man identified as Arvind Singh Bisht, 40, died after the car he was traveling in fell into a 150-m-deep gorge at Dharasu-Jogat road in Uttarkashi district on Thursday. Police has sent the body for postmortem examination. According to sources, Bisht, a resident of Tehri, was heading towards Uttarkashi from Chinyalisaur on Thursday when the accident took place.

Soon after the accident, local villagers fished out the critically injured person and rushed him to community health centre in Chinyalisaur, where the doctors declared him dead.

Sub-inspector Vinod Thapliyal, in charge Dharsu police station, told TOI, “The body of the deceased person has been sent to the district hospital for postmortem examination.”

Title: Use of drones restricted, security beefed up for PM’s Prayagraj visit
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Labourers at work at Parade Ground in Prayagraj on Thursday

PRAYAGRAJ: Hundreds of policemen, several companies of paramilitary forces and a team of 55 doctors have been roped in for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Prayagraj on Saturday.

The prime minister would in city to distribute disability aids like wheelchairs and walking sticks to over 27,000 persons at Parade Ground. The district administration will also try to create a Guinness World Record of distributing the largest number of disability aids from a single location.

On Thursday, the district authorities announced a restriction on use of drone cameras in the city in view of PM’s visit. Officials said that those violating the order would be booked. ADM (city) Ashok Kumar Kanojia said, “If anyone wants the use drones for personal use, he/she would first have to seek permission from the district administration.” The SPG has taken over security arrangements ahead of Modi’s visit. Over one lakh citizens are expected to attend the event. Police personnel from seven districts of Prayagraj zone will be deployed as part of security arrangements for the event. Six IPS-rank officials, 12 ASPs, 50 circle officers, 90 inspectors, 30 sub-inspectors, 1,600 constables and 200 women constables would be deployed at the venue. Besides, eight companies of PAC, 10 companies of paramilitary forces, an SPG team, a bomb difusal squad and sniffer dogs will also be roped in.

A team of 55 doctors along with 47 paramedics and 56 ambulances would be ready to deal with any emergency.

Modi is expected to land at Bamrauli Airport around 11am on Saturday and would reach Parade Ground in a fleet of Indian Air Force three choppers.

After attending the event, Modi would head to Chitrakoot. He would return around 4pm to Bamrauli Airport and then leave for Delhi.

Additional chief secretary (home) Avnish Awasthi was in city on Thursday to review the preparations of PM’s visit. In view of Modi’s visit, district traffic police authorities on Thursday issued a road diversion plan for heavy, commercial and other vehicles.The entry of heavy and commercial vehicles into the city limits will remain restricted for 24 hours, starting Friday night.

Title: STF busts mass copying racket in Kaushambi
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

PRAYAGRAJ: Special Task Force ( STF ) on Thursday busted a gang involved in mass copying during UP board exams and arrested three of its members from Pipri area in Kaushambi district.

Police recovered three mobile phones, Rs 11,340 cash, 13 whatsapp chat screen shots, aadhaar cards and 31 answersheets.

Those arrested were identified as Yuvraj Singh Yadav, Rajan Babu Singh of Pipri and Pradeep Kumar alias Pappu Lal of Charwa.

Additional SP (STF) Neeraj Kumar Pandey told TOI, “Acting upon a specific input that members of a mass copying racket are active at several schools in Pipri and Charwa localities of Kaushambi, a team of STF ( Prayagraj unit) carried out a series of raids and nabbed three of its key operatives.”

“STF seized as many as 31 answersheets on Wednesday afternoon before they could be delivered to the examination cenres for submission,” added Pandey.

During interrogation, the arrested trio revealed that the copies were written on the directives of one Lala Yadav alias Bhagandar, resident of Tiyra village under Pipri police station.

They confessed that Lala Yadav was working for managers of the two private colleges located in Aswaral Kala and Singraur areas and the seized answersheets were to be delivered to the same colleges.

While Rs 5,000 each was paid to Pappu and Rajan, Yuvraj had received Rs 10,000 for delivering answersheets to colleges, said police.

STF claimed that two of the racketeers identified as KK Mishra and Siddarth Singh were charging Rs 35,000 cash per candidate to provide written answersheets for all papers.

Title: Bithoor sports fest commences in city
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Evening events at Bithoor Sports Fest were inaugurated by the DM at Green Park stadium on Wednesday

Kanpur: Bithoor Khel Mahotsava commenced at Green Park stadium on Wednesday.

Inaugurating the fest, district magistrate Dr Brahm Ram Dev Tiwari said that a total of 13 sports events will be held in Green Park stadium during the fest. This year’s attraction will be wrestling and boat race which have been included for the first time in the fest, said the DM.

Unlike all other events which are being organised in Kanpur city, the boat race will be held in Bithoor. The 3.5 km long boat race will be held from Siddheshwar Ghat to Brahmavarta Ghat on February 29. The administration has announced a prize of Rs 51,000 for winner and Rs 21,000 for runners ups while the second runner up will be given Rs 11,000. Traditional boats sailed by two boatmen will take part in the race, he added.

The DM said that the sports fest was being conducted on the instructions of divisional commissioner Sudhir M Bobde. Such programmes become a success with participation of youths, he added.

Meanwhile, the preparation are in full gear for the three-day Bithoor festival to be held in Bithoor from February 28. The theme of the festival will be freedom struggle of 1857.

The specail attraction of the event will be an exhibition on the life of freedom fighters Rani Laxmi Bai, Tantya Tope, Karimaullah Khan and others which will be inaugurated at on February 28. It will be followed by various cultural and patriotic events and a Kavi Sammelan in the evening. On February 29, various events for children, yoga competition will be held. The fest will conclude on March 1 with vintage car rally which will be taken out from NRI city to Bithoor Nanarao Park.

The sports fest faced criticism regarding the venue as sports lovers complained that the games being held under Bithoor Mahotsava were being played in Kanpur Nagar neglecting the players of Bithoor.

Title: To woo investors, industrial land in state to be geo-mapped
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Indore: All new industrial land parcels and undeveloped land in the state will be Geographic Information System (GIS) mapped, a move aimed at facilitating investors to lure fresh investments, said the industry department.

The department plans to start the process of geo-mapping all undeveloped land pool and new land parcels in the state from new fiscal.

Five industrial parks under Madhya Pradesh Industry Development Corporation (MPIDC) have already been brought on the GIS platform while the second phase will see a bunch of 11 industrial parks getting geo-mapped.

Principal secretary for industry Rajesh Rajora said, “We are in the process of bringing all industrial land be it developed or undeveloped on GIS platform. This work will be done in phases and ensure that investors get hassle-free business environment.”

Madhya Pradesh has 80 industrial parks under MPIDC and has a land pool of 1.40 lakh acre.

GIS mapping will help in providing real time information related to location, size, nearby areas to the land, waterline, electricity line and Inland Container Depo among others to the investors in a single glance.

Five industrial areas including Smart Industrial Park in Indore region, Babai in Hoshangabad and a land parcel in Rajgarh have already been available on GIS platform.

Rajora said, “In the new fiscal, we plan to go to all undeveloped land pool available with us under the industrial department to bring them on the GIS platform.”

According to department, the state has land pool at 150 places spread in different areas.

In Pithampur, around 1,500 acre is being pooled from farmers to expand industrial area so as to accommodate fresh industries . The department aims to develop around 400-500 acre of land every year to allot to industries.

Title: Social justice dept portal to be integrated with CCTNS
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Jaipur: The department of social justice and empowerment will be integrating its web portal, meant for financial assistance to the victims under SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act, with the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network and Systems ( CCTNS ) of police department.

Training will be given to the officials to integrate the web portal with CCTNS through video conferencing at the directorate of social justice and empowerment department from 11 am to 1 pm on February 28.

Principal secretary, social justice and empowerment, Akhil Arora said, "Under SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act, a departmental web portal to ensure financial relief to the victims and their dependents is already in operation." He informed that this training is being organized to integrate this portal with CCTNS.

The training will be participated by officer-in-charge police civil rights, district collectors and district magistrates, SP (railway), police officers from every police station, officers invloved in uploading the cases registered under the Act and other officials from the districts.

Title: Prosecution’s ‘huge efforts’ fail, two acquitted after 33 years
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

AHMEDABAD: In this case, the prosecution had undertaken “huge efforts” to bring evidence on record in a case of trespassing and beating, but the accused went scot-free. This was because the prosecution took these huge efforts nearly 33 years after the incident took place.

The metropolitan court has recently acquitted two persons – Tulsiram Jadav and Munna Thakor – of charges of trespassing, assault, damaging property and criminal intimidation in a 1987 case. This happened because the prosecution could bring only one witness in witness box and she too turned hostile.

The court acquitted the accused with observation, “The complainant and victim are not available, the prosecution could not bring evidence on record despite its huge efforts.” The court did not find evidence enough even to go ahead to the second stage of recording evidence by the accused and did not undertake the process of recording further statement under the provisions of Section 313 of the CrPC.

According to case details, four persons Jadav, Thakor, Cheluji Dabhi and Navin Madrasi were booked for assaulting people by illegally entering the house of one Dahiben Bhailalbhai in Khokhra locality in April 1987. The case remained pending for over three decades.

Most of the time, the accused persons were not available. Dabhi and Madrasi did not turn up in response to warrants and they were charged separately. Finally, when trial took place against the remaining two accused, witnesses did not turn up on court’s summons. The court was informed that the complainant and the victim had shifted from the place some 25 years ago.

In response to one summons, the court received a photocopy of death certificate of the witness. Even the investigating officer, PSI S N Sharma’s presence could not be secured in court as his whereabout could not be known after he retired from police service from his last posting in Vadodara.

The only witness that appeared in court in this case was one Calvina Christian. She said that she had no personal knowledge about the incident. She was declared hostile.

Title: Suspense over NID chief guest continues
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

National Institute of Design

AHMEDABAD: Even as the new date for National Institute of Design (NID) convocation has been announced, the suspense over chief guest at the ceremony continues. With the fiasco in February over last-minute cancellation and subsequent backlash, it’s likely that someone from the governing council may be given the responsibility to confer the degrees, mentioned sources close to the development.

While the internal communication to staff and students mentioned March 7 as the new date — as reported by TOI on February 15 — NID’s official website and social media handles are silent even as it’s barely a week before the big day for 300-plus students from Ahmedabad, Bengaluru and Gandhinagar campuses.

An email sent to students and staff members mentioned that the convocation is ‘rescheduled’ to March 7, 2020’ based on the decision of the governing council.

‘Minute-to-minute programme for the ceremony is being worked out and will be shared soon. You may proceed with the planning of display and other events accordingly in coming days,’ mentioned the email.

Officials of NID continued their silence over the issue

Title: Trichy: Cops hail five who saved many accident victims
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Banner placed by Perambalur police to recognise good Samaritan act of people in saving accident victims

TRICHY: Perambalur traffic police have erected hoardings lauding five people for their selfless and timely help in saving the lives of people injured in road accidents on highways passing through Perambalur. Police opined that such a move will motivate the public to take efforts in rushing the injured accident victims to the hospital without worrying about police inquiries.

Police said that five people namely B Munifur Rahman, V Subramani, M Senthamarai, K Srinivasan and V Muthu hailing from Thannerpandhal, Perambalur town and Duraimanagalam localities have saved over a dozen people battling for lives in road accidents.

Employed as drivers and running shops near the highways, they have never hesitated to save the injured people, the police said. National highways traffic wing of Perambalur police acknowledged that the five were of great help in controlling the fatalities in road accidents on Trichy-Perambalur-Chennai National Highways for over a year now.

Hoardings carrying their names and photographs have been erected congratulating the quintet at Thanneerpandhal and four roads junction localities. “There is a misconception that helping accident victims may land people in trouble. There is no such condition, people can just inform us about the incident over the phone,” T Gunasekaran, sub-inspector of police, Perambalur National highways traffic wing said.

Title: State grounds civic body’s land acquisition process
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: The state urban development department has stayed the Nashik Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) proposed land acquisition worth Rs 157 crore.

The NMC’s standing committee had convened a meeting on Friday to decide on various developmental works where proposals of land acquisitions were also to be tabled.

Even a general body meeting on the issue was slated to take place on Saturday.

The stay comes in wake of a letter sent by leader of opposition in NMC and senior Shiv Sena leader Ajay Boraste to state urban development department, alleging violation of norms of land acquisitions. The urban development department sent a letter to municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game on Wednesday directing the civic body to refrain from taking any decision on this issue till further orders.

Game has been directed to submit a detailed report about land acquisitions that has to be acquired and for what purposes. The opposition has alleged that the proposed land acquisition was supposed to benefit a section of the real estate firms.

A senior civic official confirmed that the state government has stayed the proposed land acquisitions. “The general body meeting had been called on Saturday to discuss the land acquisition proposals by the civic administration, but the meeting will not take place now,” he said.

During the general body meeting held on Monday, opposition party leaders had alleged financial irregularities in the land acquisition proposals.

Boraste had alleged that the priorities for acquisitions of land reservations have already been decided. “The NMC had acquired some lands of farmers in the past, but has still not paid the compensation. Hence, the administration should first give compensation to the farmers who had given the land for various projects to NMC in the past,” he had said.

The leader of the opposition also demanded that proposals of the land acquisitions should be tabled in the general body meeting before presenting it to the standing committee. Thereafter, Boraste had complained to the urban development department.

Title: ‘Need unity to fight for democratic values’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kozhikode: Samastha Kerala Jem Iyyathul Ulema president Syed Muhammad Jiffri Muthukoya Thangal has urged democratic forces in the country to intervene and stop the destruction of democratic values .

Inaugurating a function to mark a completion of 10,000 madrassas under the Samastha here on Thursday, he said it is imperative that secularism should survive in India. “The democratic parties should speak up when the Constitution of the country is being questioned. All should work in unison to protect the values that we have been nurturing so far,” he said.

Referring to the developments in Delhi in the past few days, Thangal said that those who were supposed to protect the people stood mute witness when the miscreants went on a rampage. “It is highly regrettable that those who have been staging peaceful protests are hunted down and killed,” he said.

Samastha general secretary K Alikutty Musaliyar presided over the function. Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala, Kerala Waqf Board chairman T K Hamza, Kozhikode MP M K Raghavan, Kozhikode Khasi Sayed Muhammad Koya Jamalullaily, historian K K N Kurup, Darul Huda Islamic University vice-chancellor Bahaudeen Nadvi Kooriyad and others spoke.

K S Madhavan, Pinangode Aboobacker, Abdusamad Pookkottoor, Abdul Hameed Faizy Ambalakkadavu, Onampilli Muhammad Faizy, Sathar Panthaloor and others spoke at the seminar on madrassas. Maharashtra Khasi Muhammad Alaudeen Quadiri inaugurated the delegates session. Participants from 14 states attended the conference.

An exhibition titled ‘The Heritage’, organized as part of the conference, will conclude on March 2.

Title: ‘Limit needs to save environment’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Trichy: G Sundarrajan, a member of the NGO Poovulagin Nanbargal, on Thursday said that purchasing beyond our essential needs will also amount to environmental degradation. He was the chief guest at Climate 2020 – a national seminar on climate change: Building resilience and mitigation strategies- organised by department of geology along with Poovulagin Nanbargal on Thursday at the National College Trichy.

He also asked the students to keep away from junk food and aerated drinks, which harms us and environment. “Many of us shop beyond our need without realizing that it was produced after polluting environment and consuming excess amount of water. Limiting ourselves beyond essential needs will certainly make a difference,” he said.

He said that a shopping mall in Chennai consumes 12,000 units of electricity for an hour, which is equal to the electricity need of an entire village for 12 days and added that we need to choose between luxury and need.

He that it’s not ‘Climate Change’ but ‘Climate Crime’ that we have been committing, he said we have already lost hundreds of lives of climate change.

When we say cyclone, people in the state were only reminded of the cyclone that hit Dhanushkodi of the Rameswaram coast. But Tamil Nadu has faced extreme climatic conditions in the last six years, which includes four cyclones and a massive flood killing hundreds of lives. tnn

Title: Telangana: Three of family die as car falls in canal; villagers rescue Class 8 student
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Rescue workers pulling the car out of AMR canal on Thursday

HYDERABAD: Three members of a family travelling in a car drowned in a canal of Alimineti Madhava Reddy (AMR) project at PA Pally in Nalgonda after their vehicle fell into it on Thursday morning. However, one of the family members, a class 8 student, was rescued by two villagers, who got into the canal and pulled him out of the vehicle.

Incidentally, it was the third such incident in the past month, wherein vehicles landed in water bodies, resulting in death of people travelling in them..

Around 8.30am, V Rangaiah, 40, his wife Alivelu, 38, their daughter Keerthi, 20, a BTech student, and son Karthik, a class 8 student, started their return journey to Hyderabad from Timapur village in Devarkonda, Nalgonda police said.

Around 8.45am, when they were travelling on the bund along the canal of AMR project, Rangaiah, who operates an earth mover, lost control over the vehicle and it slipped into the canal as there was no safety barrier.

A few minutes later, two locals — Vijay and Ram Babu, who were also from Timapur village and were passing by the bund, they spotted the car submerging in the water.

Immediately, they got into the water to save persons trapped in the car. Vijay and Babu could manage to pull out Karthik from the car, but minutes later it submerged completely in the canal, which was around 15 feet deep.

“When Vijay and Babu first saw the car in the canal, it was still afloat. By the time they saved Karthik, it started to submerge. Rangaiah, Alivelu and Keerthi died in the mishap,’’ deputy superintendent of police, Devarakonda division Anand Reddy told TOI.

Rangaiah’s family went to meet his parents in Timapur on Tuesday. Police were yet to ascertain what led to the car slipping into the canal.

Police, quoting Karthik, said none of them knew swimming and out of panic they did not get out of the vehicle.

Later, when police were informed about the accident, they reached the spot and, using ropes, brought out the car. The bodies were shifted to a local government hospital for post-mortem examination (PME).

Title: Youths oppose excessive quota in various fields
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Winners of the contest seen with dignitaries

Nagpur: Youngsters gave vent to their ire against excessive reservation in various sectors that deprives deserving candidates of their right to further their career as guaranteed by the Constitution of India.

These feelings were expressed by senior college students at the first intra-collegiate elocution competition on ‘Reservation in New India’, organized by Save Merit Save Nation (SMSN), in association with The Times of India, at LAD College as part of ‘Sanvaad’ programme recently.

The competition was inaugurated by LAD principal Deepali Kotwal while faculty member Prachiti Bagadey was the convener. Bhavna Khapekar was the coordinator. Educationist Shobha Dhanwatey, marathoner Mitesh Rambhia and Vijay Upadhyay were the judges. Rashmi Shukla conducted the proceedings.

The students deplored what they called abuse by political parties of the Constitution of India, framed by Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar, for vote bank politics. They said creamy layer rule and weighted indexing system should be made applicable in all reserved categories.

SMSN has taken an initiative to know and compile the views of youngsters on the subject for building a progressive India which will maintain a fair balance between merit and reservation. SMSN is against the divisive vote bank politics that often leads to caste hatred.

It has opposed excessive reservation which is more than 50% that leaves only one out of 10 seats to open category youngsters in education and jobs.

Navjot Kaur Dhoot of BBA second semester won the first prize in the contest. Ishani Vijayan and Amruta Dalvi of BBA fourth semester won the second and third prize, respectively.

College and student associations interested in holding such events can contact SMSN convener Brijesh Segan on 9822225776.

Dr Sanjay Deshpande, SMSN state president and Dr Anup Marar, secretary, said they intend to hold more such events to unite youths for building a progressive nation. “It is high time we keep aside hatred spewing divisive politics and exchange constructive thoughts in a positive manner,” they said.

Title: Students, public can visit BDU research centres today
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Trichy: The research centres and laboratories of 22 science departments at Bharathidasan University here will remain open for college and school students and the public on Friday in view of National Science Day. The university will conduct the annual National Science Day programmes on Friday and Saturday.

The ‘open day’ is observed to display the university’s research infrastructure and activities happening there.

The university has equipment worth several crores of rupees for research. They include Laser Scanning Confocal Microscope worth Rs 2 crore and Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy worth Rs 1 crore.

“Women in Science is the theme of the National Science Day this year. We have invited 150 colleges and many schools asking them to encourage girl students to visit the university,” said S Rajasekar, dean, faculty of science, engineering and technology, BDU.

The visit would motivate the students to take up a career in science in future, he added.

Title: Freighter from Nashik carrying fresh produce to NE on cards
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: A private airline has evinced interest in dedicating a freighter to transport fruits and vegetables from Nashik to the north-eastern states.

The project would be part of the Krishi Udaan scheme, a programme spelled out in the Union Budget.

Senior officials of SpiceJet and Halcon held a meeting in Mumbai on Wednesday. Officials from Spicejet told TOI that the airline was keen on starting cargo flights to ferry vegetables and grapes from Nashik to the Northeast.

“We are examining the possibilities of starting cargo flights from Nashik to the northeastern states,” said a senior official from SpiceJet without divulging more.

Currenly, only grapes are being sent from Nashik to Guwahati, which takes at least five days by road.

“It will take only three hours if the consignment is sent by air to Guwahati. We discussed sending fruits and vegetables fom Ozar airport to the Northeast with Spicejet officials. The airline wants to start a dedicated freighter to transport vegetables and fruits under the Krishi Uddan scheme,” said a Halcon official adding the capacity of the air cargo would be 18-20 tonne.

Halcon has developed an inland container depot (ICD) and an air cargo complex adjacent to the Ozar airport, which is equipped with a packhouse, cold storages and other facilities. Currently, Halcon exports around 4,500 tonne of fresh vegetables and fruits annually to London, Dubai and other international markets via Mumbai.

Halcon officials said farmers from Nashik and adjoining districts would get access to more markets if regular cargo flights begin from Ozar. Also, farmers would get a better price for their produce if air cargo services were started from Nashik to the Northeast.

Title: Telangana: CP promises cycles to girls
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Mahesh Bhagwat

HYDERABAD: Rachakonda police commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat on Thursday promised bicycles to 15 girl students of Hajipur.

Attending a ‘Face to Face’ programme at Hajipur village, organized by sarpanch Kavitha Venkatesh Goud, days after serial rape and murder convict M Srinivas Reddy was awarded capital punishment by a court at Nalgonda , Bhagwat said they had formed special teams to complete investigation in a record time and filed charge sheets in the three cases of rape and murder cases.

Title: Ex-Army man held with skin of three leopards in Champawat
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Pithoragarh: In a joint operation by a team of Special Operations Group (SOG) and forest department, an ex-Army personnel was held on Thursday and skin of three leopards recovered from his possession.

The accused, identified as Rajendra Nath, was trying to smuggle the skin in Lohaghat area of the district when he was nabbed near Barakot. Nath, according to the police, presently works as a security guard in a co-operative bank at Barakot.

“The accused was found to have shot down three leopards in the forest of Kali Kumaon range of Champawat district with his licenced gun,” said Manish Khatri, SHO Lohaghat. The official added that Nath went to Nepal several times and police is probing his connection with a Nepali smuggler.

On a tipoff from informer police and forest department stop a without number plate scooty at Chatri chauraha of Barakot and found three leopard skin in dickey, told Lokeswar singh, SP Champawat. The man is identified as Rajendra, resident of Patyuda of Barakot block of Champawat . The length of skin are 6 feet 10 inch and age is 7 years, second skin is 7.5 feet and are 9 years and third skin is 7 feet and age 9 years, told SP.

Title: Cops confuse saffron outfit member for a criminal, ‘open fire’ at him
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Strap: Hindu Yuva Vahini Functionary Released Later, Holds Protest At Police Station

Meerut: A functionary of a saffron outfit had a narrow escape when a bunch of policemen mistook him for a criminal and allegedly opened fire at him in UP’s Baghpat district. Vasu, a Hindu Yuva Vahini functionary, entered a wedding function to escape the policemen on Wednesday evening.

He was caught and later let off, but not before being thrashed by the policemen, according to allegation. Vasu-- who goes by his first name-- on Thursday held a protest outside Baraut police station with other outfit members and demanded action against the policemen.

“I was coming out of my gym in Baraut area when three men in civilian clothes came and opened fire at me. Scared for my life, I ran and entered a home where a wedding was going on. The policemen dragged me out and thrashed me. They released me only after realising that they had picked up a wrong man,” Vasu claimed.

When contacted, Baraut’s station house officer (SHO) Ajay Sharma said, “We had information that a wanted criminal was in the area. When a police team confronted a few man, they ran and opened fire. Police didn’t fire. He (Vasu) was held during the mayhem. We released him soon after we came to know that he was not the man we were looking for.”

Title: IIFPT-Thanjavur to be ‘institution of nat’l importance’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Trichy: The Union Cabinet has approved a bill to confer the status of institution of national importance on two national institutes of food technology, one at Kundli in Haryana and the other at Thanjavur in Tamil Nadu. This would help the institutions collaborate with overseas food institutes and improve the standard of education, IIFPT authorities said in Thanjavur.

The cabinet approved amendments to the National Institutes of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management (Niftem) Bill 2019 for this purpose, information and broadcasting minister Prakash Javadekar announced in New Delhi. IIFPT director Dr C Anandharamakrishnan expressed happiness and gratitude to the Union Government for approving the status for the institution. “The bill has to be passed by both the houses of Parliament. Once it is passed successfully, we will be conferred the status”, he added.

IIFPT Thanjavur is a national institute under the ministry of food processing industries. In its five decades of excellence in research, IIFPT has come up with many useful technologies for farmers and food industry stakeholders. In the recent past, the institute gained prominence through its unique approach to research and innovation. The centre is equipped with various food processing lines for training and incubation, quality testing and training facilities.

Title: Man held for murdering wife
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bijnor: Police in Amroha have arrested a man on Thursday for allegedly murdering his wife, who he claimed to have killed his two minor children.

Police said that the accused Mohammad Aasif took the extreme step after his ‘mentally ill’ wife allegedly murdered his minor children, adding that he even tried to portray his wife’s murder as a suicide.

According to police, the body of Saaema (26) was found hanging on February 13 while her two children — a two-year-old daughter and one-year-old son — were found dead under mysterious circumstances at their house in Sentali village.

Initially, Aasif had claimed that his wife hanged herself after killing her two children. However, the postmortem report revealed that the cause of death was stated as strangulation.

Based on a written complaint lodged by Saaema’s brother, an FIR under relevant sections was registered against Aasif, his brother Aakib, sister Salma, and sister’s husband Rizwan.

Investigation later revealed that Aasif had strangulated his wife on February 13.

Amroha superintendent of police Vipin Tada claimed, “The accused has confessed to his crime. He was embarrassed because she was mentally ill and used to roam around naked. Even though her treatment was going on, he wanted to get rid of her. He had tried to eliminate her earlier too but failed. When he returned home on February 13, he found his two children lying dead on the bed and Saeema was standing around their bodies. This enraged him and he strangulated her.”

Title: Goa: High court dismisses Godinho’s bail plea
Content:
Representative image
