Title: Man dupes people in CDMs, deposits amounts in his own accounts
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Rajkot rural police arrested a person for allegedly duping several people of lakhs of rupees including his employer by opening multiple bank accounts using fraudulent documents.

Accused Rajil Javiya, a native of Junagadh and resident of Rajkot, was operating nearly 16 bank accounts in various public sector and private banks branches in Rajkot and Junagadh.

According to the police Javiya used to target gullible labourers and senior citizens who are not well versed with technology. He used to stand outside various Cash Deposit Machines (CDM) and would offer people help when he saw them struggling to use the technology.

Talking to the media, Superintendent of police, Rajkot, Balram Meena said, “In the pretext of helping people deposit money in CDMs , Javiya would take their money and deposit it in own accounts in various banks.” The police said he opened multiple bank accounts with forged documents like PAN cards and election cards.

While working as an accountant with Rajdeep Corporation of Shapar in outskirt of Rajkot, Javiya had allegedly duped the owner of the company Kishor Vaghani by using Vaghani’s credit card to deposit Rs 5 lakh in his own account. He then presented fraudulent purchase bills and transferred another Rs 8 lakh from the company’s bank account in his own accounts through RTGS.

The police has recovered 12 passbooks of various banks and 18 debit and credit cards. The police asked banks to freeze the accounts with immediate effect.

Title: Kusumagraj’s birth anniversay marks Marathi Language Day
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nashik: Renowned Marathi poet, short story writer, novelist and playwright Kusumagraj’s birth anniversary, which is celebrated as Marathi Bhasha Gaurav Diwas, was observed with various events on Thursday.

Vishnu Vaman Shirwadkar, popularly known by his pen name of Kusumagraj, was the recipient of various national awards like the Jnanpith, Sahitya Akademi and Sangeet Natak Akademi awards among others.

The city houses a cultural edifice called Kusumagraj Pratishthan in his name. The organisers released a documentary on his life titled ‘Godakathcha Mahakavi’ at the Kalidas Kala Mandir. “We have worked for a year and have compiled a documentary. It is in Marathi and is divided in three parts,” said Chandrakant Kulkarni, the documentary’s director. The organisation would screen the documentary over the weekend.

The 19th-century city library Sa Va Na organised a children’s book festival where students participated in story and poetry writing.

“We had received nearly 200 entries each for poetry, short stories and posters categories. The prizes were distributed to the winners today,” said Sanjay Karanjkar, the head of Baal Bhavan. Mayor Satish Kulkarni and civic chief Radhakrishna Game paid floral tributes to the poet. The Nashik District Library and District Information Office jointly celebrated Marathi Language Day. A book exhibition on Marathi folk literature was organised .

Title: Rawat declares public holiday on Harela festival
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Dehradun: CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Thursday announced that July 16 will be a public holiday in the state on the occasion of Harela, a harvest festival which is marked by planting of saplings.

On February 23, during the ‘Manthan’ programme, the CM had made an appeal to people to carry out massive tree planation drives on Harela this year. On Thursday, Rawat said, “Harela connects us with the environment. Protection of environment has been in the culture of Uttarakhand. By declaring public holiday on Harela, people will be able to participate in plantation drives.”

Title: Waste plant protestor hospitalized
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Dehradun: A protester, Rajesh Sharma, who was sitting outside the Shishambara Waste Management Plant for several days in protest against government inaction in shifting of the plant, had to be hospitalised at the Government Medical Doon College on Thursday morning. Sharma had been on protest for almost two months. Residents of the area said that early on Thursday, his health started deteriorating rapidly and he was subsequently hospitalised.

“Rajesh Sharma has been hospitalised at Doon hospital after his health deteriorated. He was sitting right in front of the waste plant for the past two months. The stench emanating from the waste plant is harmful for any human being. Our protest has been going on for more than four months now and we are planning to march to Delhi to protest at the National Green Tribunal headquarters,” said Satpal Dhania, a protestor.

Title: Four desalination plants to be set up
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

RAJKOT: The state government will form special purpose vehicles (SPVs) to set up four desalination plants in Devbhoomi Dwarka , Gir Somnath , Bhavnagar and Kutch districts.

Gujarat Water Infrastructure Limited has formed a special purpose vehicle (SPV) with Mumbai-based Shapoorji Pallonji & Company and Aquatic System Asia Pvt Ltd to implement the desalination plant projects over the next two years.

“Two desalination plants are proposed to be set up at Gandhavi village of Devbhoomi Dwarka districtand Ghogha near Bhavnagar with capacity fo 7 crore litre water per day each and at Gundiyali village of Mandvi taluka in Kutch district with capacity of 10 crore litre water. Another plant with capacity of three crore litre per day will be set up at Vadodara Zala village of Sutrapada taluka in Gir-Somnath district ,” according to an official release.

Title: New Ambedkar statue planned at Race Course
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Artist’s impression of the new statue

VADODARA: A new statue of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar will be installed at Race Course Circle at the corner of the GUVNL Crossroads better known as Ambedkar Crossroads. While Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) mulls new installation, activists are concerned about the dignity of the existing statue as a flyover is being constructed over it.

The flyover from Genda Circle to Manisha Crossroads is passing over six crossroads. These include the Ambedkar Circle located at the junction of the R C Dutt Road and Racecourse Circle. Representations were also made by activists to the VMC asking the civic body to ensure that the statue did not lose its prominence.

Sources in VMC said that there were two opinions regarding the statue. Some suggested that the statue should be moved to a different location near the existing place while others suggested that it should be covered with an ornate decorative structure like a ‘ chhatri ’.

Eventually, the civic body has made up its mind to come up with a new statue with the small replica of a parliament at the corner of the junction itself. Land is available near the government quarters there.

VMC deputy mayor Jivraj Chauhan said that the idol will also be new.

“Architects have already made designs for the project that will come up in a space of around 2,000 square meters. Different artisans have submitted their work and rates for the idol too. The land where the project is being planned was allocated to VMC in 1984. Some minor procedures are pending and will be completed shortly following which work can begin,” said Chauhan.

Chauhan added that the existing statue will be shifted to the Ambedkar Museum coming up near Kalyannagar or any suitable place. “It will be painted and refurbished again,” said Chauhan.

Title: Passengers bear the brunt as cadres clash
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Passengers scheduled to leave Visakhapatnam airport allegedly faced problems due to the protests by the supporters of YSRC and TDP at the airport on Thursday.

According to sources in the airport, passengers faced troubles between 11 am and 1pm due to the protests.

Speaking to TOI, additional commissioner of police (traffic) Ch Adinarayana said the protests started from 11 am and concluded with the departure of the Naidu’s flight at 7.30pm.

Adinarayana, however, said, “No air traveller faced any problem owing to the protests as we had taken all possible measures to divert traffic.”

Meanwhile, a TDP source said that Naidu reached Hyderabad at 9pm.

Title: Video: Varun Dhawan, Ayushmann Khurrana, Arjun Kapoor and others shout "Jor se bolo, Happy Birthday" as they celebrate Shashank Khaitan's birthday
Content: 'Dhadak' director Shashank Khaitan turned a year older and he ringed in his birthday with his Bollywood friends. Celebs like Karan Johar Aparshakti Khurana , Rohit Dhawan, Tahira Kashyap and more attended the birthday bash at Shashank's residence.Paparazzi snapped the actors as they arrived at the venue. And now, KJo took to his Instagram to share a video of Shashank cutting the cake while the actors say, "jor se bolo, Happy Birthday" after the regular happy birthday song. Karan captioned the post, "Happy birthday @shashankkhaitan ❤️❤️❤️".Check out the video here:Varun looked cool in a funky printed shirt teamed with grey jeans and black shoes while Arjun wore a black t-shirt and pant with flip flops. Ayushmann, on the other hand, decided to go for an all-white attire. Also, Janhvi made heads turn in a black cami top with blue ripped jeans and sneakers.Meanwhile, on the work front, Karan will start shooting for his ambitious project, 'Takht'. On the other hand, Shashank will be helming Varun's next titled 'Mr Lele'. The film has been slated for 2021 release.

Title: Now, barricades to put brakes on ‘racing stars’
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The city police have decided to install barricades on Kowdiar–Vellayambalam stretch to reign in the menace of speeding that has been leading to frequent accidents.

City police commissioner Balramkumar Upadhyay has taken the decision following the latest accident on the stretch near Manmohan Bungalow on Wednesday night.

The strategically-placed barricades are expected to cut down the speed of the vehicles ahead of the dangerous curve near Manmohan Bungalow on the stretch that has become an accident-prone zone.

A car had crashed into the electric pole that stood on the median at the junction near Manmohan Bungalow on this stretch on Wednesday around 9.30pm. Five youths, who were inside the car, had sustained injuries. Among them, the condition of a 17-year-old youth, Amodh, is reported to be serious as he sustained injuries on the head. It is alleged that the car was racing with another motorcycle when it lost control and met with the accident.

“The decision is sure to cause much inconvenience to motorists, but we have no choice left when motorists misuse the freedom and engage in dangerous racing on the road,” said Upadhyay. Wednesday night’s accident was the third one on the junction near Manmohan Bungalow this month. Two weeks ago, two cars had rammed the electric pole on the median on the same spot in a span of 12 hours. The accidents occurred on February 10 and 11 respectively.

Meanwhile, as usual, the police have not been able to find out the circumstances that led to the accident as the surveillance cameras installed at the junction were not functioning. This revelation contradicts the claim by the police that all cameras in the city surveillance network were repaired in October last year ahead of the by-election in Vattiyoorkavu constituency.

The repair works were initiated following strong criticism after the police failed to secure any visual evidence of the movement of the car allegedly driven by IAS officer Sriram Venkitaraman causing an accident that claimed the life of journalist K M Basheer in August last year.

Upadhyay said that it was indeed true that the police had carried out maintenance works of the cameras. But it was done through private agencies and not through Keltron. Some of the cameras failed to function as they were imported and spare parts were not available here.

“The government is set to replace the existing surveillance network with a new and improved one under the Smart City project. The works in this regard are expected to commence soon. Hence the department does not wish to spend more money on repairing the old cameras,” said the city police commissioner.

The city police have around 240 cameras in its surveillance network. At present not even half the cameras are functional.

Title: TDP slams cops for detaining Naidu
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Amaravati: The TDP leadership has condemned the police for detaining party president N Chandrababu Naidu at Visakhapatnam airport on Thursday. Senior leader Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy said the police action showed the YSRC government’s undemocratic attitude.

Speaking to media in Nellore, Somireddy said chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy is afraid that Naidu will expose the CM’s land deals in Visakhapatnam.

He asked Jagan to show his mark in development instead of spreading factional politics. “Naidu’s detention is illegal and undemocratic. It is a total failure of the government to provide required security to the opposition leader’s tour in north coastal region,” said Somireddy.

Yanamala Ramakrishnudu, opposition leader in legislative council, slammed the police for working at the behest of YSRC leaders. “Naidu is loved by people of Vizag as they knew well as to how he recreated the city after getting it thoroughly damaged in Hudhud cyclone. Locals will never object to Naidu’s visit,” said Yanamala.

Title: Two elderly women among three electrocuted in state
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thrissur/Palakkad/Alappuzha: Two women labourers from Palakkad who were working in a paddy field in Thrissur and a KSEB worker in Kannur were electrocuted on Thursday. Also, a KSEB worker fell from a pole and died at Mavelikkara, reportedly after getting electric shock .

Kunji, 66, of Mudapally and Devu, 65, hailing from Kadamkode were cutting grass at the field at Moorkanad near Irinjalakuda when they came in contact with a broken live electric wire around 9.30am.

The women were employed in a home in the area for various works on Monday. On Thursday, they were deputed for works at the field near Moorkanad Siva Temple. They did not come for the lunch at noon and local residents started searching for them. Later, Kunji and Devu were found dead in the farm and a snapped electric line was found near them, Irinjalakuda police said.

After the inquest, the bodies were shifted to Irinjalakuda taluk hospital for postmortem.“We suspect that the women workers accidently touched a snapped broken electric line and it caused the death. A case was registered under section 174 of CrPC and the probe is on,” said a police official.

Mazdoor dies while repairing service wire

A KSEB employee was electrocuted at Thaliparamba in Kannur district on Thursday. P P Rajeevan was a mazdoor in the section office in Thaliparamba.

The mishap happened at 12.45pm when he was repairing a service wire to a house near Trichambaram temple after switching off the line. But when Rajeevan was repairing the wire, he suffered electric shock and died.

According to KSEB officials, the electric power flowed to the service line from the inverter in the house, which remained on while he repaired the service line. However, this could be confirmed only after a detailed examination, and the officials from the Electrical Inspectorate have started a probe, the officials said.

They also said the officials would investigate if there was any other reason that caused the mishap.The body was shifted to Government Medical College, where autopsy would be conducted on Friday.

KSEB worker suffers head injuries from fall, dies

A 46-year-old worker of KSEB died after he fell from an electric pole after he reportedly got an electric shock at Mavelikkara here on Thursday. The deceased has been identified as Kamalahassan of Cherthala, and the incident took place near Government LP School, Puthiyakavu, Mavelikkara.

Circle inspector B Vinodkumar said they have not confirmed whether he died due to electric shock or not. “He suffered severe head injuries after falling from the pole. We did not see any burn marks that normally happen due to the electric shock. We can confirm the exact cause of his death after an autopsy to be held in Alappuzha Medical College Hospital on Friday,” the circle inspector said. He leaves behind his wife Moly and children Sethulakshmi, Ashtapathi and Adarsh.

Title: Man kills son over land dispute in Rajkot
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: A man bludgeoned his son to death over a land dispute in Lath village of Upleta taluka in Rajkot district on Thursday.

Police said the accused, identified as Magan Marvania (62) picked up a blunt object and hit his son Sanjay Marvania (45) on his head, killing him on the spot.

“After the murder, Magan himself called us up and surrendered. During his interrogation, Magan said there had been a dispute going on between him and Sanjay over putting latter’s name in the ancestral land, over which the duo had fought frequently in the past,” said an official from Upleta police station.

On the fateful day after heated arguments, Magan killed Sanjay in a fit of rage.

Title: ICSE helps students to manage time better
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Nagpur: ICSE’s language exam comes with a valuable time management guidelines by the board which is helping students to pace their exams well. Every question in English exams (there are two papers) comes with an advice to students about how much time they should be spending on it.

The most recent example is the English-1 exam where every question came with a clear mention of the suggested time limit. CISCE board, popularly known as ICSE which is the name of its Std X certificate, clearly mentioned, “Do not spend more than 30 minutes on this question” on top of question number one.

This pattern was followed throughout the paper in all five questions. Students were advised in each question about the maximum minutes they should spend on them.

Kenneth Mendonca, principal of Chanda Devi Saraf School, said “This has been a trend for quite some time in language papers. No doubt, it is of immense help to students because this gives them a clear idea on time management during the crucial board exam.”

A few state board academicians say this is something which should be implemented by other boards as well. Ashok Gavhankar, a senior academician, said, “In board exams, it is all about time management. Many times children get nervous and are unable to time themselves leading to anxiety when they enter the last 30 minutes.”

Indira Gandhi National Open University (Ignou) does something similar during its exams where it tells candidates the expected length of answers. P Sivaswaroop, regional director of Ignou, said “We give approximate word limit so that students do not spend too much time on a particular question and struggle with the others.”

This also eliminates the problem of students devouring extra answersheets in the misguided belief that writing long answers will get them more marks.

Title: SDPI seeks police protection for commercial establishments
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Coimbatore: Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) leaders petitioned the city police deputy commissioner on Thursday, seeking protection for their commercial establishments from the right wing outfits during the pro-CAA rally to be held in the city today.

In their petition to deputy commissioner L Balaji Saravanan, president of the SDPI trade union V M Abdul Raheem and functionaries said that in 2016, BJP cadres had ransacked their shops. They requested police to take necessary steps to prevent any untoward incidents.

A petition submitted by All Biryani Shop Owners Association went viral on social media on Thursday. The petition sought police protection for their shops as well as for their vessels from BJP cadres, who were planning to conduct a pro-CAA rally from CTC Corner to Big Bazaar Street in Tirupur on Thursday.

Meanwhile, the BJP district advocate wing petitioned the Tirupur south police on Thursday evening, seeking action against those spreading fake petition on social media. “Some people are spreading fake messages to tarnish the image of BJP,” the petition said.

Title: Day after judge sought FIRs for hate speech, changed bench says situation not conducive
Content: NEW DELHI: A day after showing urgency to prosecute four BJP functionaries for their alleged hate speeches, a changed bench of Delhi high court on Thursday accepted the stand of Delhi Police that the situation at present was not “conducive” to register FIRs.Adjourning the matter for April 13, a bench of Chief Justice DN Patel and Justice C Hari Shankar also allowed the plea of the Centre to become a party to the PIL that has sought lodging of FIRs and arrests of those who gave the hate speeches. The court said it was a “necessary party” given the nature of prayers made.On Wednesday, Delhi Police had come under fire before a bench of Justices S Muralidhar and Talwant Singh, which had taken a dim view of delay in booking Kapil Mishra , Parvesh Verma and Anurag Thakur.Justice Muralidhar was transferred late on Wednesday to Punjab and Haryana high court, days after the Supreme Court collegium made the proposal.When Solicitor General Tushar Mehta repeated the arguments on Thursday, adding that police had decided to defer registering FIRs for now “looking at the complexity of the situation”, the Chief Justice-led bench agreed to grant four weeks for a reply to be filed.Mehta said, “The paramount concern should be welfare of citizens. Not all are present before the court. Even they are suffering.” He maintained that the authorities had examined all the audio/video clips and other materials, including that on Twitter and “after having carefully considered all these materials, a conscious decision was taken to defer the decision on the question (of lodging FIR).”However, the AAP government standing counsel Rahul Mehra urged the bench to issue urgent directions in view of the seriousness of the situation in northeast Delhi and pointed out that “the court had asked why FIRs regarding hate speeches were not lodged when FIRs for other offences had been registered.” Mehra added that 48 FIRs had been registered for deaths, arson, loot and other offences committed in that area.Senior advocate Colin Gonsalves , who appeared for petitioners Harsh Mander and Farah Naqvi, urged the court to keep up the pressure on police to take action, arguing there is “hatred in the air” due to the alleged hate speeches and “it had resulted in deaths, arson and looting.” He submitted that an FIR must be lodged immediately and “these people should be arrested and taken off the streets.”During the hearing, senior advocate Chetan Sharma also mentioned a plea by Lawyers Voice, which wants FIRs against Congress president Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others for allegedly giving hate speeches. “Why did people come out on streets during President Trump’s visit? Who sent them? It needs to be investigated and such persons arrested,” he argued.

Title: Coimbatore: 485 cases booked for parking violations
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The city traffic police registered as many as 485 cases on Thursday for parking vehicles on no-parking zones and imposed a fine of Rs 100 each on the motorists .

Police had banned parking on Cross Cut Road, 100 Feet Road, RS Puram, Saibaba Colony, Peelamedu, Papanaickenpalayam, Hope College, Singanallur, Ondipudur, Ukkadam,Oppanakkara Street, Big Bazaar Street, Podanur and Kurichi. But public had demanded action against the motorists, who ignored the ban.

Subsequently, police commissioner Sumit Sharan instructed deputy commissioner of police (traffic) R Mutharasu to take action against the violators. On Thursday morning, traffic police personnel, who conducted a special drive, chained the motorcycles parked on no-parking zones and locked the wheels of cars with clamps. The personnel issued challans under the motor vehicle Act and imposed a fine of Rs 100.

“We have been creating awareness among motorists about no-parking zones for the last one week. From Thursday, we decided to book the violators,” Mutharasu said. “We imposed fines on 89 heavy vehicles, 173 four wheelers and 223 two wheelers. If the motorists repeat it again, the fine amount will be increased,” the officer said.

Title: Museum & med college areas to become no-vending zones
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The city corporation has decided to declare the area near the main entrance of Medical College, premises of dental college, entrance of Museum and area in front of Museum police station as no-vending zones. The decision, which was made by the town vending committee (TVC), was approved by the corporation council during the meeting held on February 13.

TVC decided to make the area in front of Museum as no-vending zone considering the historical importance. The town planning committee has also received the approval of corporation council to prepare a city street vending plan (CSVP). The expression of interest will be invited from agencies for preparing CSVP.

The corporation plans to rehabilitate authorized street vendors from areas declared as no-vending zones to new vending zones. An area in Chalakuzhy was earlier identified by town planning committee to rehabilitate vendors from the entrance of Medical College. However, this is likely to be revised in accordance with Kerala street vendors (protection of livelihood, regulation of street vending and licensing) scheme, 2019.

The museum and zoo department has recently forwarded complaint to corporation regarding the functioning of street vendors in front of Museum entrance.

As part of CSVP, the vending zones, restricted vending zones and no-vending zones shall be identified based on volume of traffic, number of pedestrians passing through the street and potential of the area of the street. Vending zones will also be determined based on intensity of footfall, road width and density of vehicular and pedestrian movement. Restricted vending will be linked with road width; for instance there will not be any stationary street vending on road having width up to 3.5 metres. The number of street vendors shall be decided by considering holding capacity of each designated vending area on such road.

TVC will also classify vendors as stationary vendors, mobile vendors and mobile vendors using motor vehicles. The vending fees will be determined for three categories based on area; upto 10sq.ft, 10-25sq.ft and more than 25sq.ft. The scheme also has provisions to cancel the certification mainly in case of sub-letting of licenses, a problem which has always remained unaddressed within corporation limits.

Corporation has so far done two surveys of street vendors. As per the first survey, 1,881 vendors have been identified of which 554 persons have been issued ID cards. License has not been distributed to any of the vendors so far. Around 1,599 vendors were identified in the second survey. Certain conditions have also been laid down for issuance of certificate. The vendor shall not have any other means of livelihood and he/she should not vend in any other place and shall not lease, rent or sell the certificate to others.

Title: Recession may hit S’pore due to outbreak
Content: I have been living in Singapore for 18 years now. I was there during the outbreak of SARS in early 2003 and saw how well Singapore manages epidemics there. But things are very different this time around.Lee Hsien Loong, prime minister of Singapore, has said the possibility of a recession looms over Singapore with the coronavirus outbreak already hitting the economy more severely than what SARS did 17 years ago.I can myself feel the pinch big time now. For eight years, I have been into film distribution. Now, my business is severely affected because people are hardly watching movies there. A film, which would earlier have made a certain amount of dollars in a day, doesn’t get that collection even in 10 days.I came to Kolkata in December and was supposed to go back in January. But I met with a small accident and I had to stay on till early February. By then, the news of the coronavirus outbreak spread. Since my work involves meeting people from all walks of life, especially across South East Asia and China, I was advised by doctors to stay back in Kolkata till the situation came under control. Since my work demands me to continuously meet people at cafes and other places, I am susceptible to the virus.With no options left, I have settled for meetings over Skype and phone. However, these interactions are not equivalent to face-to-face meetings. So, it has affected me professionally. I was supposed to attend the Hong Kong Film Festival. But now, that, too, has been postponed from April to August-end.Tourism has also been hit badly. Even the business of the cargo guy, who handles all my film consignments, is in doldrums.The biggest issue is that the attack isn’t even detected early. The Singapore airport is the most easily accessible and prominent one in this region. I fear I can contract the disease from travellers at the airport. Even if I reach Singapore and have to return to India for some work, I might have to go through a quarantine period. That will again impact my work. Keeping all these in mind, I have decided to stay back in Kolkata till at least the end of March.(Sen is a film producer and a distributor who lives in Singapore)

Title: Snapped wires: KSEB awaits pilot test results
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Electrocution due to snapping of live overhead power lines may come to an end if the pilot implementation of Moulded Case Circuit Breaker ( MCCB ) by KSEB in Thiruvananthapuram district proves successful.

At present, there is no proven technology or device that can be used as a tripping mechanism on power distribution lines. “Most of the unfortunate electrical accidents involving public happens when they accidentally touch upon live power lines. The higher capacity lines, 11KV and above, have tripping mechanism so that they would go dead the second they snap. But in the case of low tension distribution lines that criss cross the entire state, there is no tripping mechanism, other than the fuses. But on most occasions, snapped wires remain live and pose threat to lives. It’s in this context that the board has decided to test on pilot basis a Smart MCCB that a private manufacturer has offered for use in distribution lines,” KSEB director (system operations and safety) N Venugopal said.

Spectrum Infra Ventures (P) Ltd has demonstrated operations and functionalities of the system as the part of their smart distribution and power management system at Vydhyuthi Bhavan in November last year. During the demonstration, the company had claimed that Smart MCCB has many advantages over the traditional switch gears and have special features, including automatic cut off of the outgoing LT supply of distribution transformer or LT distribution line whenever a heavy fault occurs in that line. It could be operated remotely and can be used as a monitoring and auditing system for electrical parameters of the line.

“The Smart MCCB may reduce the electrical accidents to public and animals and may improve safety and quality of supply. However, technical feasibility of this equipment can be asserted only after conducting necessary test on a trial installation or pilot project on a selected LT distribution network at a selected area. If the system proves effective, KSEB would certainly use the same throughout the distribution network so that unfortunate deaths can be avoided,” Venugopal said.

The private company has been given permission to install the MCCB system at their own cost in one of the remote LT distribution networks under Nedumangad electrical division. The company is expected to start the pilot programme in another few weeks.

Title: Finish land acquisition by March 1: CS
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kakinada: Chief secretary Nilam Sawhney has directed East Godavari district management to complete land acquisition for housing scheme for the poor. She conducted a review meet with the collector and other officials in Kakinada on Thursday.

Sawhney asked the collector to take possession of plots , prepare layouts and allocate sites to the beneficiaries through lottery. Stating that the land acquisition is satisfactory in rural areas of the district, she said the process needs to be fast-tracked in urban areas. She said the focus should be on land acquisition in Kakinada, Rajahmundry and Tuni towns and be completed by March 1.

Collector D Muralidhara Reddy said 2.10 lakh beneficiaries in rural area and 1.20 lakh beneficiaries urban area were enrolled and 7,700 acres are needed for the scheme. In view of the land price and dearth of vacant spaces, he said it has been proposed to allow house sites for G-Plus housing which can reduced requirement to 3,800 acres. He said 3,100 acres of government land was available and process was on to acquire another 850 acres.

Title: Textbook sale from schools opposed
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: Members of Vadodara Book Sellers Association have threatened to surrender their licenses if the state government does not reverse its decision to allow sale of textbooks from school only.

The education department earlier this month notified that schools will have to sell textbooks with QR code to students directly and have banned books published by private publishers. Schools will get a commission of 12.5% on sale.

Association said they will lose their business and the current stock which they hold will be rendered useless.

In Vadodara district alone, book sellers have a stock of textbooks worth at least Rs 5 crore. “We will not be able to sell these textbooks as now onwards textbooks with QR code will have to be used,” said an office bearer of the association.

On Thursday, while addressing the media the association members said that if the government will not withdraw its decision, they will surrender their licenses. Students studying in schools affiliated to state government board use textbooks published by Gujarat State School Textbook Board.

Title: Indian Navy to induct 24 multi-role choppers in early 2021, ENC to get 12
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam:The Indian Navy is set to induct 24 MH-60R Multi-Role Helicopters (MRH) worth around $2.2 billion through foreign military sales. Half of these helicopters — that is 12 — will be stationed at Visakhapatnam under the Eastern Naval Command (ENC) while the remaining 12 will be with the Western Naval Command (WNC). The delivery of the helicopters is likely to begin early 2021.

The move comes at a time when the Indian Ocean Region is witnessing increasing security threats due to proliferation of submarines.

The helicopters can be employed for offensive and defensive roles, including anti-submarine warfare, anti-ship strike, low-intensity maritime operations, search and rescue, over the horizon network-centric operations and electronic warfare.

These helicopters are a replacement for the Sea King 42/42A helicopters, decommissioned in the 1990s, and envisaged to operate from frontline ships and aircraft carriers providing them the critical attributes of the flexibility of operation, enhanced surveillance and attacking capability.

A spokesperson from the ENC said, “The acquisition, which is worth about $2.12 billion, was approved by India’s top defence clearance body, the Cabinet Committee on Security, which is headed by the Prime Minister. We can expect 12 of them for ENC while the other 12 for WNC.” The acquisition of MH-60R as envisioned in the ‘Capability-Based Perspective Plan’ provides the Indian Navy with a key capability and contributes to the Make in India initiative.

As part of the Indian Navy’s commitment to the ‘Make in India’ initiative, the OEM (original equipment manufacturer) M/s Lockheed Martin would also be discharging offsets through the transfer of technology to Indian offset partners for the manufacture of products and services. This would enable the absorption of niche technology, skill development and manufacture of eligible products or services leading to a generation of employment, skilling of MSMEs and indigenous production of products for buy-back by the OEM.

Title: Aadhaar & pension: Another milestone for her
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Kollam: Bhageerathi Amma of Prakkualam in Thrikkaruva gramapanchayat in Kollam continues to be in the limelight. She excelled in the equivalency exam conducted by the State Literacy Mission at the age of 105 and got mentioned in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly ‘Mann Ki Baat’. Now, she will secure an Aadhaar card and will become eligible for welfare pension .

The Times of India had reported her great achievement by appearing for the equivalency exam. In that report, it had been stated that she was not yet considered for old age pension citing that she had no Aadhaar card to claim the benefit.

The Aadhaar registering authority had once tried to collect the data. But, owing to her old age her fingerprints could not be taken and iris scan could not be conducted successfully. Citing this the grama panchayat authorities were denying her social security pension.

Following the TOI report, Bank of India Niramankara branch officials told TOI that they would take extra effort to go to Kollam and try to record her biometric details.

As her inspirational success story got figured in the Prime Minister’s Mann Ki Baat on the other day, the bank officials got excited and they came to Kollam on Wednesday. As they alerted the UIDAI authorities in Bengaluru they took over the system and tried to remotely record the details. But, as they found it difficult to record her fingerprint and iris scan they allowed the Aadhaar enrolment staff of the bank to record it on their own.

Bank of India team led by manager P Prasanth, assistant manager N Riyaas, Aadhaar enrollment supervisor Anukiran and technician Soumya recorded the details. “Aadhaar card would be readied in four–five days,” said Anukiran.

“Mother was disappointed over not receiving the pension citing absence of Aadhaar card. Now, she is happy that she could get the social security pension,” said Thankamani Amma, daughter of Bhageerathi Amma.

KB Vasanthakumar, the literacy mission key resource person said it was the most prestigious moment for him in his 30-year-long association with the literacy movement.

“With the Prime Minister himself recognising her achievement, the Aadhaar authorities were also enthusiastic about granting her the card,” he said.

Hearing about the Bank of India initiative, Corporation Bank Thrikkaruva branch officials came to her house and opened her savings account.

Thrikkaruva gramapanchayat president K Chandrasekhara Pillai said the panchayat would complete the formalities on the day she received her Aadhaar card to grant her pension. Her literacy trainer S N Shirley was also present.

Title: Cable TV distribution major hauls local operators to court
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: At a time when cable television is almost on the brink of becoming history, city seems to be witnessing a fresh cable war.

In what appears to be an attempt to retain existing customers , a cable television operator in Manjalpur area of Vadodara has been giving new set-top boxes and additional number of channels to its customers. While sources claim that this may be a strategy to stop people moving onto other television platforms including DTH and fibre optic network, it is being done illegally and allegedly for ‘personal gains’ only.

However, to restrain this operator and also other operators from indulging in such illegal competition in cable business, Den Networks Ltd and Fortune (Baroda) Network Pvt Ltd (FNPL) have moved court against nine cable operators in Manjalpur. These nine operators hold 49% in FNPL holdings. The nine cable operators and Den Network Ltd had formed FNPL as a joint venture (JV) company in 2008 to provide cable television services in Manjalpur area. While the agreement signed at the time of forming the JV restrains any competitive business by any of the parties, one of the cable operators – Kirit Patel – started promoting cable television services of New Delhi-based Infiniti Television and Telecom Pvt Ltd, and also Indore-based ACN Digital Pvt Ltd in the city. “The cable operators, who are the shareholders, cannot engage in any competing business directly or indirectly as per the agreement so what has happened so far is a clear breach of it,” said FNPL and Den Network’s advocate Jaideep Verma. He added that the court has admitted the petition and had also served notices to the respondents. The next hearing will take place on March 2.

According to the case presented by FNPL and Den Network, Patel assured customers and other cable operators that the two competing companies’ services are trustworthy and better compared to FNPL’s and Den Network’s. He even got set-top boxes changed without the customers’ permission. Earlier the cable television subscribers had Den Network’s set-top boxes but after Patel’s collusion with the competing companies, the customers got set-top boxes of ACN Digital Pvt Ltd.

The petition states that Patel colluded with the New Delhi company and became its director. The New Delhi company is a majority shareholder in the ACN Digital.

Title: Govt orders CBI probe into 2017 rape
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Vijayawada: The Andhra Pradesh government on Thursday ordered a CBI probe into the alleged rape and murder of a minor girl, who was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Cattamanchi Ramalinga Reddy Residential High School in Kurnool district in 2017.

Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy had met the victim girl’s parents a few days ago.

Jaganmohan Reddy had assured justice for the victim and said that their government will refer the case to CBI for further investigation.

The AP government on Thursday issued the necessary order for an investigation by the CBI. tnn

Title: Decade after renovation, Deepak open air theatre to be history
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

VADODARA: It’s curtains for the historical Deepak Open Air theatre located in the Madanjhampa Road area.

After refurbishing the theatre at a cost of Rs 5.5 crore with added facilities designed by the Institute of Indian Interior Designers (IIID), the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) finally decided to raze parts of the new additions to help a community hall come up at the site now.

The theatre, considered as part of the city’s history was renovated in 2009 under VMC’s golden goals. But the project hit roadblocks right from its inception. First the contractor who was awarded the renovation work gave up the project. He was blacklisted and after much efforts another agency was identified to complete the work.

The refurbished theatre was eventually inaugurated in 2015 amid much fan-fare. This too proved to be short-lived as there were hardly any bookings for cultural events.

The renovated theatre got three bookings in 2016-17 and just one in 2017-18.

Congress corporator Balasaheb Surve in whose ward the theatre falls along with others started arguing that the facility should be used for some other purpose. It was suggested that it should be given to people for holding functions like marriages.

Discussions regarding identifying some alternative use for the facility began last year and it was eventually decided to redo the theatre again with minimal expenses so that it could be used as a community hall. The budget for the ensuing financial year also included the work.

Standing committee on Thursday cleared a proposal to raze some parts of the theatre.

The VMC plans to raze two of the four food stalls, the security cabin, rooms added behind the stage and the amphitheatre-like sitting arrangement with rooms below it. A kitchen will be made behind the stage and an existing hall will be extended. Two counters for serving food will also come up.

“We want to ensure that the changes are done with minimum expenses. The space was lying unused and with the changes it will be utilised and will also generate some revenue for us,” said VMC standing committee chairman Satish Patel. The agency demolishing the parts of the facility will also pay Rs 2.51lakh to VMC.

Title: Gujarat: Man charred to death as car goes up in flames
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

PALANPUR: A 55-year-old man was charred to death when his car suddenly went up in flames near temple town Shamlaji on Thursday.

The deceased was identified as Ganpat Patel, chairman of a local milk union associated with Sabar Dairy in Himmatnagar.

The accident happened around 2.30pm near Sareja village, five from Shamlaji, on Bhiloda road, said police.

Police said the car driver jumped out as soon as he sensed the flames and survived. However, Patel who was sitting in the rear seat was charred to death on the spot.

The car was running on CNG.

Title: Fire breaks out at Vellalore dump yard, extinguished
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: A fire broke out at the Vellalore dumpyard of the Coimbatore City Municipal Corporation on Thursday morning.

Personnel of fire and rescue services rushed to the spot and controlled the fire by around 4pm. As many as six fire engines, 12 water tankers, four earthmovers and 60 personnel worked together to bring the fire under control. Smoke had spread to neighbouring areas such as the Podanur-Chettipalayam Road.

Corporation commissioner J Sravan Kumar said they controlled the fire by late afternoon. “But there is still smoke and we are trying to put it out completely. It was just a small fire and we were able to control it as we reached there immediately,” he said.

The fire could have been caused by the rising temperature and the presence of methane generated in the yard, Kumar said. “The fire had broken out in one heap. As we had compartmentalized the yard, it did not spread. It was well within an acre.”

Activists, meanwhile, said the yard flaring up has almost become an annual affair now. They said the civic body only reacts to the incidents of fires, but doesn’t take proactive measures to prevent them.

Organizer of the Vellalore dumpyard opposition committee J Daniel Jesudass said there has to be a permanent provision for putting out fire at the dump yard. “We have been asking authorities to station five fire engines at the yard. It has not been done. Considering the frequent incidents, a fire sub-station should also be set up there,” he said.

Last year, there were two major fires at the 650-acre dump yard one in March and another in August. In the March incident, fire had spread over 80 acres and a chopper from the Sulur Air Force Station was deployed to extinguish it.

Title: Bareilly mosques to conduct prayers for peace in country
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bareilly: Expressing concern over violence in parts of Delhi, Salman Hasan Khan, national vice-president of Jamat Raza-e-Mustafa, an organisation affiliated to Dargah Aala Hazrat, on Thursday appealed to imams of Bareilly to conduct special prayers in their mosques on Friday for the peace in the country, especially in Delhi which saw 38 lives lost in a spate of violence.

Khan said, “Strict action should be taken against leaders who are instigating riots with their inciting speeches. Besides, action should also be taken against those policemen who were found helping rioters, as shown in some videos uploaded on social media.”

Condemning attacks on religious places, Khan said, “The Constitution provides for the protection to religious places and structures, but rioters damaged religious sites in Delhi in presence of police. In the prevailing atmosphere, it seems that our mosques are not safe, which is a matter of concern.”

The organisation demanded compensation and jobs for the families of those who were killed in the violence. Organisation members said a delegation would visit the violence-hit areas in Delhi, soon.

Title: Rs 5.35cr sought to develop infra in minority-populated areas
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Coimbatore: The backward classes and minorities welfare department under the district administration has sought funds to the tune of Rs 5.35 crore to develop infrastructure in areas where people from the minority community reside, officials said.

Officials of the department said the funds were meant for constructing anganwadis and classrooms and toilets in schools in areas where minority communities live, such as Kurichi and Kuniyamuthur. “We had sent the proposal to the state, which had approved it and sent it to the Centre. We are now awaiting Centre’s nod.”

On Thursday, vice-chairperson of the National Commission for Minorities George Kurian visited the Coimbatore district collectorate and held discussions with district administration authorities and representatives of minority religious communities such as Muslims, Christians, Sikhs and Jains.

Kurian gathered information from the district administration officials on how the Prime Minister’s ’15-point programme’ for the development of minorities was being implemented in the district and how many people have been benefitted from it. The programme includes components such as making integrated child development scheme, school education and scholarships available to children from minority communities and preventing incidents of communal violence.

He inquired about the implementation of the Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram scheme, which seeks to provide better socio-economic and infrastructure facilities for the minority community people.

Kurian also asked the representatives of minority communities to take the schemes to the members of their communities. He asked officials to identify core areas to be developed for such people

Title: Mobile ration shops to cater to tribal settlements
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Until now, tribal people in 27 settlements in Kuttichal panchayat had to travel for around 20km to buy ration items from the four ration shops located in Kuttichal Junction. But, they will not have to go through this ordeal anymore, thanks to the effective intervention of the civil supplies department.

On Thursday, civil supplies minister P Thilothaman conducted district-level inauguration of mobile ration shops for marginalized and people living in secluded forest areas.

The inauguration was held at Mannamkonam at Kottoor in Kattakada. K S Sabarinadhan, MLA, presided over the function. Kuttichal panchayat president G Manikantan, Vellanad block panchayat president S S Ajithakumari, civil supplies secretary P Venugopal and district supply officer Jalaja G S Rani among others attended the event. Heads of tribal settlements were honoured at the function.

The minister said that all eligible tribal persons will get ration. “In addition to mobile ration shops, possibility of setting up a ration shop at Podiyam in Kottoor will be explored,” the minister said. He also promised to take steps to renovate the Kottoor–Mannamkonam Road.

District supply officer Jalaja G S Rani said that the project was rolled out in Kuttichal considering the number of tribal people in the area.

“There are around 495 tribal families spread out in 27 settlements in the area. Often, they come together as a group to buy ration items from around four ration shops located at Kottoor Junction. Some have to spend around Rs 300 for the transportation alone. While the Anthyodaya ration cards make them eligible for 30kg rice and 5kg wheat free of cost, many of them skip visiting ration shops due to the tedious travel,” said Rani.

The district supply officer said that tribal promoters and rationing inspectors will fix a day for bringing the ration items in a tipper trucks to the areas. “The mobile ration shop will visit two-three areas in the locality so that people of various settlements can purchase items,” the officer said.

Title: Trade tax employee reads out satire ‘targeting’ PM, SP chief at function; suspended on disciplinary grounds
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Bareilly: Reading out a satire at a function organised to celebrate the trade tax department’s foundation day on Wednesday didn’t do any good to an employee of the department but instead landed him in trouble.

In his self-written satire, Prem Singh, 45, allegedly first targeted Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav and then took a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, which left officials red-faced.

Soon after, officials asked him to leave the podium and he was sent on leave on disciplinary grounds. On Thursday, the headquarters issued his suspension orders.

A function was organised at the zonal office of the trade tax department where the employee recited the couplet.

Additional commissioner of trade tax Mukti Nath Verma said that when principal assistant Prem Singh’s turn came, he started reciting some couplets on a lighter note but it was completely out of reference.

He added, “His choice of words were highly inappropriate and we immediately asked him to stop reciting the poem and leave the podium.”

Traders were also in attendance at the function and they opposed to the employee’s poem. They demanded strict action against him for using objectionable words for the PM.

Notably, Singh also holds the post of district unit general secretary of UP Ministerial Staff Association and according to sources he was appointed on compensatory ground after his father’s demise.

A senior official on condition of anonymity said, “Since he is not a highly educated person and didn’t join the department through any competitive exam, he is not aware of certain things.”

Meanwhile, on Thursday BJP workers reached the trade tax office and demanded the sacking of the employee. Additional commissioner told TOI, “We informed the headquarters in the morning about the incident and by the evening we received his suspension orders.”

Title: TNAU launches timber contract farming programme
Content:
This story is from February 28, 2020

Coimbatore: The Forest College and Research Institute of Tamil Nadu Agricultural University at Mettupalayam launched timber contract farming programme with a Madurai-based timber company at the fourth annual workshop of the Consortium of Industrial Agro forestry (CIAF) on Thursday.Addressing the gathering at the event, TNAU vice-chancellor N Kumar said the Consortium of Industrial Agro forestry (CIAF) has enabled creation of 12 decentralized nurseries with a production capacity of 18 million plants per annum, expansion of area under industrial agro forestry to the tune of 5,000-6,000 acres per year, creation of a link between skilled manpower and other stakeholders for planting, felling, transportation and marketing of wood, value addition of wood based wastes, price supportive system and insurance cover.
